job.jobDescription:
The Staff Accountant is responsible for assisting in the month-end close and financial reporting process for the Ardent Information Technology department. Other accounting duties may be assigned by the IT Controller or the AVP, Budget & Planning.

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Assist in month-end close process of the Corporate Office and Corporate consolidations.
  • Prepare, review and analyze various journal entries for accuracy and reasonableness.
  • Prepare and distribute monthly intercompany allocations.
  • Reconcile corporate balance sheet accounts and perform analytical reviews of monthly activity.
  • Field questions from the hospitals' accounting personnel and research accounting issues.
  • Assist in the preparation of corporate schedules for annual audit performed by external auditors.
  • Review AP invoices and process through ImageNow.
  • Maintain ImageNow workflow processes for Corporate Office.
  • Maintain AP Vendor Master in Lawson module.
  • Fixed Assets
  • Unclaimed Property
  • Perform other duties and special projects as assigned.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

  • Ability to provide accurate and efficient service under the stress of constant deadlines.
  • Knowledge of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles.
  • Ability to work on different projects at one time.
  • Ability to work and interact with departments throughout the Company.
  • Ability to work independently.
  • Exceptional written and verbal skills.
  • Exceptional problem solving abilities.
  • Exceptional organizational skills.
  • Detail oriented.
  • Skill in the use of personal computers an d related software applications.


Qualifications:

Education and Work Experience:

  • Bachelor's Degree in Accounting or Finance required.
  • 2-5 years of accounting experience required; healthcare and corporate office experience preferred.

Additional Requirements:

  • Excel experience - intermediate to advanced
  • Lawson Financial Accounting and ImageNow experience a plus but not required

Admin Assistant II, Corp Compliance

Job Summary:

This position will be an integral part of achieving the objectives of BSA's Compliance Program. Position provides clerical support to the Director of Corporate Compliance and the Compliance Department staff. Transcribe notes from various project meetings. May be expected to attend meetings on occasion to take minutes. Make arrangements for meetings. This may include room reservations, refreshments, audiovisual equipment, etc. Maintain department files, binders, records, logs, etc. Identify needs for additional record keeping and establishes the same. Type confidential letters, memoranda and other forms, reports and correspondence of a routine and non-routine nature for Director. Make recommendations, revisions, or corrections as needed, and completes assignments in a timely manner.

Experience PREFERRED:

Two to three years job related experience preferred.

High tolerance for stressful situation preferred, flexibility, self-motivation

Education/Training PREFERRED:

High School Diploma or GED

Two years college majoring in secretarial sciences or successful completion of specialized training from a secretarial or business school preferred.

Skills & Abilities PREFERRED:

- Fluency in English language to function in job environment appropriately required

- Must exhibit desire to exemplify the BSA culture, including the BSA Mission, Vision and the BSA Way

- Good interpersonal and customer service skills

- Good organizational and follow-through skills

- Ability to multi-task constantly and tolerate interruptions

- Must display good communication (written, verbal, and phone), strong organizational and follow through skills.

- Demonstrate knowledge in the use of personal computers, word processing and spreadsheets.

- Strong organizational and planning skills.

- Personal computer skills with emphasis on Microsoft Word, Excel and Access data base program.

- Must handle confidential information on a regular basis and communicate diplomatically to maintain confidentiality.

- Utilize advanced word processing and specialized computer applications.

Schedule Details:
- Full-time

- Monday - Friday

- 8:00am 5:00pm

job.jobTitle: Women's Health Center ~ Service Line Administrator
job.jobDescription:
Service Line Administrator (SLA) - Women's and Children's Services

We are currently seeking a Women's and Children's Service Line Administrator for Hillcrest Medical Center in Tulsa, OK.
For more than 90 years, Hillcrest Medical Center (HMC) has provided an environment of hope, health and healing. The 691-bed hospital is among Oklahoma's most widely respected and acclaimed hospitals, offering extraordinary care and a multitude of services in many areas. The Peggy V. Helmerich Women's Center is also an integral part of the Medical Center from outpatient surgeries to preventative care.
The SLA will apply business development practices in the growing designated service line areas. He/she will create, implement and maintain a specific strategic plan while setting standards for outcomes and service expectations. The SLA is responsible for identifying industry movement, engaging Physicians and improving efficiency of resources used.
Responsibilities will include but are not limited to:
  • Overseeing the comprehensive service for Obstetrics, Gynecology, Labor & Delivery, Neonatal, Perinatal, and Pediatric services.
  • Collaborating with departmental leadership plans and develop annual budgets, establishing long-term and short-term goals for Women's & Children's services.
  • Ensuring that standards of quality are maintained to the highest degree.
  • The SLA will strategize and execute improvement initiatives and work closely with the partnered hospital's administrative team and physicians.
  • Focusing on community outreach, business development, and physician alignment as it relates to Women's & Children's services.
  • In addition to the business development functions, they will have administrative oversight of the nursing staff and nursing practice in the assigned department(s).

Requirements:

  • 4 year degree, Master's/Post Graduate Degree is a plus
  • Oklahoma licensure as a Registered Nurse preferred but not required
  • 3-5 years experience in a related/similar role

Compensation:

Competitive based on years experience and skill set

Advance Practice Provider - CV Surgery, Oklahoma Heart Institute

From comprehensive diagnostics to open heart surgery and cardiac rehabilitation, Oklahoma Heart Institute combines nationally recognized cardiovascular physicians with the region's most advanced technology.

Join the winning team and become part of the professionals who work for the recognized leader in Cardiac and Endocrinology care! We are looking for that special candidate that can step up and meet the high standards of patient care provided at Oklahoma Heart Institute. To be a successful candidate you must be a highly motivated person with impeccable customer service skills. Only apply if you can meet these standards.

This position will see patients in the office and hospital settings, as well as take call. Previous surgery, cardiology or vascular experience preferred.

Must be an Oklahoma licensed Advanced Practice Registered Nurse or Physician Assistant. Must have or be eligible for prescriptive authority.

Advance Practice Provider, Utica Park Clinic

Utica Park Clinic is the physicians group of Hillcrest HealthCare System. With over 53 locations throughout northeastern Oklahoma, most patients enjoy the convenience of a location that is close to home. UPC patients have consistently given top ratings (98% patient satisfaction scores) for the quality of care they receive. When choosing a healthcare provider, you can be confident that you'll find a good match at Utica Park Clinic.

Qualified candidate will perform usual and customary duties of an Advanced Practice Provider (APP), i.e., taking patient history, performing physical exams, diagnosing, monitoring care, and counseling patients under the direct supervision of the designated physician at UPC. These services may be provided in a variety of settings.

Must be an Oklahoma licensed Advanced Practice Registered Nurse or Physician Assistant. Must have or be eligible for prescriptive authority.

job.jobTitle: Out Patient Family Nurse Practitioner in Beautiful Albuquerq
job.jobDescription:
NURSE PRACTITIONER - PRIMARY CARE - FULL TIME - LOVELACE Westside, South Valley & Northside Clinics
Lovelace Medical Group - Family Medicine is seeking a Full time Nurse Practitioner.
Lovelace Medical Group is a patient centered multi-specialty group practice in Albuquerque, NM. Our providers are committed to quality and the delivery of compassionate care and we work closely with our hospitals to benefit patients through better coordination of care, improved communication between facilities and providers, and improved patient flow through our integrated health system.

We are seeking Family Nurse Practitioners and Geriatric Nurse Practitioners to join our group as employed providers. With a focus on evidence based medicine and quality of life for our patients, providers and staff we provide the very best care for our community in 3 outpatient locations in Albuquerque.

Our Advanced Practice Professionals have an assigned MA and 3 rooms from which to practice. When on call, all calls are screened through a triage service and call is shared among the providers at their location.

We offer a Nationally competitive salary and benefits combined with a generous signing bonus and up to $10K in relocation assistance. Our Nurse Practitioners also enjoy 30 days of vacation, 5 days of CME time and $3K in CME funds.
Call or e-mail Victor Jensen, Physician recruiter at 505-503-3364 / Victor.jensen@lovelace.com

Advance Practice Provider, Oklahoma Heart Institute

From comprehensive diagnostics to open heart surgery and cardiac rehabilitation, Oklahoma Heart Institute combines nationally recognized cardiovascular physicians with the region's most advanced technology.

Qualified candidate will perform usual and customary duties of an Advanced Practice Provider (APP), i.e., taking patient history, performing physical exams, diagnosing, monitoring care, and counseling patients under the direct supervision of the designated physician at OHI. These services may be provided in a variety of settings.

Must be an Oklahoma licensed Advanced Practice Registered Nurse or Physician Assistant. Must have or be eligible for prescriptive authority.

job.jobTitle: Breast & Melanoma Surgery Physician Assistant / Nurse Practi
job.jobDescription:
PHYSICIAN'S ASSISTANT / NURSE PRACTITIONER- FULL TIME - BREAST SURGERY & MELANOMA - ALBUQUERQUE, NM

***LOVELACE WOMEN'S HOSPITAL- BREAST CARE CLINIC***

Lovelace Medical Group is a patient centered multi-specialty group practice in Albuquerque, NM. Our providers are committed to quality and the delivery of compassionate care and we work closely with our hospitals to benefit patients through better coordination of care, improved communication between facilities and providers, and improved patient flow through our integrated health system.

We are seeking a PA or Nurse Practitioner for our highly successful and respected Breast Surgery Center. the Advanced Practice Professional will work alongside Breast Surgeons, Breast Radiologists Medical Oncologists and Breast Care Navigator. Providing care and education, performing surgical assisting, surgical post ops, and occasional rounding.

Responsibilities will include:

Participation in weekly multidisciplinary tumor board meetings

The NP or PA will follow their patients to the OR to assist the breast surgeon with all surgeries. The clinic schedule depends on O.R. days for each NP/PA. Generally, clinic days will be from 8:30am 4:30/5:00pm Monday through Friday.
During O.R. days the NP/PA assisting the breast surgeon, will start at 7:30am which is our first surgery case of the day. If one NP/PA is in the O.R. the other NP/PA will be seeing patients in clinic. They will also rotate in the Call Schedule.

Lovelace Health System is committed to offering high quality health care services for our patients and the community. Our hospitals and facilities are consistently earning local and national recognition for meeting or exceeding quality measures.

HOSPITALIST NURSE PRACTITIONERS - FULL TIME
LOVELACE HEALTH SYSTEM HOSPITALS
Lovelace Medical Group is seeking Full time Nurse Practitioners and PA's to be Hospitalists - DAY AND NIGHT Shift opportunities available.
12 Hr Shifts - 7 Days on 7 Days off - 7a - 7p OR 7p to 7a

The Lovelace Health System, a 6-hospital system serving the greater Albuquerque, New Mexico metropolitan area of over 450,000, is building a hospitalist group to service Four hospitals in the city.

We are seeking Nurse Practioners who have experience working in an all inpatient setting as a Hospitalist and enjoy it . Our hospitalists will be dedicated to working at one of the four facilities within our system, performing standard internal medicine/hospitalist duties, with some basic critical care procedures an d offering consults on a variety of cases. The schedule is 7 days on and 7 days off, equaling a minimum of 182 shifts per year , and there are opportunities for part-time positions as well . The Census target is 16-18 patients per shift .

The hospitalist service will have physician leads, project coordinators and a practice manager to oversee day to day hospital administrative duties. The compensation model will provide TOP TIER salaries. Day and night shifts are available. Nocturnist will be compensated at a higher level, but all positions offer very generous salaries and benefits.

Albuquerque is a great place to live; with the Rio Grande River and the Sandia Mountains in town, this city is a natural choice for outdoor enthusiasts. The high altitude and low humidity of Albuquerque provide about 300 days of sunshine per year to hike, bike, hunt, fish , ski and BBQ all year 'round.

There are good public, private and parochial schools in Albuquerque. The cost of living is very moderate. The city offers museums, entertainment, good shopping, fine dining, including some of the best Southwestern Cuisine anywhere.

Here's a link to more information about Albuquerque www.itsatrip.org

If you or someone you know may be interested in learning more about this opportunity, please forward your CV to or contact:


We offer a Nationally competitive salary and benefits combined with a generous signing bonus and up to $10K in relocation assistance. Our Nurse Practitioners also enjoy $3K in CME funds.
Call or e-mail Victor Jensen, Physician recruiter at 505-503-3364 / Victor.jensen@lovelace.com

The PACS/Imaging Systems Analyst will implement, modify, maintain and support medical imaging systems and imaging department management systems. Primary duties include:

- Configure applications and systems to meet objectives set by department and physician leadership.

- Coordinate support efforts among and between end users, physicians, vendors and internal I/T teams.

- Manage projects to improve system performance, end user experience, system functionality and stability.

- Participate as an Imaging Systems subject matter expert on cross-disciplinary project teams.

- Configure, support and maintain associated computer hardware and infrastructure.

- Monitor system performance and take corrective actions to prevent future problems.

- Research and recommend solutions to enhance the functionality and efficiency of supported applications.

- Learn and apply departmental standard tools and processes for project, time, problem tracking.

Skills

- Excellent written and oral communications skills.

- Able to organize and prioritize multiple projects.

- Able to work independently with good judgment and minimal oversight.

- Able to establish and maintain strong working relationships with diverse team members and customers.

- Able to learn quickly and apply prior knowledge to new situations.

Experience and education

- Bachelor's degree, preferably in Computer Science or related technology field.

- 2 4 years experience supporting PACS, CVPACS or other medical imaging systems.

- Working knowledge of hospital imaging department processes and workflow.

- Working knowledge of PC and server hardware, networking, storage technology and imaging modalities.

- Working knowledge of Windows operating systems and Office tools.

Population Health QualityAnalyst, Utica Park Clinic

Utica Park Clinic is the physicians group of Hillcrest HealthCare System. With over 53 locations throughout northeastern Oklahoma, most patients enjoy the convenience of a location that is close to home. UPC patients have consistently given top ratings (98% patient satisfaction scores) for the quality of care they receive. When choosing a healthcare provider, you can be confident that you'll find a good match at Utica Park Clinic.

Individuals within this job classification will provide technical and analytical support to the Population Health activities of Utica Park Clinic and to Hillcrest Health System. This support includes the production of reports used for strategic planning, clinical measurement reporting, provider quality measures, payer activity and measures, Ad hoc reporting, regulatory reporting and patient satisfaction reporting.

Bachelor Degree in a healthcare field and/or Health/Finance Information Management preferred. Three years experience as a database analyst for a healthcare related organization preferred.

Position is located 1145 S. Utica Avenue.

The Sr. Financial Analyst is responsible for the preparation and analytical support to Executive management, middle management, and accounting for both Accounting and Financial Operations.

Preparation of the data components and analysis to support month service line profiles, state and other outside reporting agency requirements.

Providing data for the preparation of complex financial analyses for business plans that support new and expanded services and facility and equipment acquisitions (CER).

Hospital budgeting and forecasting.

Audit support and other financial, process improvement and operating analytics as needed.

May be responsible for recommending strategic alternatives and developing operational plans.

This position also provides accurate and useful reports about potential business opportunities and remains current on data sources and analysis tools.

Adheres to all Hillcrest Healthcare Systems policies, procedures, and standards, within budgetary specifications, including time management, supply management, productivity, and accuracy of practice.

Promotes individual professional growth and development by meeting requirements for mandatory/continuing education, skills competency, supports department-based goals which contribute to the success of the organization; serves as preceptor, mentor, and resource to less experienced staff.

Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Economics, or Finance; MBA desired; Minimum of 3 years of accounting or finance experience

Unit Summary:

Environmental Services (EVS) is a vital part of BSA in maintaining a sterile environment for patients. Each day EVS conducts an average of 300 routine cleans (this includes patient rooms, office areas, etc.) and 100 checkouts (which are rooms vacated by discharged patients). Each Area Tech is held accountable for each job they perform including response time, duration of job, and are also required to maintain a 90% or above on inspections conducted by the supervisor.

Responsibilities:
The Area Tech I performs general cleaning duties in areas such as patient rooms, public areas, restrooms, offices and clinical areas.

Qualifications:
- Good organizational and follow-through skills
- Excellent customer services skills
- Attention to detail
- Ability to multi-task constantly and tolerate interruptions
- Ability to write legibly
- Make quick, accurate decisions and function calmly under stressful situations
- Ability to be on your feet for long periods of time
- Must be able to read, write, and speak English fluently

Schedule Details:

- Part-time
- Tuesday - Saturday (subject to change)

- 2nd Shift - Evenings

- 4:00 P.M. - 9:00 P.M.
- Some weekends and/or holidays may be required

Unit Description:

Our Bio-Med department provides service in-house and to our clinics and surgery centers. We have approximately 10,000 pieces of equipment that we service. The bio-med department has a staff of 12 which includes the manager.

Job Summary:

Transport and set up materials for installation. Provide basic troubleshooting of systems and identify problems. Seek guidance as necessary to find solutions. Coordinates repair parts orders through Biomedical Engineering Manager. Assist in project installations as assigned. Complete projects within established timelines with little supervision. Utilize specialized tools and test equipment. Read and interpret blueprints, diagrams, submittals and product manuals to properly program and verify new systems. Feeding cables through access holes, roof spaces and cavity walls to reach fixture outlets; then position and terminate cables, wires and strapping. Bio-Med closets need to be kept tidy and all pulls need to have cable management. Evaluate, diagnose and troubleshoot systems equipment that requires servicing. Communicate systems performance to customer. Termination and certify network cable. Pull low voltage cable. Perform other duties as assigned. Maintain documentation to satisfy regulatory requirements and improve quality of service.

Education/Licenses and Certifications:

High School Diploma or GED

Qualifications/Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:

1-2 years of experience in puling and termination of network and low voltage cable.

Satellite experience a plus

Position requires fluency in English language to function in job environment appropriately

Must exhibit desire to exemplify the BSA culture, including the BSA Mission, Vision and the BSA Way

Good interpersonal and customer service skills

Good organizational and follow-through skills

Ability to multi-task constantly and tolerate interruptions

Ability to read and interpret schematics and blueprints

Effectively communicates, both verbally and in writing to patients and staff

Schedule Details:

Status: Full Time

Days: Monday Friday and occasional weekends and holidays as required

Hours: 8:00 AM 5:00 PM and occasional evenings as required

Work Schedule: 8.00

Shift: 1st Day

This position is accountable for carrying out specific cardiovascular research studies under the supervision of the Coordinator, CV Research. The incumbent ensures projects are carried out and properly monitored for progress and compliance with funding agency rules and other regulatory bodies.

Position Reports to: CV Research Coordinator/ CV Administrative Director

Care Partner - Utica Park Clinic

Utica Park Clinic is the physicians group of Hillcrest HealthCare System. With over 53 locations throughout northeastern Oklahoma, most patients enjoy the convenience of a location that is close to home. UPC patients have consistently given top ratings (98% patient satisfaction scores) for the quality of care they receive. When choosing a healthcare provider, you can be confident that you'll find a good match at Utica Park Clinic.

The Care Partner position contributes to the work for the Quality Improvement Team at Utica Park Clinic. Care partner responsibilities include telephonic outreach to patients with existing gaps in care, scheduling appointments to fulfill gaps in care, communication with medical staff regarding urgent needs or new tasks, and contributing to best practice for care partner staff and other associated tasks.

An ideal candidate will have leadership qualities with a positive attitude. Effective and timely communication is expected in all areas including interpersonal, telephonic and electronic communication. Familiarity and competency in Microsoft Excel, electronic health records and web based platforms are also required skills.

A high school diploma is required. Experience in health care, medical office or customer service are preferred but not required.

Position is located at 1145 S. Utica Avenue.

Lovelace Shared Services: Organizational support departments for all Lovelace facilities including Coding, Finance, Health Information Management, Revenue Cycle, Marketing, and the Resource Team. We are dedicated to exceeding our customers' expectations in every way.

Lovelace Shared Services is now hiring a Care Concierge.

  • The Care Concierge/Sales Advisor facilitates the referral of unassigned ED patients to PCPs and specialists to promote follow up and continuity of care.
  • Track the referrals out and return business to each hospital and conducts discharge follow- up calls to ensure the continuity of care.
  • Communicates healthcare questions to clinical staff for appropriate assessment. Maintain/update/revise database of referral sources.
  • Keep referral source information up to date with assistance from Marketing.

Qualifications:

  • Minimum: Associate's degree - education may be substituted for relative experience. Healthcare background/ experience.
  • Desired: Comparable experience in customer relations, scheduling, etc
  • Ability to communicate effectively and maintain confidentiality, consistency and accuracy.
  • Able to work independently or as a team member.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills
  • Basic computer and typing skills.
  • Computer skills including managing databases, working with EMRs, Excel, Word, etc
  • One (1) year previous job related experience.
  • Medical Assistant Certification preferred

To manage individual's health needs through the full continuum of care while ensuring and facilitating the achievement of quality, clinical and financial outcomes. Assesses the ongoing needs of the patient/family and makes referrals to the appropriate community resources or other health care services. The case manager uses a clinical reasoning process for assessing, planning, implementing and evaluating the plan of care while ensuring that coordination of services are done in a timely manner. The case manager is held accountable to ensure that discharge planning is appropriate, timely and communicated to the patient, family and health care team. The case manager will perform utilization review in accordance with InterQual & Milliman and Robertson criteria, which will assure appropriate use of health care resources. The nurse case manager is expected to adhere to and abide by the rules and regulations set forth by the Oklahoma Board of Nursing.
*The Case Manager is responsible for monitoring and evaluating the plan of care for individual patients, providing professional clinical skills and expertise in the assessment, planning, implementation and coordination of necessary health care services. This position will adhere to all policies, procedures and regulations to ensure patient safety and compliance.*

Case Manager

PRN

Valid LSW for Hospital, and or valid NM RN License.

You're going to LOVE Lovelace!

About us: Lovelace Women's Hospital is New Mexico's first and only hospital dedicated to women's health. We are a highly accomplished 120 bed Women's Hospital nestled at the Foot Hills of the Sandia Mountains where it's sunny 360 days a year. Our patients choose Lovelace Women's Hospital because it's a name they trust. Whether we come alongside them for a birthing experience or breast cancer treatment, our primary goal is to offer them exceptional care. For eight consecutive years, Lovelace Women's Hospital has been recognized by Modern Healthcare Magazine as one of the best places to work in healthcare in the nation.

  • 2015 & 2016 Women's Choice Award for America's Best Breast Centers
  • 2016 Women's Choice Award for America's Best Hospitals for Patient Safety
  • Named to Modern Healthcare's 100 Best Places to Work since 2008
  • Zia Award from Quality New Mexico for Best in Class
Facility: Lovelace Women's Hospital is New Mexico's first and only hospital dedicated to women's health and features a 53-bed Level III Neonatal Intensive Care Unit, 24/7 emergency department, 16 labor and delivery rooms, 41-bed Mother-Baby unit, and a Maternal-Fetal Medicine program for high-risk pregnancies. Additionally, the hospital is home to a Natural Birthing Center, where women who wish to have a more natural delivery can deliver in a safe environment. Lovelace Women's Hospital offers a nationally accredited Breast Care Center, digital mammography, and cardiology. Lovelace Women's Hospital also has the latest minimally invasive robotic surgery system, offering surgery with less pain, shorter hospital stays and faster recovery for many gynecological and urological procedures.

Responsible for the implementation of the Case Management process. Monitors physician documentation and works closely with the medical staff for appropriateness of hospitalization. Identifies and evaluates quality of care, infection control, safety hazards, and potential risk management and utilization problems. Reports findings to Director for dissemination to appropriate department and/or committees. Responsible for initial utilization screen and ongoing utilization review through discharge. Identifies discharge and transition needs and is ultimately responsible for the coordination of discharge planning activities. Works collaboratively with interdisciplinary staff internal and external to the organization. Participates in quality improvement and evaluation process. Primary duty of performing office or non-manual work directly related to the management or general business operations of the employer or employer's customers. Primary duty includes the exercise of discretion and independent judgment regarding matters of significance.

Observe professional ethics in maintaining confidential information acquired regarding personal, financial, medical or employment of patients, families, and employees of SCH. Must follow and enforce accepted safety practices for patients and SCH. Must report hazards and initiate appropriate action. Must participate in safety instructional programs.

Communicates with the attending physicians as needed to ensure the medical record documentation represents the acuity of need of that patient to allow for appropriate reimbursement. Contacts attending physician to clarify patient's medical information and discharge plans and identify potential needs. Directly responsible for coordination of services indicated or required by the patient post-discharge, i.e., SNF, Nursing home, Home Health Care. Responsible for referring patients with special financial needs / requirements to the appropriate finance personnel.

The above statements reflect the general duties considered necessary to describe the essential functions of this position as identified, and shall not be considered as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be inherent in the position.
Education: Graduate of an approved school of nursing. BSN encouraged

Experience: Minimum of 5 years of Nursing. Case Management experience preferred.

Licenses/Certificates: Oklahoma RN

The Cashier Specialist is responsible for the following functions within the Physicians Billing Office:

  1. Prepares deposit daily.

  2. Verifies electronic payment report matches what the bank has received and then follows the process to have files posted.

  3. Prints out all insurance eob's from websites and electronic files that were unable to posted electronically (edits) to the system and prepare these documents to be manually posted..

  4. Reviews each electronic files edit list according to the process and work accordingly.

  5. Sorts mail received from lockbox/inter-office mail and distributes/works accordingly.

  6. Updates lockbox reconciliation and credit card report daily and provides via email to appropriate staff by deadlines..

  7. Reviews and indexes EDM items daily.

  8. Maintains lockbox batches received daily and files them.

  9. Other duties as assigned.

Under the supervision of the Cardiologist, Radiologist or Electrophysiologist, performs all routine diagnostic and therapeutic catheterization procedures. Provides patient care for a population base of all ages including adolescence, adult and geriatrics. Assures the equipment is functioning properly. Assists coworkers and physicians in performing difficult and complex catheterization procedures by monitoring the patient's vital signs, interpreting patient status information, performing duties as a scrub assistant, and assisting cath team members in retrieving supplies, recording patient information, and operating equipment. Provides performance improvement opportunities through team CQI processes. Maintains a sterile, clean, environment. Educates patients, family members, and cath team. Processes results, archives images, and stocks inventory.

Graduate of an accredited school of cardiovascular technology or degree or certification in an allied health field.

2 years CVT or Critical Care experience preferred

Current Licensure in one of the following, ARRT (Association of registered radiology technologist), RCIS (Registered Cardiovascular Invasive Specialist), RCES (Registered cardiovascular Electrophysiology Specialist), or Current Oklahoma RN license., BLS Basic Life Support for Healthcare Provider; If ACLS/ PALS certified upon hire, must maintain, otherwise, obtain certification within 6 months of employment and maintain.

Hillcrest Medical Center Child Development Center is seeking a Certified Childcare Professional, who is energetic, organized, typically happy and smiling, caring, able to multi-task and uses good judgment. Reporting to the Child Development Center Manager, the Certified Childcare Professional will be dedicated to providing outstanding care for the children of HMC employees. The age group will be mixed from 2 months to 4 years. The hours are usually 1:00 PM 8:00 PM.

Responsibilities:

Assume responsibility of children as teacher's shift end

Prepare center for next operational day

Lunch relief for Infant room teachers

Complete daily charts and reports

Engage in required health and safety procedures to reduce the spread of germs and ensure the safety of the children

Maintain an open, friendly and cooperative relationship with each child and each child's family

Provide a learning environment for the children that is warm, supporting and comforting

Maintain a positive and collaborative attitude

Cooperate successfully as a team

Requirements:

High school or GED, and obtained the qualifications at Level III or higher of the DHS Professional Development Ladder

3 years professional childcare experience

Minimum of a CDA (Child Development Associate Credential) or CCP (Certified Childcare Professional)

Entry Level Child Care Training Certificate

Food Handler Permit

Excellent verbal communication and organizational skills

Ability to multi-task and provide care for a group of eight children in a mixed age setting

Possess the skills to perform the position responsibilities

Meet the background investigation requirements per Oklahoma State Licensing Standards

Work with children without physical, psychological or emotional punishment, mistreatment, or abuse

Individualize the care and learning opportunities to meet each child's needs based upon the child's age and abilities, including reviewing the information provided by the parent while respecting confidentiality

Oklahoma Professional Development Ladder: Maintain a current OPDL certificate per State Licensing Standards

Local candidates preferred; no relocation assistance available for this position

Hillcrest Hospital in Cushing, OK is looking for a Chef/Kitchen Supervisor to join our growing team! We are looking for an experienced, reliable and hardworking individual who is passionate about food. Candidates should possess strong work ethic, leadership skills and enjoy organizing and catering special events. Experience with food purchasing and preparing is a must! Does this sound like you? Then we want to hear from you!

Duties/Tasks Include:

Creates exciting new food and menu items that appeal to patients, employees and guests.

Assists the department manager with food preparation and production including:

o Ensuring that all food and products are consistently prepared and served according to the hospital's recipes, portioning, cooking and serving standards.

o Stocking and maintaining sufficient levels of food products at line stations to assure a smooth and efficient delivery.

o Preparing items for broiling, grilling, frying, sauting or other cooking methods by portioning, battering, breading, seasoning and/or marinating.

o Consistently complying with the hospital's standard portion sizes, cooking methods, quality standards and kitchen rules, policies and procedures.

o Implementing appropriate portion control of food products prior to cooking according to recipe specifications.

o Handling, storing and rotating all products properly.

o Following proper plate presentation and garnish set up for all dishes.

Provides assistance with financial responsibilities including:

o Ensuring that all products are ordered according to predetermined product specifications and received in correct unit count and condition and deliveries are performed in accordance with the hospital's receiving policies and procedures.

o Controlling food cost and usage by following proper requisition of products from storage areas, product storage procedures, standard recipes and waste control procedures.

o Maintaining strict adherence to the departmental budget for food and supplies.

o Scheduling labor as required by anticipating business activity while ensuring that all positions are staffed when and as needed and labor cost objectives are met. Oversees the quality and compliance program including:

o Checking and maintaining proper food holding and refrigeration temperature control points.

o Maintaining a clean and sanitary work station area including tables, shelves, grills, broilers, fryers, pasta cookers, saut burners, convection oven, flat top range and refrigeration equipment.

o Ensuring that all equipment is kept clean and in excellent working condition through personal inspection and by following the hospital's preventative maintenance programs.

o Closing the kitchen properly by using the closing checklist for kitchen stations. Assists others in closing the kitchen.

o Attending all scheduled employee meetings and bringing suggestions for improvements.

Provides personnel management and supervision including:

o Assisting in training new kitchen employees in areas of cleanliness, sanitation and safe operations of kitchen equipment and utensils.

o Assisting with employee performance appraisals.

o Administering prompt and consistent corrective action for any and all violations of hospital policies, rules and procedures.

o Preparing required paperwork, including forms, reports and schedules in an organized and timely manner.

Displays a positive attitude, a warm smile and a genuine concern for others.

Creates a culture within the kitchen and cafeteria of competence, efficiency and compassion for others.

Assumes responsibility for leading the department in the absence of the manager.

Understands that there will be a whole bunch of other cool things to do that we haven't thought of yet, but will.

Unit Summary:

Within BSA hospital there is a high volume laboratory running thousands of specimens 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. Each Phlebotomist is responsible for each specimen they draw and is held accountable by daily/monthly reports regarding their workload and accuracy.

Responsibilities for High Volume Laboratory:
Provide phlebotomy service, clerical service, and courier service to several outside facilities as well as BSA Health System. Process patient data and physician orders in to the computer system and verify patient insurance.

Education/Certifications:
- High school diploma or GED required
- Graduation from a certified phlebotomy program or at least 6 months phlebotomy experience with proper documentation required

Qualifications:
- Previous data entry and clerical experience strongly preferred
- Effective communication skills including fluency in the English language (written & verbal)
- Good organizational skills required
- Great customer service
- Ability to multi-task
- Possess and maintain a valid TX driver's license
- Exhibits desire to exemplify the BSA culture, including the BSA Mission, Vision and the BSA Way
- Must be at least 21 years of age and have a good driving record for insurance purposes.

Schedule Details:

- Full Time
- 3rd Shift Nights

- 10:30 P.M. - 7:00 A.M.
- Monday Friday, alternating weekends and holidays

Office Manager, Utica Park Clinic

Utica Park Clinic is the physicians group of Hillcrest HealthCare System. With over 35 locations throughout northeastern Oklahoma, most patients enjoy the convenience of a location that is close to home. UPC patients have consistently given top ratings (98% patient satisfaction scores) for the quality of care they receive. When choosing a healthcare provider, you can be confident that you'll find a good match at Utica Park Clinic.

The Office Manager is responsible for supervising and participating in the daily operations of the practice. Specific duties include assigning/scheduling work duties, providing orientation/training to personnel, monitoring/overseeing work flow, and maintaining the operational budget. This individual also will be expected to identify and recommend improvements in work procedures. This position will adhere to all policies, procedures and regulations to ensure patient safety and compliance.

Prefer 3-5 years management experience for multi-physician practice. Must have high school diploma or GED.

Office Manager

Utica Park Clinic is the physicians group of Hillcrest HealthCare System. With over 35 locations throughout northeastern Oklahoma, most patients enjoy the convenience of a location that is close to home. UPC patients have consistently given top ratings (98% patient satisfaction scores) for the quality of care they receive. When choosing a healthcare provider, you can be confident that you'll find a good match at Utica Park Clinic.

We have a great opportunity at UPC within their Midtown UPC clinic. The ideal candidate is a highly motivated, forthright, and eager individual with the immediate ability to step in as Office Manager for the clinic. This position will report to the Administrative Director and service multiple physicians within the clinic.

Examples of responsibilities:

  • Patient scheduling and communication
  • Supervising and participating in the daily operations of the practice
  • Assigning/scheduling work duties, providing orientation/training to personnel as well as monitoring/overseeing work flow
  • Maintaining accurate medical records and overseeing proper billing
  • Communicating with the physicians regarding the operations and needs in the clinic
  • Contribute to monthly budget recommendations for the practice
  • Work with Administrative Director to monitor and reconcile expenditures as well as the organizational goals of all clinic specific activities and personnel to achieve the highest quality patient care as well as long term profitability
  • Resourceful with compliance to policies and procedures, task assignments and allocation of manpower, space and equipment to ensure effective patient care and provide conformance with efficient clinic service commitments at clinic specific site(s)

Requirements include:

  • Associates degree or above from an accredited university/college or program preferred, HS Diploma/GED required
  • 2-3 years of office management experience for a multi-physician practice preferred
  • Must be able to function at a high level of independence and autonomy

Unit Description:
Family medical clinic staffs physicians and nurses trained in family medicine. They provide diagnosis and treatment of basic medical conditions for all ages, including routine physicals, illnesses, and accidents. The clinic is open Monday Friday from 8am 5pm, closed on major holidays.

Job Summary:
Responsible for management of daily clinic operations, including building maintenance, patient flow, budget, accounts payable, supplies, staff supervision and customer satisfaction, and a wide variety of duties, as needed. Background in Medical Office Management and Supervision; Working knowledge Electronic Health Record system; Demonstrated leadership skills; financial management skills including budget development and reporting( Excel); demonstrated ability to lead staff in Customer Service; Ability to lead change

Licenses and Certifications:
Coding Training Preferred but not required

Qualifications/Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:

Preference will be given to individuals with previous similar clinic experience

Previous job experience in delivering exceptional customer service

Must exhibit desire to exemplify the BSA culture, including the BSA Mission, Vision and the BSA Way.

Good positive, customer focused interpersonal and business telephone skills

Position requires fluency and communication skills in English language to function in job environment appropriately

Strong communication skills include:

o Strong English verbal skills

o Ability to read and understand English language

o Strong interpersonal skills and ability to interact with customers and healthcare professionals at all levels

o Legible writing skills and penmanship in English language

Good organizational and follow-through skills

Demonstrates strong leadership skills

Must be able to work in a fast paced environment and adapt to rapidly changing situations

Must be able to quickly evaluate and prioritize requests of staff and physicians

Ability to deal with employees, patients, physicians and visitors in stressful situations

Must be well versed in HIPAA laws and keep patient documentation and information confidential

Ability to multi-task constantly and tolerate interruptions

Ability to function in an occasionally hostile environment with patients/customers who are ill or hurt

Must be willing to work as part of a cohesive medical team to care for patients and deliver exceptional customer service

Responsibilities include and not limited to managerial position that supports the ED revenue cycle, monitors and coordinates quality risk management activities as well as patient satisfaction excercises, patient rounding, discharge call back, employee rounding, maintaining/updating the Oklahoma State Trauma Registry Database. This position also assists with indicated educational needs of the department reflected in QRM monitoring. Assists in managing staffing productivity. Required to have a good working knowledge of current EMR system and computer knowledge, which includes, and not limited to excel, word, meditech, and outlook. Individual could be called upon to represent ED Director in any given funtion (meetings, staff meetings, providing training and etc).

Essential Functions

1. Daily ED census STATS: including patients admit IP/OBS, LWBS/AMA/Elopement/LWOTS, Transfer, SDS, and discharged home totals. Will report to Accounting Department and ED Director by determined time each day.

2. Maintain/Report weekly transfer log, providing location to and reason for transfer to accounting department and ED Director by determined time/day each week.

3. Will track and report via spreadsheet: All information gathered from above duties, ESI level breakdown, Throughput times, Core Measures, Hold Times/unit, and any other tracking requirements. Reporting monthly to Accounting Department and ED Director at determined date/time.

4. Identifies all patient cases that meet criteria for inclusion in the trauma registry database.

5. Reviews medical records in detail to obtain required elements needed for trauma registry reporting.

6. Reports and/or transmits hospital data in a timely and complete manner as required by Oklahoma Department of Health and Human Services (State Registry).

7. Ensure system is in place to monitor validity of data abstraction and entry.

8. Works in collaboration with the Director of Emergency Services, Emergency Medical Director and the Oklahoma State Trauma Registry Director to set standards for data entry, implements necessary procedures, and provide documentation for all registry related functions.

9. Consults with physicians or other clinical staff as needed for the assistance with acquiring trauma case reporting information. Identify all patient cases that meet criteria for inclusion in the trauma registry database.

Education: RN graduate of an accredited school of nursing. ADN required, BSN preferred.

Technical/Formal Training: Has completed or willing to complete Oklahoma State Trauma Registry Training. Must maintain CPR certification, preferably Basic Life Support for Healthcare Provider. ACLS and PALS must be obtained within 6 months of hire.

Knowledge: Must have advanced computer skills, including excel, word, and other systems needed to perform duties.

Experience: Prefer 3 years experience ER acute care hospital, with 1 year triage or critical care experience. Has experience in an ER setting and Trauma patients. Has QA experience and understanding of Core Measures, flow of an ER related to throughput, ESI levels.

Licensure: Must possess a current Oklahoma license as a Registered Nurse in good standing

Assistant Chief Nursing Officer

We are currently recruiting for an Assistant Chief Nursing Officer (ACNO) to join Hillcrest Medical Center in Tulsa, OK.

The ideal candidate will serve as a part of the administrative team and report directly to the CNO and ensure that patient care services are in compliance with nursing standards, federal and state regulations. As a member of the Hillcrest Medical Center's administrative team, the ACNO will support and facilitate an interdisciplinary team approach to the delivery of care. This includes creating a nursing environment in which collaboration is valued and excellence in clinical care, education, and research is promoted and achieved.

The selected ACNO will be responsible for:

  • Mentoring and guiding any and all direct reports
  • Monitoring and evaluating quality, patient satisfaction and employee satisfaction outcomes to implement strategies for improvement
  • Implementing change and establishing strong collaborative relationships with physicians
  • Analyzing financial data to ensure proper allocation of resources
  • Acting as interim CNO when needed

Education/Certifications Required:

  • Masters in Nursing or Hospital Administration
  • BLS (Basic Life Support)
  • Current OK RN Licensure

Experience Required:

  • 5 or more years of related experience required
  • 5 years of administrative/management experience in 200+ bed hospital

Compensation:

Attractive/Competitive package based on experience and skill set- relocation, sign-on bonus, salary and performance based compensation incentives.

Ardent Health Services is a nationwide provider of hospital and healthcare services which owns and operates 14 hospitals serving three major markets as well as owning physician practice organizations, diagnostic facilities and ambulatory surgery centers. With annual revenues in excess of $2 billion, we are an established organization that is growing.

We are currently recruiting for a Chief Nursing Officer (CNO) to join Lovelace Medical Center which is a part of Lovelace Health System in Albuquerque, NM. Lovelace Medical Center (LMC) is among New Mexico's most widely recognized and respected health care leaders. The Lovelace Medical Center campus includes Lovelace Medical Center and the Heart Hospital of New Mexico at Lovelace Medical Center. Situated in the heart of Albuquerque, LMC exceeds 11,000 admits and 41,000 Emergency Department visits each year. This 318-bed campus was recently named to Modern Healthcare's Best Places to Work list, and was recognized by Truven Health Analytics as one of the nation's Top 50 Cardiac Hospitals. In addition, LMC received the 2015 Midas Platinum+ Quality award. Lovelace Health System was also recently recognized as one of the Top 15 Health Systems by Truven Health Analytics.

We are searching for a CNO who is interested in joining a stable and growing company where you can make a lasting impact. Our new CNO will be a visionary who is inspired by a challenge and will put forth the effort to succeed. We are seeking a dynamic leader that understands the importance of strong employee relations; someone who provides a positive, healthy work environment, and facilitates organizational improvement through creative initiatives. The CNO at LMC must be a true leader in terms of advising and creating strategies of organizational lay out, nursing development and excellence, new cost-effective programs and productivity.

The Chief Nursing Officer will be responsible for the operational, financial, clinical and personnel activities of all assigned clinical services.

Primary responsibilities include:

  • Directing nursing services for the facility and working collaboratively with other care providers to meet patient care needs.
  • As a member of the executive team, participating in the development of and implementation of programs and services, including system-wide collaboration.
  • Establishing the vision and providing leadership in the delivery of optimal patient care and in the achievement of facility initiatives.
  • Working with the members of the management, ancillary and care provider team to assure operational effectiveness, clinical excellence, physician and employee engagement and patient satisfaction.

REQUIREMENTS

Education: BSN and master's degree required (MSN preferred, but will consider candidates with MHA or MBA).

Work Experience: Five (5) years of progressive experience in a hospital administration. A record of performance demonstrating innovative operations management resulting in improved health outcomes, employee engagement and controlled expenses.

Additional Requirements: Strong clinical nursing experience and a minimum of six (6) years of clinical experience in acute care are required. Strong physician and clinical relationship skills are essential. Previous experience in managing multiple areas of clinical and support operations also required.

Ardent is looking for Inpatient Coders! These positions can be located in Nashville TN, Tulsa OK, Albuquerque NM or Amarillo, TX. There are are also opportunities for remote Coders!

Ardent Health Services:

  • 3 health systems with 14 hospitals
  • 2,194 licensed beds
  • 12,000 employees
  • 3 physician groups with 270 employed physicians

The Inpatient Coder will bring to the table proven experience in all aspects of hospital coding, which includes the technical abilities to perform facility coding for hospital inpatient services. To achieve appropriate and timely reimbursement and data integrity the IP Coder must ensure accurate and compliant application of correct coding principles for hospital services. and participate in any coding-related projects.

The IP Coder is responsible for

  • Assigning ICD-9-CM and/or ICD-10 diagnosis and procedure codes and present on admission (POA) indicators; HCPCS/CPT codes; and modifiers.
  • Maintains at least a 97% accuracy rate.
  • Maintains average to high productivity based on Ardent Shared Coding Productivity Standards.
  • Abstracting of facility required data in McKesson Star.
  • Working applicable McKesson Pre-Bill Edits and Receivable Work Station (RWS) requests.
  • Follow up on missing documentation, including the generation of appropriate queries, as needed.
  • Communication of issues to the MS-DRG, APC Manager and/or Director Shared Coding Services, as appropriate.
  • Thorough understanding of ICD-9-CM/ICD-10 Official Coding Guidelines for Coding and Reporting and AHA Coding Clinic.
  • Thorough understanding of HCPCS/CPT coding systems and CPT Assistant and Coding Clinic for HCPCS guidelines.
  • Thorough understanding of Medicare Inpatient Prospective Payment System (IPPS), Medicare Severity-Diagnosis Related Groups (MS-DRGs).
  • Thorough understanding of Medicare Outpatient Prospective Payment System (OPPS), Ambulatory Payment Classification (APC).
  • Understanding of coding resources and tools, including 3M 360 Encompass.
  • Acknowledgement of receipt and review of updated Ardent coding policies.
  • Maintains continuing education (CE) requirements per Ardent policy.

Education :

  • Successful completion of a Medical Terminology, Anatomy and Physiology, and Pharmacology course
  • Successful completion of an ICD-9-CM and HCPCS/CPT coding class
  • Coding/HIM certification
Experience & Requirements :

  • 3 years coding/abstracting experience in hospital inpatient and outpatient coding. Advanced training in ICD-10-CM and PCS.
  • Coding credential though AHIMA or AAPC.
  • Computer and software skills, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, encoder/grouper
  • Strong written and verbal communications skills
  • Organizational skills
  • Leadership skills

The Contract Specialist is responsible for preparing, examining, analyzing, negotiating and revising contracts that involve the purchase or sale of goods or services such as equipment, materials, supplies, or products.

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Oversee the preparation and revision of contracts that involve the purchase of sale of goods and services.
  • Prepares and completes critical documentation for physician contracts, leases, and agreements between facilities; monitors and maintains all contracting issues.
  • Handle the acquisition, distribution, and store of equipment and supplies.
  • Dispose of unclaimed property.
  • Oversee proposal planning and administration of contracts.
  • Negotiate terms and conditions.
  • Prepare contract briefs and revisions summarizing contractual requirements and budgets.
  • Track authorizations and correspondence.
  • Maintain detailed and organized files.
  • Prepare contract change notices, monitor contractor performance, including the reporting and status of contractor and owner deliverables.
  • Maintain an audit file for each contract which will include original contract, all correspondence, changes/deviations, amendments, clarifications, payment schedules.
  • Prepare and disseminate information to appropriate employees regarding contract status, facilitate contractor meetings.
  • Ensure that contractor is in compliance with legal requirements, owner specifications and government regulations.
  • Perform closing activities as needed.
  • Track payments and deadlines.
  • Analyze and mitigate risk.
  • Provide contract summaries and ensure contract execution in accordance with company policy.

This position is located at 1145 S. Utica Avenue.

The Performance Improvement Coordinator will be responsible for managing and facilitating process improvement projects that deliver a measurable impact on quality, safety, efficiency, and patient satisfaction. In this capacity he/she will work closely with the clinical and administrative leadership to identify improvement priorities and goals, partnering to deliver improvements to clinical and operational processes. This position will also serve as an analyst in reviewing data, pulling reports and reporting as needed.

Preferred-Lean/Six Sigma Green Belt credentials or must obtain within one year of employment with addition of Black Belt credentials by end of year two (2). Experience with other process improvement methodologies strongly desired.

Ability to analyze and interpret data, communicate effectively, function independently, and work in a high pace environment. Strong presentation skills. Ability to compile complex reports and possesses above average analysis and problem solving skills.

1-3 years performance improvement experience preferred.

Preferred Oklahoma Nursing license.

Individuals within this job classification are accountable for providing nursing care under the supervision of a registered nurse or licensed practical nurse. The Cross Trained Assistant must be able to demonstrate the knowledge and skills necessary to provide care appropriate to the age of the patients served on the assigned unit and must be able to demonstrate the knowledge and skills necessary to function as the unit secretary on a patient care area. This individual must demonstrate knowledge of the principles of growth and development over the life span and possess the ability to function in an assistive role to provide patient care. This individual must also understand the workings of the unit information flow and be able to facilitate this information for the most efficiency possible. The Cross Trained Assistant will be responsible for activities of patient care which involve activities of daily living and must be able to work as a unit secretary to a busy patient care unit. He/she is expected to adhere to and abide by the rules and regulations set forth by the Oklahoma Nursing Practice Act.

Nurse Aide experience preferred

High School Diploma or GED

Nurse Aide/Unit Secretary, Med/Surg, Hillcrest Hospital Claremore, FT 7a-7p, varied every other weekend.

At Hillcrest Hospital Claremore, we're proud to offer advanced services right here at home from our Peggy V. Helmerich Birthing Center, to outpatient surgeries and preventative care. And when you need emergency care, our 24/7 emergency physician staffed ER is right where you want it to be close by- to give you prompt medical treatment. The CNA/NA helps patients with activities of daily living; basic nursing care needs, and maintains a safe and clean environment under the direction and supervision of the Registered Nurse. Is responsible for manning the nursing station and performing clerical and receptionist duties.
Must have high school diploma or equivalent. Previous work experience as a nurse assistant or completion of a nursing assistant training program is required. Nursing Assistant certification is preferred, must be able to provide basic nursing care to patients of all ages: neonates to geriatric population. Demonstrates teamwork and self-direction. Hospital experience as a unit secretary and/or medical terminology knowledge preferred. Clean, well kept appearance. Demonstrates ability to perform technical skills outlined the job performance standards. Demonstrates teamwork and self-direction. Typing and computer skills preferred.

The Cross Trained Assistant performs clerical duties as well as CNA duties related to SDU under the direction of a registered nurse (RN) or LPN and the unit manager. He/she acts as the unit's receptionist, assigns patient to room on board, s nursing staff to patient arrival, pulls and prepares chart. Assists nursing staff by receiving patients at the desk, taking the patient to appropriate room, gives initial instruction, obtains vital signs, assists in transporting discharged patients and answers inquiries within the scope of practice. In addition, the CTA will order and monitor utilization of selected supplies: office, nutritional supplements, forms and retrieval chart backs. The CTA will also assist with stocking supplies that are needed in the unit as well as assist in keeping the nursing stations clean and organized.
Education:
Must possess a high school diploma or GED equivalent.
Technical/Formal Training:
Must obtain and maintain a current BLS certification. Oklahoma Certified Nursing Assistant or Patient Care Technician preferred.

Knowledge/Skill/Abilities:
Cognitive and interpersonal skills required to deliver intelligent, safe and effective directed patient care. Excellent communication skills both in person and via telephone. Working knowledge of computers and Microsoft Office Suite. Technical and interpersonal skills required to transcribe orders. Ability to use telecommunications equipment.

Experience:
Desirable characteristics include at least one year of experience as a Unit Secretary with or without nurse assistant or CNA experience.

This individual must also understand the workings of the unit information flow and be able to facilitate this information for the most efficiency possible. The Cross Trained Assistant will be responsible for activities of patient care which involve activities of daily living and must be able to work as a unit secretary to a busy patient care unit. He/she is expected to adhere to and abide by the rules and regulations set forth by the Oklahoma Nursing Practice Act.

Nurse Aide experience preferred

High School Diploma or GED

The Cross Trained Assistant performs clerical duties as well as CNA duties related to SDU under the direction of a registered nurse (RN) or LPN and the unit manager. He/she acts as the unit's receptionist, assigns patient to room on board, s nursing staff to patient arrival, pulls and prepares chart. Assists nursing staff by receiving patients at the desk, taking the patient to appropriate room, gives initial instruction, obtains vital signs, assists in transporting discharged patients and answers inquiries within the scope of practice. In addition, the CTA will order and monitor utilization of selected supplies: office, nutritional supplements, forms and retrieval chart backs. The CTA will also assist with stocking supplies that are needed in the unit as well as assist in keeping the nursing stations clean and organized.
Education:
Must possess a high school diploma or GED equivalent.
Technical/Formal Training:
Must obtain and maintain a current BLS certification. Oklahoma Certified Nursing Assistant or Patient Care Technician preferred.

Knowledge/Skill/Abilities:
Cognitive and interpersonal skills required to deliver intelligent, safe and effective directed patient care. Excellent communication skills both in person and via telephone. Working knowledge of computers and Microsoft Office Suite. Technical and interpersonal skills required to transcribe orders. Ability to use telecommunications equipment.

Experience:
Desirable characteristics include at least one year of experience as a Unit Secretary with or without nurse assistant or CNA experience.

The CTA performs unit secretary duties as well CNA duties for the Clinical Decision Unit under the direction of a registered nurse (RN/LPN) and/or the RN unit manager. He/she acts as the unit's receptionist, assigns patient to rooms, s nursing staff of patient arrival, enters physician's orders into computer, and prepares patient charts. Assists nursing staff by receiving patients at the desk, taking the patient to appropriate room, gives initial patient check in instructions, obtains vital signs, performs bed bath, linen changes, passing of meal trays and assists in transporting discharged patients all within the scope of practice. In addition, the unit secretary/CNA will order and monitor utilization of selected supplies: office, nutritional supplements, forms and retrieval chart backs. The candidate will perform duties with a customer service focus striving for service excellence.

1) Able to accurately take vital signs, perform finger stick glucometer checks using aseptic technique, provides daily linen changes and bed baths, passes meal trays and assists patient with tray set up when needed. Insures patient rooms are clean and tidy, empties trashes and removes dirty linens timely.
2) Functions as unit secretary for department, answers phones, enters orders timely into computer, greets patient and families with respect and courtesy.
3) Answers patient call lights in person within 2 minutes of patient call.
4) Notifies nurse of pertinent patient care needs, s nurse of unstable vital signs or patient's appearing in distress.
5) Assists with hourly rounding of patients and quickly responds to patient needs.
6) Exemplifies excellent customer service skills in communicating with patients, caregivers, nurses and physicians. Builds strong working relationships with peers and other departments to create a positive work environment.
7) The CTA will demonstrate knowledge of development and norms for adolescent, adult and geriatric customers. They will carry out the plan of care as directed by the nurse.
8) The unit clerk must possess proficient computer skills with few errors on order entry.

Education:
High School Diploma or equivalent

Technical/Formal Training:
Must obtain and maintain a current BLS certification. Oklahoma Certified Nursing Assistant or Patient care Technician preferred.

Knowledge/Skill/Abilities:
Has knowledge of basic computer skills. Must exhibit proficiency in oral communication skills. Must be emotionally mature and able to function effectively under stress. Must be able to perform basic nurse aide duties. Must be able to follow directions and perform work according to department standards under the supervision of an RN/LPN.

Experience:
Minimum 1 year health care experience as a nurse aide required. Desirable characteristics include at least one year of experience as a Unit Secretary or Administrative Assistant.

The Cross Trained Assistant performs clerical duties as well as Nurse Aide duties related to the Postpartum Unit under the direction of a registered nurse (RN) and the unit manager. He/she acts as the unit's receptionist, assigns patient to room on board, s nursing staff to patient arrival, pulls chart or prepares chart. Assists nursing staff by receiving patients at the desk, taking the patient to appropriate room, gives initial instruction, obtains vital signs, assists in transporting discharged patients and answers inquiries within the scope of practice. In addition, the CTA will order and monitor utilization of selected supplies: office, nutritional supplements, forms and retrieval chart backs.

Maintains professional working relationship with co-workers, physicians and customers. Listens attentively as evidenced by appropriate response. Maintains positive attitude. Promotes teamwork. Willing to go the extra mile. Speaks clearly and has a pleasant tone of voice. Displays positive non-verbal communication skills. Demonstrates positive customer relations.
Wears identification badge while on duty. Complies with the hospital and departmental dress code and maintains a professional image at all times.
Exhibits consistent and appropriate telephone courtesy by answering phones in a timely manner and responding in a friendly fashion. Demonstrates positive telephone skills by not leaving phone unattended.
Prepares paperwork and submits for processing in an organized and timely manner. Prepares, organizes and maintains patient chart.
Collaborates with the nurse to expedite unit schedules/procedures.
Transmits all patient orders in a timely manner and ensures orders are processed.
Limits overhead paging to only urgent pages. Assesses a situation, considers alternatives and chooses the appropriate course of action with few errors.
Collaborates with Housekeeping to assure rooms are turned over in a timely manner.
Provides patient privacy, respect and dignity during patient/visitor encounters.
Demonstrates protection of patient rights as evidenced by compliance with policies related to informed consent, DNR, ethical issues and resolution of patient complaints.
Reports to work on time with no more than 1 tardy per pay period. Works as scheduled. No identified pattern of absence with <5 per year. Attends 80% of scheduled departmental meetings.
Utilizes policy and procedure manuals, and other reference material to assure proper course of action.
Education:
Must possess a high school diploma or GED equivalent.

Technical/Formal Training:
Must obtain and maintain a current BLS certification.

Knowledge/Skill/Abilities:
Must exhibit proficiency in patient and oral communication skills. Must be emotionally mature and able to function effectively under stress.

Experience:
Desirable characteristics include at least one year of experience as a Unit Secretary with or without nurse assistant or nurse aide experience.

Licensure:
Oklahoma Certified Nursing Assistant or Patient Care Technician preferred.

Hillcrest Hospital Henryetta, located in Henryetta, OK, is a premier provider of health care services, delivered with compassion for patients and their families, with respect for employees, physicians and other health professionals, with accountability for our fiscal and ethical performance and with responsibility for the communities we serve.

Individuals within this job classification are accountable for assessing, implementing, evaluating and documenting respiratory care in accordance with Hillcrest Henryetta standards and under the direction of the department Manager and Medical Director in order to deliver efficient, effective and quality respiratory care. The Respiratory Therapist must be able to demonstrate the knowledge and skills necessary to provide respiratory care appropriate to the age of the patients served on the assigned unit. This individual is responsible for the administration of oxygen, various treatment modalities, and ventilator management. He/she is expected to adhere to and abide by the rules and regulations set forth by the Oklahoma Respiratory Care Practice Act.

Unit Description:

The BSA Surgery department consists of 16-multi-purpose suites and 2-cystoscopy suites operated on a 24-hr basis with approximately 50-surgeons. The most frequent surgeries are: General Surgery, Orthopedic, Vascular, Urology, Cardiothoracic, Neurosurgery, ENT, Gynecology, Plastics, Robotics and Bariatric; 12,700 surgeries annually.

Job Summary:

Accountable to assist the RN and surgeon in preparing for surgical procedures, assist in surgical procedures, and prepare for the next case. The scrub technologist handles the instruments, supplies, and equipment necessary during the surgical procedure. He/she has an understanding of the procedure being performed and anticipates the needs of the surgeon. He/she has the necessary knowledge and ability to ensure quality patient care during the operative procedure and is constantly on vigil for maintenance of the sterile field.

Education/Certifications:

Current CST certification from NBSTSA, or eligible for Certification

CPR certified from the American Heart Association or the American Red Cross

Qualifications/Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:

Current TX LVN with prior recent experience working as a surgical tech in a hospital setting will be considered

Ability to rapidly evaluate and prioritize request of the healthcare team and physicians

Self motivated with a positive attitude; excellent teamwork

Ability to multi-task constantly and tolerate interruptions

Good organizational and follow-through skills

Exhibit good customer service skills; friendly

Good communication skills; able to communicate with patients, families, physicians and multiple healthcare team members

Schedule Details:

Status: Full Time

Hours: Varied

Days: Varied

Work Schedule: 8.00

Shift: 1st

On-call required; approximately 8 to 10 days per month with a 30-minute report time

Join the team at Lovelace Women's Hospital, voted 2nd Best Place to Work in the Nation by Modern Healthcare Magazine!

Lovelace Women's Hospital is New Mexico's first and only hospital dedicated to women's health and features a 53-bed Level III Neonatal Intensive Care Unit, 24/7 emergency department, 16 labor and delivery rooms, 41-bed Mother-Baby unit, a Maternal-Fetal Medicine program for high-risk pregnancies, and a Pediatric Observation Unit supervised 24/7 by pediatricians. For four years in a row, Lovelace Women's Hospital has been recognized by Modern Healthcare magazine as one of the best places to work in health care in the nation.

Duties:
Performs Computed Tomography imaging procedures. May provide clerical support to assigned department to include but not limited to maintaining records, answering phones and scheduling appointment. Adheres to policies, procedures and regulations to ensure compliance and patient safety.

1) Performs Computed Tomography imaging procedures. Adheres to policies, procedures and regulations to ensure compliance and patient safety
2) Administers contrast media accurately under direction of the Radiologist both manually and with pressure injector.
3) Assists with biopsy and drainage procedures in CT in conjunction with Interventional Department.
4) Provides clerical support to include but not limited to maintaining records, answering phones and scheduling appointments.
5) Maintains credentialing and/or licensure.
6) Participates and attends departmental meetings.
7) Takes ownership of assignments; other duties as assigned or requested.
8) Communicates and listens effectively with internal and external customers; effectively understands instructions and shares knowledge.
9) Cooperates and interacts with supervisors, peers, other departments, and all customer groups demonstrating our commitment to "service".
Minimum education: Associates Degree in Radiologic Sciences or equivalent. Desired education: Bachelor of Science Degree; Formal CT Education. Technical/Formal Training: CT

Knowledge/Skills/Abilities: Basic Computer skills; Proficient with pressure injectors; CT biopsy procedures; Cross sectional anatomy; Sterile techniques and patient monitoring. Radiation safety.

Experience: One (1) year experience as a Radiologic Technologist. Desired: One year experience as a CT Technologist.

Licensure: ARRT, Radiologic Technologist Certificate issued by State of NM, and CPR.

Under the direction of the Director of Registration along with Women's and Children's Services, the Customer Service Specialist performs clerical, secretarial duties related to the assigned unit. This position is accountable for obtaining high quality ultrasound images of the heart and vascular system in adolescence through the geriatric age group: 2D echo/Doppler studies, TEE and stress echo, carotid duplex imaging, arterial Doppler and duplex and venous imaging studies, and rotates 24 hour call responsibility with other staff members. Must be competent in Adult Echocardiography and Vascular Imaging.

There is high daily public contact with patients, physicians, family members and other departmental staff. The incumbent must possess strong interpersonal and communication skills and must be self motivated; the ability to make decisions based upon the Hillcrest values in an independent working environment is essential to the successful performance of the job.

Preference for 3 to 5 years of experience in the performance of the above studies with preferable a formal education in ultrasound or cardiovascular technology. Registration in Adult Echocardiography and/or Vascular Technology through the ARDMS or CCI is required within 12 months of employment.
