Job Summary:
The DI Tech I operates radiology equipment to produce radiographic images of specified areas of the body and performs related technical x-ray procedures, in accordance with recommended radiation safety practices. Technologist will prepare exam rooms, equipment, supplies, and medications. The technologist will be expected to communicate effectively and professionally with patients, physicians, and intra- and inter-departmentally situations. Additional responsibilities as designated by Diagnostic Imaging leadership team.

Education/Certifications/Licensures:
- Current State of Texas MRT license
- Current ARRT License
- Current Basic Life Support Certification / CPR issued by American Heart Association

Qualifications:

- Ability to consistently provide safe patient care and excellent customer service to all patient populations

- Possesses excellent critical thinking skills along with the ability to work in a high volume and fast paced environment

- Outstanding customer service skills

- Part-Time

- 1st shift, 10.00 hour shift length

- Saturday - Sunday

- Holidays may be required

You're going to LOVE Lovelace!

About us: Lovelace Women's Hospital is New Mexico's first and only hospital dedicated to women's health. We are a highly accomplished 120 bed Women's Hospital nestled at the Foot Hills of the Sandia Mountains where it's sunny 360 days a year. Our patients choose Lovelace Women's Hospital because it's a name they trust. Whether we come alongside them for a birthing experience or breast cancer treatment, our primary goal is to offer them exceptional care. For seven consecutive years, Lovelace Women's Hospital has been recognized by Modern Healthcare Magazine as one of the best places to work in healthcare in the nation.

  • 2015 & 2016 Women's Choice Award for America's Best Breast Centers
  • 2016 Women's Choice Award for America's Best Hospitals for Patient Safety
  • Named to Modern Healthcare's 100 Best Places to Work since 2008
  • Zia Award from Quality New Mexico for Best in Class
Facility: Lovelace Women's Hospital is New Mexico's first and only hospital dedicated to women's health and features a 53-bed Level III Neonatal Intensive Care Unit, 24/7 emergency department, 16 labor and delivery rooms, 41-bed Mother-Baby unit, and a Maternal-Fetal Medicine program for high-risk pregnancies. Additionally, the hospital is home to a Natural Birthing Center, where women who wish to have a more natural delivery can deliver in a safe environment. Lovelace Women's Hospital offers a nationally accredited Breast Care Center, digital mammography, and cardiology. Lovelace Women's Hospital also has the latest minimally invasive robotic surgery system, offering surgery with less pain, shorter hospital stays and faster recovery for many gynecological and urological procedures.

The Director, Clinical Systems provides leadership and strategic direction in the functional support, design, instruction and guidance of the clinical applications to enable the achievement of success in the business operation at the division office and hospital facilities. Responsibilities include: providing leadership to the Clinical Applications Team, developing system strategies that are congruent with overall IT strategies as well as the business goals of stakeholders, fiscal and HR accountability for the Clinical Team, conducting business needs analysis, identifying and mitigating IT risks, managing the implementation of clinical application projects

Primary Duties and Responsibilities

Analysis and Solution Definition

  • Quickly understands the business issues and data challenges of the organization and industry.
  • Identifies the organization's strengths and weaknesses and suggests areas of improvement.
  • Develops functional requirements, specifications and system design specifications for business requests.
  • Develops or oversees the development of system documentation, user manuals and training classes for application suite.
  • Creates and maintains detailed test plans and scripts.
  • Leads testing efforts and ensures issues are identified, tracked, reported on and resolved in a timely manner.

Project Execution

  • Evaluates current state processes and identifies gaps to future state process around utilization of applications to maximize departmental and organizational efficiency and effectiveness.
  • Communicates and applies project standards.
  • Enforces of project deadlines and schedules.
  • Takes input from supervisor and appropriately and accurately applies comments/feedback.
  • Manages resources in accordance with project schedule.
  • Consistently delivers high-quality services to business stakeholders.
  • Understands the components of running a fiscally successful project and department.

Communication

  • Assists in the facilitation of team and client meetings.
  • Delivers informative, well-organized presentations.
  • Understands how to communicate difficult/sensitive information tactfully.

Problem Solving

  • Prioritizes and resolves issues.
  • Exhibits confidence and an extensive knowledge of emerging industry practices when solving business problems.
  • Collaborates with business stakeholders to introduce innovative solutions.

Leadership

  • Generates enthusiasm among team members.
  • Challenges others to develop as leaders while serving as a role model.
  • Facilitates effective team interaction.
  • Acknowledges and appreciates each team member's contributions.
  • Develops and fosters relationships with business stakeholders.
  • Continually seeks opportunities to increase customer satisfaction.
  • Manages business stakeholder expectations effectively.


General

  • Participates in leadership incident manager on-call rotation.
  • Ability to travel up to 50%.
  • Embodies and Promotes Core Values: Inquisitiveness, Team-Mindedness, Passionate, and Positive Attitude.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

Education

  • Bachelor's Degree (Equivalent business experience will be considered)
  • Master's Degree preferred

Leadership and Experience

  • Five or more years of management/leadership experience required
  • Five years of experience in clinical care or healthcare delivery with EPIC application experience preferred
  • Subject matter expertise in multiple clinical application modules/solutions with experience in configurations and system setup
  • Proven ability to understand business and clinical issues and objectives as well as the ability to translate them into application solutions and workflow
  • Established project manager of multiple large scale large projects of 12+ team members, with experience managing:
  • Resources and critical path
  • Project scope
  • Issues identification and oversight
  • Change control processes
  • Stakeholder communications
  • Project budget
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Preferred experience with the following EPIC Clinical or Ancillary Products

BSA Health System in Amarillo Texas is seeking a premier candidate to fill the position of Director of Facilities Services. The Director of Facilities Services will be an engaged, dynamic, knowledgeable servant leader who will oversee one of the most passionate, highly motivated teams within the System. The Director will be responsible for an annual operating budget of +$10.5 million and a capital budget in excess of $51 million.

Areas of Responsibilities will include:

Facilities Services, maintenance, operations, construction/ design, biomedical engineering, safety management, utilities, and print services. These collective departments have over 49 FTE's in Facility Services and 11 FTE's in Bio-Medical pursuing the goals/initiatives of the department and System.

In addition to the core leadership responsibilities, this stellar candidate will also be integral in the planning, designing and construction (within the next 24 months) of a: State of the art Cancer Center project

Education/Experience Preferred:

Bachelor's degree in facilities management, engineering or facilities related field.

Minimum of 3-5 years of successful experience in operation and maintenance of physical plant facilities, design and construction

Strong leadership skills with 3 years of managing experience in a hospital setting

Qualifications/Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:

High knowledge level of the regulatory environment, including permitting, workplace safety, and environmental regulations to comply with local, state, and federal standards

Ability to multi-task and manage numerous projects, requests, and daily job requirements simultaneously

Ability to apply principles of logical or scientific thinking to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions

Tact, diplomacy, and composure needed for interaction with contractors, vendors, and hospital Board, Administration, and staff

Ability to effectively utilize basic personal computer functions

Excellent communication (both verbal and written), customer service, and follow through skills

Job Summary:
The role is to serve BSA Health System through leadership of the Don & Sybil Harrington Cancer Center (HCC) and affiliated entities, including Harrington Physicians, Inc. and Harrington Breast Center, in their business activities so as to facilitate teamwork and cooperation among stakeholders and maximize the organization's success. This leader has the authority and responsibility for developing and implementing policies and procedures, budgets, goals, and planning for the areas of responsibility. The primary focus will be to support the mission of the BSA Health System and the Don & Sybil Harrington Cancer Center in the development of an environment which stresses the value of quality patient care, education and research.

The scope includes leadership of a multi-site operation which includes HCC Main Campus, HCC Radiation Oncology satellite and Harrington Breast Center with regional mammography outreach program. Responsibilities within Harrington Cancer Center include the Departments of Radiation Therapy, Nursing and Quality, Pharmacy, Clinical Laboratory, Business Office, Supportive Care Services, Medical Records, Information Technology, Clinical Research, Physician Relations, Facility Services, Development, and Goldston Tumor Registry. Leadership will be provided to Harrington Physicians, Inc. including practice management, business development and physician recruitment.

The position carries oversight of the BSA Comprehensive Cancer Program, which includes the BSA Hospital Oncology Department.

This position requires strong skills in management, strategic planning, leading, organizing and controlling. The economic, political and public expectations of the organization are significant, and the changing market requires skillful leadership and planning to design and implement strategic adjustments as appropriate. Because the organization involves multiple physician groups, it is essential to have the ability to build coalitions of these and other key groups and individuals to facilitate necessary changes and foster a strong organizational commitment.

Education:
- Bachelors in Healthcare Administration or Business, or Medical Degree required
- Masters in Healthcare Administration or Business preferred

Qualifications:
- Minimum of three years director level leadership experience in oncology

- Demonstrated success in the leadership of a comprehensive cancer program

- Understanding of and work experience with the multidisciplinary process of treating cancer patient
- Proven track record of excellent physician relationships
- Position requires fluency in English language to function in job environment appropriately

- Must exhibit desire to exemplify the BSA culture, including the BSA Mission, Vision and the BSA Way

- Good interpersonal and customer service skills

- Good organizational and follow-through skills
- Ability to multi-task constantly and tolerate interruptions

- Ability to remain calm under stress and evaluate personnel situations and make independent decisions
- Demonstrated professional, organizational and leadership skills

For more than 80 years, Lovelace (LHS) has set new standards of care in New Mexico through revolutionary advances in medicine and surgery. Today, that legacy of accomplishment continues in our commitment to advanced technology and sensitive care. At Lovelace, we believe that each encounter with a patient or healthcare consumer offers an opportunity to make a difference in their health and well-being.

Lovelace Regional Hospital Roswell is a 26-bed acute care general hospital that provides both inpatient and outpatient services to southeastern New Mexico, including Roswell, Chaves County and the surrounding communities. In addition to the hospital's full range of medical and surgical services, Lovelace Health Care Center and Lovelace Specialty Health Care offer a broad spectrum of primary care and cardiology services. Services and specialties include labor and delivery, outpatient and inpatient surgery, gastrointestinal procedures, imaging, physical therapy and emergency services.

The Human Resources Director will be responsible for providing a variety of human resources services for an office, subsidiary or remote location. Will help enforce policies and programs related to human resources function within the Lovelace Regional Hospital Roswell policy and procedure guidelines. This role will work closely with upper management to ensure success of human resources programs. You will also help make sure everyone adheres to policies, procedures, and regulations to ensure compliance and patient safety.

Examples of Responsibilities:

About us: Lovelace Women's Hospital is New Mexico's first and only hospital dedicated to women's health. We are a highly accomplished 120 bed Women's Hospital nestled at the Foot Hills of the Sandia Mountains where it's sunny 360 days a year. Our patients choose Lovelace Women's Hospital because it's a name they trust. Whether we come alongside them for a birthing experience or breast cancer treatment, our primary goal is to offer them exceptional care. For seven consecutive years, Lovelace Women's Hospital has been recognized by Modern Healthcare Magazine as one of the best places to work in healthcare in the nation.

Facility: Lovelace Women's Hospital is New Mexico's first and only hospital dedicated to women's health and features a 53-bed Level III Neonatal Intensive Care Unit, 24/7 emergency department, 16 labor and delivery rooms, 41-bed Mother-Baby unit, and a Maternal-Fetal Medicine program for high-risk pregnancies. Additionally, the hospital is home to a Natural Birthing Center, where women who wish to have a more natural delivery can deliver in a safe environment. Lovelace Women's Hospital offers a nationally accredited Breast Care Center, digital mammography, and cardiology. Lovelace Women's Hospital also has the latest minimally invasive robotic surgery system, offering surgery with less pain, shorter hospital stays and faster recovery for many gynecological and urological procedures.

The Director of Surgical Services is responsible for planning, organizing and directing of the operations and staff (clinical and non-clinical) of the Surgical Services Department. Develops and sustains an environment that supports excellence and innovation in clinical nursing practice and patient care through assessing, planning, implementing, and evaluating programs and standards that support positive patient outcomes. Facilitates, approves, and approves the budget for Surgical Services.

Essential Functions:
1) Performs a variety of staff management functions including the interviewing, hiring, evaluating, counseling and termination of assigned management and support staff.
2) Provides coaching, mentoring, and support and consultation to managers, colleagues, and staff.
3) Serves as a role model in professional behavior and leadership skills, problem-solving ability, and interpersonal skills.
4) Delegate's authority and accountability to nursing staff for clinical nursing practice and patient care decisions that is consistent with professional standards, regulatory agencies, and organizational policies and procedures.
5) Maintains an ongoing departmental Quality Improvement Plan and process consistent with the organizational Quality Management Plan, develops and implements unit specific standards, polices, and procedures that guide and support the provision of care and services; continuously assesses and improves assigned departments' performance while enhancing service.
6) Reviews appropriate financial reports, and makes appropriate modifications to reduce costs associated with supplies, staffing, service agreements, and/or identifies sound alternatives for purchasing equipment and supplies.
7) Participates in and/or chairs committees, work groups, or meetings as appropriate.
8) Participates in strategic planning as it relates to patient care.
9) Maintains a current knowledge of principles, practices, techniques, and policies and procedures.
10) Ensures that principles, practices, techniques, and policies and procedures are consistent with professional standards and regulatory agencies.
11) Analyze situations accurately and adopt an efficient course of action.
12) Provide excellent customer service and establish and maintain working relationships with patients, staff, and physicians.
Education:
A graduate of an accredited nursing school. Bachelor's degree in Nursing required, Master's preferred.

Technical/Formal Training:
Must obtain and maintain a current certification in CPR-BLS and ACLS.

Knowledge/ Skill/Abilities:
Demonstrated leadership abilities; able to work under stressful situations. Possesses good oral and written communication skills. A demonstrated ability in interpersonal relationships which enhances communication, promotes conflict resolutions, and facilitates staff development.

Experience:
Prefer at least 5 years of experience in surgical environment with management experience.

Licensure:
Must possess a current Oklahoma License as a Registered Nurse.

Reporting to the AVP of Case Management, the Case Management Auditor/Educator shall perform reviews for Case Management process improvement to include review of case management documentation, case management processes, utilization review processes and documentation, assisting with education for case management staff at all ardent facilities as needed, observation and 1-2 day inpatient audits, and transitions of care evaluation and process improvements. The CM Auditor/Educator will assist in the development of the processes to standardize Case Management, Transitions of Care, and Utilization Review.

Education: Prefer a Bachelor's Degree in Nursing or Licensed Master Level Social Worker with Case Management certification required (ACM or CCM).

Work Experience: A minimum of four years of experience as an RN Case Manager, Utilization Review RN or LMSW Case Manager. An ACM or CCM certification is required for the position or must be obtained in 1 year. Experience auditing and reviewing medical records preferred. Completion of reports for documentation of issues in Word and Excel spreadsheet formats. Proficiency with Power Point a plus. Conduct medical chart and process reviews for potential opportunities to improve Case Management, TOC and UR system-wide.

Skills need to include knowledge of hospital operations, hospital department case management, TOC, and utilization review, revenue cycle services and CMS regulations. Extensive knowledge of all CMS regulations regarding Conditions of Participation for Discharge Planning, OPPS and IPPS documentation regulations, Two-Midnight Rule, CMS Inpatient only list, NOTICE Act.

Additional Requirements: Communication skills and developing a rapport with hospital administration, department managers, and case management staff are paramount to identifying issues and developing resolution. Must be detail oriented and work both independently and collaboratively with various administrative and clinical staff. Requires willingness and ability to travel up to 50% or greater.

1. Reviews case management documentation and processes, UR processes and documentation and TOC processes and documentation to ensure efficiency and effectiveness. This includes:

Improvement of facility processes and procedures to assure timely and accurate CM/TOC/UR processes.

Development and implementation of System-wide Denial Management for regulatory payors.

Develop clinical in-services and education programs for field staff and establish procedures for timely and accurate for CM/TOC/UR delivery.

Develop and maintain collaborative working relationship with all Ardent facilities including CM/TOC/UR, Administration and all other departments that impact Case Management processes.

2. Inter-relate with department managers to identify trends and issues. Assist in directing resolution of the issue.

Document identified issues using current tools or develops new tools to enhance process.

Monitor identified issues and the timeline for resolution.

Document financial impact of identified issue.

4. Address revenue cycle QA issues as needed.

5. Monitor and trend CM/TOC/UR processes to identify opportunities for process improvement.

6. Function as a resource to the CM/TOC/UR departments and Facility Administration.

7. Complies, reconciles and distributes reports timely to the appropriate personnel.

Unit Summary:

BSA provides 24 hour paramedic care through our ambulance service, which responds to emergencies in Canyon and 825 square miles of Randall County. BSA EMS staffs two stations 24/7/365, one in northern Randall County and one in Canyon.

Job Summary:

Primarily responsible for providing emergency care and transportation of the sick and injured in accordance with established protocols, BSA Health System Policies and Department Guidelines. Responds to emergency calls to provide efficient and immediate care to the critically ill and injured. Determines the nature & extent of the patient's condition and provides appropriate emergency care & transports patient when necessary. Accepts other tasks as assigned by the EMS Director.

Licenses and Certifications:

Certification as an EMT- Basic by Texas Department Health Services is required

National Registry certification is preferred

American Heart Association Healthcare Provider CPR is required

Valid minimum Class C Texas Driver License with restriction "A" permissible

Must be 21 years of age or older with excellent driving record

Completion of the following Department of Homeland Security, Federal Emergency Management Agency National Incident Management System (NIMS) courses: IS-100, IS-200, IS-700, IS-800.A is required within 80 days of employment

Qualifications/Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:

Previous field experience is strongly preferred

Demonstrates competency handling emergencies utilizing all BLS equipment and skills in accordance with all local protocols and behavioral objectives in the US Department of Transportation EMT-Basic curriculum.

Use good judgment and remain calm in high stress situations including situations not covered by written or verbal instructions.

Calculate weight and volume ratios and read small print, both under life-threatening time constraints.

Accurately discern street sign and address numbers and able to read maps

Must have good critical thinking skills and perform duties under intermittent or continuous physiological duress

Must have excellent communication and customer service skills required

Schedule Details:

- Weekly shifts include a 24 and 12-hour shift

- Including weekends and holidays; additional hours, as required

Current BLS for the HealthCare Provider

Individuals within this job classification are accountable for providing nursing care under the supervision of a Registered Nurse or Licensed Practical Nurses. The GI lab Endoscopy Tech must able to demonstrate the knowledge and skills necessary to provide care appropriate to the age of patients served on the assigned unit. This individual must demonstrate knowledge of the principles of growth and development over the lift span and possess the ability to function in an assistive role to the licensed nurse in the provision of technical and environmental responsible for activities of patient care activities as delegated by an under the supervision of the licensed staff. The GI Lab Endoscopy Tech will be responsible for activities of patient care which involve specialty training in the Endoscopy lab. He/she is expected to adhere to and abide by the rules and regulations set forth by the Oklahoma Nursing Practice Act.

Individuals within this job classification are accountable for providing nursing care under the supervision of a Registered Nurse or Licensed Practical Nurses. The GI lab Endoscopy Tech must able to demonstrate the knowledge and skills necessary to provide care appropriate to the age of patients served on the assigned unit. This individual must demonstrate knowledge of the principles of growth and development over the lift span and possess the ability to function in an assistive role to the licensed nurse in the provision of technical and environmental responsible for activities of patient care activities as delegated by an under the supervision of the licensed staff. The GI Lab Endoscopy Tech will be responsible for activities of patient care which involve specialty training in the Endoscopy lab. He/she is expected to adhere to and abide by the rules and regulations set forth by the Oklahoma Nursing Practice Act.

Primary responsibilities include maintaining, monitoring, and deploying data network infrastructure for Ardent Health Services. This encompasses updating network documentation, deploying new hardware utilizing enterprise standards, and conducting utilization studies. This position will work closely with other members of the Ardent technology team to support the overall mission of the company and its' strategic business initiatives.

q Maintain and install Cisco network equipment in corporate office and data center environments.

q Support Senior Engineers in design/implementation strategies.

q Maintain documentation related to network layout.

q Maintain security policies for the Cisco environment.

q Ensure that requirements for high availability are in place for the Cisco environment.

Education:

q Required-Associates' degree in Information Systems / Computer Science or equivalent technical training.

q Active CCNA certification required. Additional certifications preferred.

Experience:

q Minimum of 3 years experience working in Information Systems, preferably in the heath care industry.

q Minimum of 2 years experience with Cisco routing, switching and wireless products.

q Configuration of Complex Routing protocols and High Availability WAN architecture.

q Configuration and troubleshooting experience with complex LAN Infrastructures, Ethernet, MPLS, and BGP networks. PVST, Ether-channel/Port Channel configuration, Dot1.Q Trunking, VTP.

q Configuration and troubleshooting of advanced wireless networks including RF spectrum analysis, and interference remediation.

q Configuration of Cisco Wireless Controllers and autonomous access points

q Configuration of Cisco ASA firewalls

Additional Requirements:

q Proficient in the operation and analysis of LAN and WAN packet captures, and Network Analysis.

q Proficient with DNS, DHCP, configuration and troubleshooting.

q Experience with route summarization.

q QOS/COS.

q Checkpoint firewall

Unit Description:
BSA Facility Services encompasses Maintenance, Fleet, Construction, Grounds, Safety, Clinical Engineering and Print Shop. The Hospital campus is served 24 hours per day, 7 days per week with the majority of staff on the day shift. We also provide daily coverage for BSA facilities across Amarillo including call coverage. We provide complete operation of and service to the organizations physical plant and all related infrastructure.

Job Summary:

The Facility Tech I provides repair, service, and operational reliability of utilities and/or equipment required to meet the needs of the facility. Said skills shall be commensurate with those expected of an entry-level technician as determined by his immediate supervisor. Keep designated area of responsibility neat, clean and well maintained. Ensure that a work order exists for all completed tasks.

Licenses and Certifications:

  • High school diploma or GED required.
  • Willingness to be available for training classes if needed
  • Valid Texas driver's license and good driving record required for insurance purposes
  • Certification in HVAC, plumbing, and/ or electrical background is strongly preferred
  • Licensure in a specialty field may be substituted for other experience at the discretion of the supervisor

Qualifications/Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:

  • Minimum of one year previous experience in related equipment and / or building maintenance.
  • At least 21 years of age is preferred for insurance purposes
  • Must have good mechanical and/ or electrical aptitude
  • Basic computer skills and knowledge required
  • Must have good interpersonal, teamwork and customer service skills
  • Great organizational and follow through skills a must
  • Ability to multi-task and tolerate interruptions

Schedule Details:

Status: Full Time

Days: Monday Friday, Occasional Weekends/Holidays

Hours: 11:00 PM 7:30 AM

Work Schedule: 8.00

Shift: 3rd - Night

Reporting to the Controller of Ardent's Information Technology Department, the Financial Analyst is responsible for conducting financial analysis projects and statistical studies. You will perform a variety of complicated tasks, including financial modeling, projections, monitoring, and tracking.

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Month-end Review RNI, Accruals and Prepaid schedules.
  • Financial Analysis:
  • Review actual in contracts file and labor analysis for accuracy
  • Update contract and contract labor projections
  • Coordinate and obtain monthly cost trackers for strategic and capital projects
  • Epic - Tracking and updating the financials for Ardent's roll out of Epic.
  • PO's / Invoices Provide input on coding questions for Pos and Invoices
  • Capital Forecasting / Budgeting
  • Provide direct input for project owners to prepare CER's
  • Validation of cost offsets within the CER documentation
  • Prepare initial forecast schedule using monthly cost trackers for Controller review.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

  • Ability to provide accurate and efficient service under the stress of constant deadlines.
  • Knowledge of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles.
  • Ability to work on different projects at one time.
  • Ability to work and interact with departments throughout the Company.
  • Ability to work independently.
  • Exceptional written and verbal skills.
  • Exceptional problem solving abilities.
  • Exceptional organizational skills.
  • Detail oriented.
  • Skill in the use of personal computers and related software applications.


Qualifications:

Education:

  • Requires a Bachelor's degree
  • CPA preferred

Work Experience:

  • 3+ years of experience in Accounting.

Other Factors:

  • Healthcare experience strongly preferred.
  • Must be familiar with standard concepts, practices, and procedures.
  • Should possess experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals.
  • Must have strong financial modeling/projection experience.
  • Lawson experience is preferred.
  • Hyperion experience is preferred.

job.jobDescription:
Bailey Medical Center (BMC) located in Owasso, Oklahoma is a premier provider of health care service voted Modern Healthcares Top 100 best places to work three years running. BMC is a premier provider of health care services, delivered with compassion for patients and their families, with respect for employees, physicians and other health professionals, with accountability for our fiscal and ethical performance, and with responsibility to the communities we serve.

This position will assist with bariatric patients by implementing exercise prescriptions as part of secondary prevention. Evaluates individual responses to exercise and conditioning, and educates patients regarding secondary prevention. Posses the ability to assess data reflective of the patient's status and interpret the information appropriate and necessary to identify each patient's requirements relative to his/her age specific needs, and to provide the care needed as described in the department's policies and procedures. Delivers exercise therapy and education to facilitate behavior modification and change. Manages patient data to determine outcome of program effectiveness. Additional requirements include the ability to support the Health & Wellness Coordinator in the implementation of new health and wellness programs, Bariatric Support Groups, Childhood Obesity Program and other services and activities. Individual is accountable for complying with national standards and benchmarks in accordance with BMC standards to deliver efficient, effective, quality patient care. The Exercise Consultant is expected to adhere to and abide by the rules and regulations set forth by the law and must demonstrate critical thinking, skills, and leadership in anticipating, delegating and planning. The coordinator will assist in creating and implementing programs for the purpose of educating and engaging employees in healthy lifestyle choices.

Under close supervision of an EVS Lead, performs a variety of routine cleaning tasks requiring moderate to heavy physical effort. Maintains assigned work area and equipment in an orderly and sanitary condition at all times. Accountable for spot cleaning and shampooing carpets and buffing, scrubbing, and waxing of tiled floors throughout the facility.

High school diploma or equivalent

Must have effective oral/written communication skills. Possesses ability to maintain effective working relations with the public. Ability to operate housekeeping equipment.

** Guaranteed Onsite Interview Opportunity**
 Guaranteed Onsite Interviews will be held every Tuesday starting at 10:30 AM and 11:30 AM.

Interested in attending here's how:

  • Submit an online application.
  • On the day and a time mentioned above come to the main BSA front doors, and ask a greeter to escort you to the Nutrition Offices to meet with Beverly.
  • Interviews will promptly start at the above times so please allow yourself time for parking.

Unable to attend Tuesday, that's ok:

  • Submit an application.
  • Recruiter will review and will contact based on qualifications to schedule an onsite interview that's convenient for you.

Unit Description:
The Dining Center of BSA Health System offers eight food stations serving Mexican, Asian, American food and much more. The Dining Center hours are 6am 10:15am for breakfast and 11am 11pm for lunch and dinner. The Dining Center is open every day including holidays and weekends. The Dining Center serves patients, family members, employees, guests and all customers.

Job Summary:

The grill cook is responsible for preparing dinner menu entree and vegetable items for the Dining Center. Take and prepare orders at grill using griddle, broiler, fryers, and sandwich table. Assembles and serves food to customers and prepare food according to recipes. Clean equipment at end of each shift. Individual must be able to work other areas and positions in the dining center as needed.

In addition: Grill Staff are expected to fill in at various other areas in order to provide Great Customer Service. These areas would include 2-3 of the following areas as training is provided: Deli, Pizza, Classic Buffet, Specialty Areas, Cashier, and Dish Room Duties.

Licenses and Certifications :

High school diploma or GED is preferred

Serve Safe certification a plus

Qualifications/Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:

Six-months prior restaurant/institutional food service experience with food preparation/handling preferred

Previous grill experience preferred

Knowledge of sanitation and food prep is preferred

Must be able to handle food and equipment quickly and safely

Must be able to read, write, and speak English

Basic math skills required

Must be able to communicate, exhibit team work, and provide great customer service skills

Hours: 7:00 AM - 3:30 Pm

job.hours: 8:00am - 1:00pm Four days/Work week with Sunday rotation
job.jobDescription:
Bailey Medical Center (BMC) located in Owasso, Oklahoma is a premier provider of health care service voted Modern Healthcares Top 100 best places to work three years running. BMC is a premier provider of health care services, delivered with compassion for patients and their families, with respect for employees, physicians and other health professionals, with accountability for our fiscal and ethical performance, and with responsibility to the communities we serve.

The Health Information Management Department (Medical Records) is a service- oriented department whose goal is to accurately and legally maintain the medical records of patients seen at Bailey Medical Center, whether on an inpatient or outpatient basis.

The HIM Specialist is responsible for locating and/or picking up patient charts. Auditing discharge logs to ensure all charts are received. Specialist is responsible for accurately and productively prepping, scanning, indexing and releasing inpatient, same day surgery, observation, and loose sheets into One Content (Legal Medical Record).

High school diploma is required. Associates degree is preferred.

Healthcare experience preferred.

Hours: 8:00am - 1:00pm Four days during work week with rotating Sunday

Medical Records Technician, Oklahoma Heart Institute

From comprehensive diagnostics to open heart surgery and cardiac rehabilitation, Oklahoma Heart Institute combines nationally recognized cardiovascular physicians with the region's most advanced technology.

Responsible for support of electronic medical records, scanning, indexing of paper records, release of information, faxing out electronic records, and handling in coming calls from a variety of internal an external customers. Will function as part of cross-trained team in a high volume fast paced environment. Requires good customer service skills, multi-tasking, attention to detail, and computer / keyboarding skills.

Position will be located at 1265 S. Utica or 9228 S. Mingo.

Bailey Medical Center (BMC) located in Owasso, Oklahoma is a premier provider of health care service voted Modern Healthcares Top 100 best places to work three years running. BMC is a premier provider of health care services, delivered with compassion for patients and their families, with respect for employees, physicians and other health professionals, with accountability for our fiscal and ethical performance, and with responsibility to the communities we serve.

Supervises the work activities of Environmental Services personnel to ensure clean, orderly and attractive conditions in the hospital. Provides coverage as needed. Coordinates some activities of the Environmental Services Department with those of other hospital departments.

Hospital experience preferred.

High school/GED education required.

Under close supervision of an EVS lead, performs a variety of routine cleaning tasks requiring moderate to heavy physical effort. Maintains assigned work area and equipment in an orderly and sanitary condition at all times.

Must have efficient oral/written communication skills. Possesses ability to maintain effective working relations with the public. Ability to operate housekeeping equipment.

Under close supervision of an EVS lead, performs a variety of routine cleaning tasks requiring moderate to heavy physical effort. Maintains assigned work area and equipment in an orderly and sanitary condition at all times.

Must have efficient oral/written communication skills. Possesses ability to maintain effective working relations with the public. Ability to operate housekeeping equipment.

Job Summary:
The HR Assistant is responsible for administering the various employee leave benefits offered to employees and accurately performs various data entry in the HRIS system each pay period and monthly. This position will also answer and direct phone calls, greet and assist visitors, make badges and file employee paperwork. The HR Assistant must perform other duties as assigned.

Education:
- High school diploma or GED required

Qualifications:

- Human Resources experience preferred

- Must demonstrate excellent verbal and written communication skills
- Customer service skills and cheerful attitude
- Ability to interface with people at all levels in the organization

- Ability to positively deal with employees in stressful situations

- Organizational skills
- Remain flexible in a fast paced environment
- One-year office experience

- Must exhibit strong commitment to protecting the privacy of employee work and health information

- Proficiency with basic office equipment including multi-line telephone & badge making equipment
- Beginning to Intermediate level of expertise in Microsoft Office Outlook, Word, and Excel

Qualifications:
Status: Full Time
Days: Monday - Friday
Hours: 8:30 AM - 5:00 PM
Shift:1st
Work Schedule: 8.00

The IP Coder II will bring to the table proven experience in all aspects of hospital coding, which includes the technical abilities to perform facility coding for hospital inpatient and outpatient services. To achieve appropriate and timely reimbursement and data integrity the IP Coder II must ensure accurate and compliant application of correct coding principles for hospital services. and participate in any coding-related projects.

The IP Coder II is responsible for

Assigning ICD-10 diagnosis and procedure codes and present on admission (POA) indicators; HCPCS/CPT codes; and modifiers.

Maintains at least a 97% accuracy rate.

Maintains average to high productivity based on Ardent Shared Coding Productivity Standards.

Abstracting of facility required data in McKesson Star.

Working applicable McKesson Pre-Bill Edits and Receivable Work Station (RWS) requests.

Follow up on missing documentation, including the generation of appropriate queries, as needed.

Communication of issues to the MS-DRG, APC Manager and/or Director Shared Coding Services, as appropriate.

Thorough understanding of ICD-10 Official Coding Guidelines for Coding and Reporting and AHA Coding Clinic.

Thorough understanding of HCPCS/CPT coding systems and CPT Assistant and Coding Clinic for HCPCS guidelines.

Thorough understanding of Medicare Inpatient Prospective Payment System (IPPS), Medicare Severity-Diagnosis Related Groups (MS-DRGs).

Thorough understanding of Medicare Outpatient Prospective Payment System (OPPS), Ambulatory Payment Classification (APC).

Understanding of coding resources and tools, including 3M 360 Encompass.

Acknowledgement of receipt and review of updated Ardent coding policies.

Maintains continuing education (CE) requirements per Ardent policy.

Education:

Successful completion of a Medical Terminology, Anatomy and Physiology, and Pharmacology course

Successful completion of an ICD-10-CM/PCS and HCPCS/CPT training and/or coding class

Coding/HIM certification

Experience & Requirements:

3 years coding/abstracting experience in hospital inpatient and outpatient coding. Advanced training in ICD-10.

Computer and software skills, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, encoder/grouper

Strong written and verbal communications skills

Organizational skills

Leadership skills

The Instructor IV teaches one or more of the advanced courses taught in the Employee Education Department: AHA courses, ENA courses, ONS chemotherapy, IV Therapies, AWHONN courses, NRP or others as recognized by the Director. Level IV instructor serves as the Lead Instructor for at least one or more of the advanced courses. The Instructor Level IV position requires current license certification in one or more of the following: Paramedic, Respiratory Therapist, RN, DO, PA, or MD. This position requires excellent presentation, communication and written skills. This position assists the TC Director with staffing adjustments as needed.

Must have current healthcare license in current field. Must be instructor certified in assigned Course for which you are being paid to teach.

You're going to LOVE Lovelace!

Lovelace Shared Services: Organizational support departments for all Lovelace facilities including Coding, Finance, Health Information Management, Revenue Cycle, Marketing, and the Resource Team. We are dedicated to exceeding our customers' expectations in every way.

Lovelace Shared Services is now hiring an Insurance Verifier - PRN

  • Lovelace Shared Services is now hiring an Insurance Verifier. The Insurance Verifier contacts all insurance companies to verify description of patient(s) medical plan benefits. Interacts with physicians' office personnel and patients regarding financial issues; assures appropriate payment for procedures.
  • Handles customer account transactions, provides customer assistance, and performs and/or oversees cashiering operations.
  • Adheres to policies, procedures and regulations to ensure compliance and patient safety.

Qualifications:

  • Minimum: High School Diploma or GED equivalent
  • Desired: Associate's Degree in related field of study
  • Medical Terminology
  • Ability to type and enter data efficiently and accurately. Ability to work independently. Ability to communicate effectively. Knowledge of office procedures. Knowledge of insurance plans. Skilled in a variety of software applications, Microsoft Office (Excel, Word). Ability to problem solve. Ability to communicate effectively and exercise sound judgment.
  • One (1) year of previously related experience.
  • Preferred: Previous medical office experience
  • Preferred: Heart Saver

Why Lovelace?

DNV Accredited

Named to Becker's Hospital Review's list of 100 Hospitals with Great Neurosurgery and Spine Programs

Truven Health Analytics named Lovelace Health System among the top 20 percent of health systems in the country, and is the only health system recognized for this honor in New Mexico

Ardent Health Services (AHS) is a national healthcare company headquartered in Nashville, TN. Our subsidiaries own and operate hospitals and multispecialty physician practices in three states. Ardent includes: 3 health systems with 14 hospitals, 2,194 licenses beds, 12,000 employees, and 3 physician groups with 270 employed physicians. Within the industry, we are noted for recognizing that every hospital is as unique as the community it serves. This in-depth understanding of how health care works at the local level is one of our great strengths.

We are seeking a dynamic, self-motivated Senior Auditor to join our team in Nashville, Tennessee. In our Audit Services department, you will continue to develop the skills you learned in public accounting that will ultimately lead to your placement in an operations, financial or other role within the Company.

As a Senior Auditor, you will be responsible for leading audit engagements, designing the audit approach to address risk and effectively communicating the results of your procedures. You will consult with management on special assignments, including accounting matters, contract compliance, operational initiatives and/or due diligence.

If you are creative, enjoy the pace of public accounting without the hours; have experience using data analysis tools such as Excel, Access or ACL, as well as exceptional financial/operational audit skills, this role will be a perfect fit for you.

Requirements:

Education:

  • BS/BA in Accounting, Finance or related field
  • Advanced degree preferred

Experience & Attributes:

  • 2-3 years of Public Accounting experience preferred
  • Certified Public Accountant required
  • Healthcare or Health Plan experience preferred
  • Efficient use of Excel, Access or ACL
  • Demonstrated analytical approach to problem solving
  • Ability to lead project activities
  • Contribute to strong relationships through interactions with Company management
  • Contribute to engagement planning and ensure that products/deliverables address risk
  • Strong written and oral communication skills
  • Contribute to a positive team attitude
  • Willingness to travel up to 25%

This individual, in addition to being able to operate all routine radiographic equipment, must be able to operate all equipment related to special procedures in a safe and proficient manner. Must maintain their registry status as set forth by the American Registry of Radiologic Technologist (A.R.R.T. or be registry eligible (have applied to take the registry).

This individual must be able to handle telephone scheduling of procedures.

The incumbent must be able to produce high quality radiographs with a minimum of repeats. Must be able to operate all specialty equipment in a safe manner. i.e., film changers, oxygen, arterial catheters, and wires, and power injectors. Must be able to coordinate patient flow. Must be available for 24-hour callback, with a 30-minute response time. Must demonstrate skill in communication with physicians, patients, families, and ancillary hospital personnel. The incumbent must be able to demonstrate proficiency in using the PACS computer system.

The incumbent must be able to demonstrate the knowledge and skills necessary to provide care appropriate to the age of the patients served in his or her assigned area. The individual must demonstrate knowledge of the principles of growth and development over the life span and possess the ability to assess data reflective of the patient's status and interpret the appropriate information needed to identify each patient's requirements relative to his or her age-specific needs, and to provide the care needed as describe din the department's competency plan. Will participate in performance improvement initiatives. Will assist with other activities as deemed necessary for the day to day operation of the department.

*The Interventional Radiology Technologist is responsible for producing high quality radiographs and assisting the radiologist with a variety of invasive and non-invasive procedures, as directed by the Interventional Radiology Clinical Coordinator. Specific duties may include assisting as a scrub tech during invasive procedures. The candidate must be a graduate of an approved school of Radiologic Technology and registered with the American Registry of Radiologic Technologists. Advanced certification in CV is preferred. This position will adhere to all policies, procedures and regulations to ensure patient safety and compliance.*
CPR, ARRT registered or registry eligible, previous experience preferred

The IT Help Desk Tech is a self-starter with excellent communication skills that include a technical vocabulary. These individuals provide a helping hand and often progress into other departments within the IT&S team. You will evaluate user's problems, determine the source, and guide the issue through the proper steps for resolution.

Education:

  • High School diploma or equivalent required. Bachelor's degree preferred.

Experience:

  • Two-years experience working with Microsoft applications (ex. Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint)
  • Successful track record of experience identifying PC problems to a functional level
  • Successful history of handling repetitive telephone calls
  • Experience working in a help desk environment
  • Healthcare experience/knowledge a plus
  • Commitment to customer satisfaction

What You'll Do:

This dynamic job will present situations that require you think on your feet, but here are a few things you can expect:

  • Assist users with inquires that relate to department repair policies in a timely manner.
  • Improve the level of Information Service by providing problem resolution or forwarding inquiries to appropriate personnel/technician.
  • Analyze types of problems and inquiries to assign severity levels, assign problem resolution, and follow through on resolution.
  • Log and input trouble tickets in "Service Plus" in order to analyze and track service response and problems to final resolution.
  • Encourage and support a team environment. Work with peers to equitably distribute problems and escalations.
  • Stay abreast of the latest technology. Utilizes in-house training opportunities to further personal development, as assigned by Shift Lead.
  • Excellent communication skills both written and verbal. Easily discuss technology in simple, every day terms. Highly organized individual who can manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
  • Conflict resolution and anger diffusion are key elements to success to gain customer respect and confidence.
  • Ability to work varying shifts to accommodate business needs.
  • Ability to support twenty-four by seven operations to include On Call Rotation between Customer Service Representatives.

Benefits:

  • Competitive Paid Time Off program
  • 401(k) Retirement Savings
  • Competitive Salary
  • Bonus targets based on company and individual performance
  • Comprehensive Medical, Dental and Vision Benefits
  • Company provided & Optional Life Insurance
  • Healthcare & dependant care flexible spending accounts

Lovelace Shared Services is now hiring a PT Desktop Support Tech.

  • The Desktop Support Tech provides accurate, timely, and creative solutions to end-user computer problems of a moderate nature to ensure end-user productivity.
  • Performs restorative and maintenance actions either remotely or at the end user's location to resolve problems using basic troubleshooting and technical skills.
  • Performs general maintenance tasks, troubleshoots, and repairs computer systems and peripheral equipment located throughout the enterprise.

Qualifications:

  • Desired-Associates' degree in Information Systems / Computer Science or equivalent technical training.
    Desired MCP certification.
  • Experience
    Minimum of one year experience in Information Systems / Network Administration.
    Experience with Windows 2000 Server and Active Directory.
    Microsoft Exchange Server 2000 Administration Skills.
  • Additional Requirements
    Hardware knowledge and experience in installing and replacing computer peripherals.
    Working knowledge of Ethernet networks, Server and PC hardware, network printers, Microsoft Office 2000, Exchange 2000, Active Directory, WINS, DNS and DHCP.
  • Primary Duties and Responsibilities
    Handle support calls from end users related to desktop issues.
    Ensure that proper backup systems are being preformed in order to preserve the integrity of data.
    Knowledge, Skills and Attributes (Underlying skills and abilities that enable the execution of duties and responsibilities)
    Must have good communication skills both oral and written.
    Must display the ability to be a team player and work well with employees at all levels.

The Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) is responsible and accountable for the practice of professional nursing, performed under the direct supervision of an RN or licensed independent practitioner. The LPN also must demonstrate the knowledge and skills needed to provide age-appropriate care, based on the assigned unit. This includes a thorough understanding of the principles of growth and development over the life span, along with the ability to collect data reflective of the patient's status. This position will adhere to all policies, procedures and regulations to ensure patient safety and compliance.

High school diploma or GED, and current OK LPN license required.

Position is located in Pryor, OK.

Individuals within this job classification are accountable for assessing, planning, implementing, evaluating and documenting care activities in accordance with HHS standards in order to deliver efficient, effective and quality patient care. The Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) must be able to demonstrate the knowledge and skills necessary to provide care appropriate to the age of the patients served on the assigned unit. This individual must demonstrate knowledge of the principles of growth and development over the life span, possess the ability to assess data reflective of the patient's status, interpret the appropriate information needed to identify each patient's requirements relative to his/her age-specific needs. The LPN is to plan for the provision of patient care including the development, modification and implementation of the plan of care in accordance with HHS standards in order to deliver efficient, effective and quality patient care as described in the Patient Care policies and procedures. He/she is expected to adhere to and abide by the rules and regulations set forth by the Oklahoma Nursing Practice Act

Current Oklahoma LPN license and a minimum of one year experience in an acute care facility required.

Under the supervision or direction of a Registered Nurse, the LPN provides patient care specific to the age of the patient. Demonstrates the appropriate skills and ability, based on scope of practice, level of training and/or licensure, to assess, treat, and/or care for patients. Care is provided through utilization of the nursing process, by leadership to provide direction of other non-licensed nursing service personnel and by working collaboratively with other members of the health care team. Must be able to function both as a team member and independently; excellent customer service skills, competent, safe, and knowledgeable in patient care. Must have some familiarity with telemetry.

Hillcrest Hosptial Claremore- LPN-Med/Surg- PT, 7p-7a, varied e/o weekend
At Hillcrest Hospital Claremore, we're proud to offer advanced services right here at home from our Peggy V. Helmerich Birthing Center, to outpatient surgeries and preventative care. And when you need emergency care, our 24/7 emergency physician staffed ER is right where you want it to be close by- to give you prompt medical treatment. The LPN works under the direct supervision of the Physician, RN and other clinical staff in the delivery of primary care to patients. He/she is an integral part of the interdisciplinary care team and is responsible for adhering to the standards of nursing practice, managing supplies and equipment, and promoting teamwork with the physicians and personnel of other departments.
High school diploma or equivalent, Graduate of an accredited school of nursing with a current license as a Licensed Practical Nurse in the State of Oklahoma. Prefer 6 months to 1year experience. ACLS to be acquired within 1 year. Current BLS certification required. Demonstrates the ability to perform the technical and critical thinking outlines in the performance standards. Must be able to provide nursing care to patients of all ages: neonates to geriatric population. Demonstrates team working, self-direction, and teaching skills.

LPN, Hillcrest Medical Center

***MUST BE ENROLLED IN A BSN PROGRAM WITHIN 1 YEAR FROM HIRE DATE.

Individuals within this job classification are accountable for providing nursing care under the supervision of a registered nurse or licensed independent practitioner. The Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) must be able to demonstrate the knowledge and skills necessary to provide care appropriate to the age of the patients served on the assigned unit. This individual must demonstrate knowledge of the principles of growth and development over the life span and possess the ability to collect data reflective of the patient's status. The LPN is to participate in the development, modification and implementation of the plan of care in accordance with HHS standards in order to deliver efficient, effective and high quality patient care. He/she is expected to adhere to and abide by the rules and regulations set forth by the Oklahoma Nursing Practice Act.

Under the supervision or direction of a Registered Nurse, the LPN provides patient care specific to the age of the patient. Demonstrates the appropriate skills and ability, based on scope of practice, level of training and/or licensure, to assess, treat, and/or care for patients based on the age of the patient. Age groups may include the newborn, pediatric, adolescent, adult and geriatric patients. (Varying levels of practitioner and/or care giver will have different skills and abilities.) The skill and ability may include knowledge of growth and development, ranges of treatment and the ability to obtain and interpret information regarding patient needs. The criteria to deliver age appropriate care shall be in the individual departmental policies and procedures. Care is provided through utilization of the nursing process, by leadership to provide direction of other non-licensed nursing service personnel and by working collaboratively with other members of the health care team.

The criteria to deliver age appropriate care shall be in the individual departmental policies and procedures. Care is provided through utilization of the nursing process, by leadership to provide direction of other non-licensed nursing service personnel and by working collaboratively with other members of the health care team.

Ardent Health Services invests in quality health care. In people, technology, facilities and communities, Ardent makes considerable investments, producing high quality care and extraordinary results. We are seeking a leader for the Information Security Team.

Responsible for developing and managing Information Systems security projects including business continuity/disaster recovery, metrics reporting, and regulatory compliance. Oversees IT audits and assessments to ensure corrective action plans are implemented and process improvements maintained. Conducts logical and physical security assessments of networks, systems, and applications. Familiarity with ITGC concepts, practices, and procedures. Relies on extensive experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Leads and directs the work of others. A wide degree of creativity and latitude is expected. Reports to AVP, Information Security.

Education :

Graduate of accredited university or college in computer-related discipline or equivalent experience in related IT field.

Experience:

Minimum of eight years IT experience with at least five in information security or IT auditing. Infrastructure experience including knowledge of Cisco networks, Linux and MS Windows family of operating systems is required. Prefer minimum two years experience in managing complex information technology projects. Strong background in open source security tools is a plus (e.g. Nessus, nmap, OSSIM, Wireshark, etc.).

Certificates/ Licenses:

CISA and PMP certifications preferred; Recognized IT certifications (CISSP, SSCP) is a plus.

TECHNICAL KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS/ABILITIES :

Knowledge:

Strong knowledge of HIPAA, HITECH, PCI, SOX404, and best practice information security standards (ISO27001/2, NIST 800-series, ITIL, etc.). Knowledge of computer security issues, requirements, and trends. Technical knowledge of the software and hardware used within LAN/WAN infrastructure (e.g., Cisco routers & switches, Cisco ASA firewalls, VPN's, patch panels, modems, communication protocols, network nodes, various transmission methodologies and associated network management software). In-depth understanding of TCP/IP (subnetting, services and ports), attack and defense-in-depth strategies, secure network architecture, perimeter security, wireless security, security assessments, incident management, and Linux and Windows operating systems.

Skills in:

Exception al communication skills to effectively interact with executive mgmt, IT personnel, business partners, and end users.

Strong organization, leadership, and project management skills. Strong analytical and problem solving skills.

Ability to:

Perform all essential functions. Identify and remediate security vulnerabilities.

Perform vulnerability analysis, risk analysis, customer training and system technical security reviews and audits.

Develop, clearly define and document required plans, policies and procedures in support of IT security

disaster recovery, and business continuity planning.

Organize and prioritize work to balance cost and risk factors and bring adequate data security measures to the information technology environments.

Read and understand related laws and corporate compliance guidance.

This position can be located in Tulsa, Oklahoma - Amarillo, TX or Albuquerque, NM !!

The Manager of Charge Integrity has responsibility for the areas set forth in the primary responsibility section. The Director possesses requisite managerial and technical abilities to provide corporate leadership and direction in maintaining audit protocols, validation of clinical application functionality, processes and work flows for the timely and accurate recording of hospital revenue in regards to charge capture and oversight of the AHS audit team. This position reports directly to the Director, Charge Integrity and will be responsible for communication from hospital-based leadership as it relates to audit activity, information technology ,Patient Financial Services, and revenue generating departments back to the director for decision making. This position also has collaborative work relationship with Finance, Health Information/Case Management, and Compliance/Internal Audit.

QUALIFICATIONS

Education: Position requires RN, LPN, and Coding/AHIMA Certification. Bachelor's Degree in nursing preferred.

Work Experience: Minimum of five years of relevant clinical /financial audit experience a must with at least two years of experience in a corporate-based environment specializing in charge capture audits. Must have technical knowledge of correct coding principles of CPT-4/HCPCS/ modifiers assignment, proficient with ICD-10 and DRG assignment knowledge.

Additional Requirements: Proven leadership, management and organizational skills. Must have a thorough knowledge of hospital operations, hospital department charge capture, charging system, revenue generation, and Medicare regulatory environment. Must be detail oriented and work both independently and collaboratively with various administrative and clinical areas. Must have excellent communication skills and understands chain of command with regard to decisions and management of challenges and issues.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Manages the corporate nurse auditors including demonstrated proficiency of coding and required regulations for billing and reporting to all payers. Uses web-based tools and recommends consulting needs as appropriate.
  • Assists and recommends specific policy development to Director for corporate policies and procedures for audit related activities.
  • Reviews charge integrity workflows to ensure efficiency and effectiveness. This includes: Improvement of facility processes and procedures to assure timely and accurate capture of all chargeable activities and develop clinical in-services and education programs for field staff and establish procedures for timely and accurate charge capture mechanisms. Must be approved by Director of Charge integrity prior to implementation.
  • Ensures accuracy of the audit teams work and provides corrective action when necessary.
  • May be required to provide input into development of financial impact reports, scorecards, dashboards as it relates to the Charge Integrity departments activity. Must be able to analyze and articulate findings in all reports, scorecards, etc.
  • Communicates and listens effectively with internal and external customers; effectively understands and articulates and shares knowledge as appropriate.
  • Assists Director in integration of all new business acquired and within current AHS enterprise.

Note: The essential job functions of this position are not limited to the duties listed above.

Must have a thorough knowledge or gain knowledge quickly of hospital EMR in all AHS markets, hospital operations and department charge capture, charging system, revenue generation, and Medicare regulatory environment. Must be detail oriented and work both independently and collaboratively with various administrative and clinical areas. Must have technical knowledge of correct coding principles of CPT-4 /HCPCS /, ICD-10, clinical applications, etc.

job.department: Utica Park Clinic - Central 3rd Floor West
job.jobDescription:
Medical Assistant, Utica Park Clinic

Utica Park Clinic is the physicians group of Hillcrest HealthCare System. With over 35 locations throughout northeastern Oklahoma, most patients enjoy the convenience of a location that is close to home. UPC patients have consistently given top ratings (98% patient satisfaction scores) for the quality of care they receive. When choosing a healthcare provider, you can be confident that you'll find a good match at Utica Park Clinic.

The Medical Assistant is responsible for vitals, injections and basic triage and should be able to assist in minor procedures. In addition, candidates should possess a solid understanding of medical terminology, good customer service skills, computer skills, phone experience, and good written/verbal communication skills. Responsible for maintaining an efficient patient flow, assisting the physician during patient exams and performing all necessary follow-up in a timely and accurate manner while exhibiting quality care. Must be knowledgeable of routine office procedures and medical instruments. Screens phone calls from patients for the provider. This position will adhere to all policies, procedures and regulations to ensure patient safety and compliance.

High school diploma or equivalent, registered or certified MA, and current CPR certification required.

Position is located at 1245 South Utica, 3rd Floor.

Location: Lovelace Medical Group - Constitution Clinic

Lovelace Medical Group providers are known for their commitment to quality and delivery of compassionate health care. We are comprised of experienced, skilled providers who embrace advanced medical care. Lovelace Medical Group, including Southwest Medical Associates, is committed to delivering team-based, coordinated medical care in a cost-effective environment to communities served by our hospitals and health plans.


Lovelace Medical Group is now hiring a Certified Medical Assistant.


  • The Medical Assistant performs clinical and administrative duties that assist in the delivery of effective patient care within assigned area.
  • Demonstrates knowledge of medical practice and patient care as it relates to the clinical setting and medical specialty.
  • Adheres to policies and procedures and regulations to ensure compliance and patient safety.

Qualifications:

Certified Medical Assistant (CMA) and proof of current membership from American Association of Medical Assistants (AAMA)

OR

o Certified Clinical Medical Assistant (CCMA) and proof of current membership from National Healthcareer Association (NHA)

OR

o National Certified Medical Assistant (NCMA) and proof of current membership from National Certified Competency Testing (NCCT)

OR

o Completion of a medical assistant program from an accredited institution and ability to obtain registration/certification from one of the above certifying bodies within 30 days of hire.

Computer and keyboarding skills; Positive communication skills.

Desired: One (1) year experience as a Medical Assistant in healthcare setting

Minimum: CPR

Named one of the 150 Great Places to Work in Healthcare by Becker's Hospital Review

Named one of the Best Places to Work by Albuquerque Business First

Named Top Workplace by Albuquerque Journal, 2013, 2014 and 2015

Named to Modern Healthcare's 100 Best Places to Work five times since 2008

Job Summary:

The MT/MLT will primarily rotate in the various sections of the Microbiology department in the clinical laboratory as assigned, and may perform special procedures as required in a medical laboratory which may include, but is not limited to, hematology, special chemistry, chemistry, blood bank, microbiology, serology, and urinalysis. They will also solve practical problems, deal with a variety of issues and interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written or oral form.

Licensure/Certification/Registration REQUIRED:

Degree from approved MT or MLT program or ASCP or equivalent registry

or
Currently enrolled in an accredited MT program.

Qualifications:

- Must have capability to conduct all aspects of procedural and instrument troubleshooting, method evaluation, establishment and maintenance of acceptability of test results for their section
- Must have the ability to ensure optimal communication of information with healthcare professionals
- Must possess excellent customer service skills
- Must exhibit the technical ability and problem-solving skills to perform all tests (both manual and automated) in the clinical laboratory.

- Prior work experience as an MT/MLT (ASCP) preferred

- Prior Microbiology experience is preferred

- Must display good interpersonal skills

- Must display good communication (written/verbal) and organizational skills

- Knowledge of chemical, biological, and mathematical principles, laboratory instrumentation, method

principles, and techniques

- Responsible for solving practical problems, dealing with a variety of issues and interpreting a variety of instructions furnished in written or oral form.
- Position requires fluency in English language to function in job environment appropriately

- Must exhibit desire to exemplify the BSA culture, including the BSA Mission, Vision and the BSA Way

- No experience required; however, preference will be given to individuals with prior work experience.

Schedule Details:
- Full-time

- 1st Shift, Days
- 5:00 A.M. - 3:30 P.M.

- Monday Friday, alternating weekends and holidays

The certified Medical Technologist is responsible for routine and specialized testing and quality control. This individual should possess a solid understanding of testing theory and must be able to troubleshoot common technical problems, with minimal supervision. This position will adhere to all policies, procedures and regulations to ensure patient safety and compliance.

Bachelor's Degree and MT (ASCP) certification.

The certified Medical Technologist is responsible for routine and specialized testing and quality control. This individual should possess a solid understanding of testing theory and must be able to troubleshoot common technical problems, with minimal supervision. This position will adhere to all policies, procedures and regulations to ensure patient safety and compliance.

Bachelor's Degree and MT (ASCP) certification.

The MT will administer, direct and coordinate all activities of the Laboratory Department. Follow regulatory, federal and state agency requirements. Responsible for application and implementation of policies and procedures regarding laboratory procedures, quality control programs and safety programs. Responsible for areas of the Lab to include: Urinalysis, Hematology, Chemistry, Serology, Blood Banking, and Micro Biology. Give direct input into decisions on hiring and terminating of departmental employees. This position will be the lead MT and assume some leadership roles.

Bachelor's degree required

The certified Medical Technologist is responsible for routine and specialized testing and quality control. This individual should possess a solid understanding of testing theory and must be able to troubleshoot common technical problems, with minimal supervision. This position will adhere to all policies, procedures and regulations to ensure patient safety and compliance.

Bachelor's Degree and MT (ASCP) certification.

The Medical Technologist is responsible for overall daily operations and testing in the laboratory, reviews and maintains quality control and preventative maintenance records, reviews and updates procedure manuals, inventories laboratory supplies, and evaluates new test and procedures.

Must posses a Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university in a chemical, physical, biological, or clinical laboratory science, or medical technology program.

Must be emotionally mature and able to function effectively under stress. Must be able to follow directions and perform work according to department standards when no directions are given.

Desirable characteristics include at least two years experience as a Medical Technologist.

Must be eligible for ASCP or equivalent registry. Or must possess an Associate degree from an accredited college or university and be AMT certified.

Mental Health Aide, Hillcrest Hospital Claremore, FT, 7A-7P varied

At Hillcrest Hospital Claremore, we're proud to offer advanced services right here at home from our Peggy V. Helmerich Birthing Center, to outpatient surgeries and preventative care. And when you need emergency care, our 24/7 emergency physician staffed ER is right where you want it to be close by- to give you prompt medical treatment. The Nurse Aide is responsible for a wide range of daily living/patient care tasks, performed under the direct supervision of the RN or LPN. This individual must demonstrate the knowledge and skills needed to provide age-appropriate care, based on the assigned unit. This position will adhere to all policies, procedures and regulations to ensure patient safety and compliance.
Job Requirements:
Must have high school diploma or equivalent. Previous work experience as a nurse assistant or completion of a nursing assistant training program is required. Nursing Assistant certification is preferred, must be able to provide basic nursing care to patients of all ages: neonates to geriatric population. Demonstrates teamwork and self-direction.
