Oversees the month end close process including preparing monthly journal entries and reviewing income statement balance sheet for reasonableness and accuracy, prepares the monthly balance sheet reconciliations and posts to Team Room, oversees the preparation and distribution of payroll, assists in the preparation of the annual budget and quarterly forecasts in conjunction with the Hospital CFO, attends and participates in monthly Department Operating Reviews with department managers, assists in the preparation of the Medicare Cost Report as needed, assists the independent auditors and Medicare auditors as needed, assists in the preparation of the annual income tax return as needed, and other financial analysis or projects as requested by the CFO.

Radiology/Imaging Manager

Hillcrest Healthcare System consists of The system today consists of 7 hospitals: Hillcrest Medical Center, Hillcrest Hospital South, Oklahoma Heart Institute, Bailey Medical Center, Hillcrest Hospital Cushing, Hillcrest Hospital Claremore, and Hillcrest Hospital Henryetta.

At Hillcrest Hospital Cushing we have an immediate need for a Radiology/Imaging Manager.

The ideal candidate will be responsible for the following:

  • Managing, planing, organizing and directing all activities of the Diagnostic Imaging Department.
  • Establish goals, objectives and standards of performance
  • Oversight of Policy and Procedures, Continuous Quality Improvement, Governmental Agency Regulations (to include TJC, State and Government inspections)
  • Preparing departmental budget
  • 24 hours a day oversight of the department
  • Giving direct input into decisions on hiring and terminating of departmental employees

Education: Vocational/Technical; Bachelor's Degree preferred

Experience: 5 Years of Tech Experience; 2-3 Years of Supervisory/Management Experience

Sr. Financial Operations Manager

This role will provide financial support to directly senior management and facilities through performance reporting, budgeting, and financial analysis. This position will report directly to the Assitant CFO for the Hillcrest Medical Center. The ideal candidate will possess the ability to transfer into an Assistant CFO position within 18-24 months.

The Sr. Manager of Financial Operations will have responsibilities including, but not limited to: financial forecasting, operational pro forma, key performance indicator review, expense controls, volume trending, revenue cycle analysis, creating and managing financial databases, constructing and presenting monthly operating reports, and much more.

In addition to the above responsible, essential functions will be as follows:

  • Provide insight to operational leaders on trends and opportunities for growth
  • Monthly financial reviews
  • Forecasting and budgeting
  • Operational modeling and M&A modeling
  • Capital expenditure analysis
  • Metrics review " revenue, expenses, collections, volumes, etc
  • Work with third parties to establish financing for equipment and large capital projects
  • Lead projects to implement financial process changes that effect both revenue cycle and expense control
  • Special transactions review " equity changes, relocations, M&A
  • Present financial results internally and externally
  • Coach facility leaders on financial matters and areas for improvement

Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree in Accounting or Finance
  • Advanced degree such as MBA, MAcc preferred
  • 3-5 years of accounting and finance operations experience in a healthcare setting
  • Strong analytical and critical thinking skills
  • Strong business acumen
  • Advanced skills with Microsoft Office Suite is a must

Compensation:

Competitive based on skill set and experience.

Lab Manager

Hillcrest Healthcare System consists of The system today consists of 7 hospitals: Hillcrest Medical Center, Hillcrest Hospital South, Oklahoma Heart Institute, Bailey Medical Center, Hillcrest Hospital Cushing, Hillcrest Hospital Claremore, and Hillcrest Hospital Henryetta.

At Hillcrest Hospital Cushing we have an immediate need for a Lab Manager.

The ideal candidate will have a variety of responsibilities including the following:

  • Direct and control daily activity of all areas of departments for delivery of patient care, record retention and associated functions.
  • Ensure department is in compliance with regulatory agencies and state health department.
  • Be responsible for departments finances/budgeting.
  • Complete reports and present timely communication to the hospital's administration concerning cost containment or budgetary matters.
  • Maintain responsibility for long-term strategic planning and development of operations.
  • Plan, design, and implement new facilities and/or systems.

Individuals within this job classification are accountable for providing observation of cardiac monitors in the Central Monitoring Unit. The Monitor Technician must be able to demonstrate an understanding of the principles of electrocardiography and recognize cardiac arrhythmias. They must possess the knowledge and skills necessary to provide care appropriate to the age of the patients served in the patient care areas as well as recognize and respond to life-threatening situations. This individual must demonstrate knowledge of the principles of growth and development over the life span and possess the ability to function in a support role to the patient care staff. This individual must also understand the workings of the monitoring unit in relation to the patient care units so that appropriate information is given to the patient care areas in an efficient and timely manner.

This position is accountable for operating the M.R.I. scanner, transportation of patients to and from the department, handling telephone calls for scheduling patients, answering questions, and calling reports of exams. The incumbent must be able to start an IV line to administer contrast fluid. Must be able to handle patient support equipment, i.e. I.V. pumps and pulse oximeters. Must help clean rooms and equipment and order supplies. Help supervisor with daily operations of the M.R.I. Department. Must be registered or registry eligible with ASRT (American Society of Radiologic Technologists).

The incumbent must be able to maintain a high standard of imaging and positioning to acquire a quality scan. Must be able to handle multiple demands simultaneously and keep a helpful attitude towards patients, their families, office personnel, physicians, and associates. Must be able to coordinate patient prepping and scanning to maximize smooth patient flow. Must be available for 24-hour call back with a 30-minute response time. Must be able to help move patients when needed.

The incumbent must be able to demonstrate the knowledge and skills necessary to provide care appropriate to the age of the patients served in his or her assigned area. The individual must demonstrate knowledge of the principles of growth and development over the lifespan and possess the ability to assess data reflective of the patient's status and interpret the appropriate information needed to identify each patient's requirements relative to his or her age-specific needs, and provide the care needed as described in the department's competency plan. Will participate in performance improvement initiatives. Will assist with other activities as deemed necessary for the day to day operation of the department.
Associate Degree, experience with G E MRI Equipment, MUST have 1-3 yrs exp, License / Certification ARRT (MR)

Unit Description:
BSA Information Services is comprised of technology, information security, desktop support, and application support teams. Success of the department is dependent on the ability to work across teams in a collaborative, supportive environment. We believe IT can positively impact patient outcomes, therefore we are committed to the success of our end users by providing the tools to care for our patients in an atmosphere of kindness and respect.

Job Summary:

Applies knowledge and ingenuity to develop solutions and design systems while considering the limitations imposed by practicality, regulation, safety, and cost. Provides network engineering services for projects and maintains and optimizes the data network infrastructure. Includes updating network documentation, conducting utilization studies and the establishment of fault notification procedures. Coordinates the configuration, installation and the general troubleshooting of network hardware and possibly software. Provides remote support for facilities throughout the organization. This position will work closely with other members of the BSA information services team to support the overall mission of the company and its long-term strategic business initiatives.

Licenses and Certifications :

Required Associates' Degree in Information Systems, Computer Science or similar field or equivalent technical training

One of the following certifications preferred: current applicable CCNA (Routing and Switching, Data Center, Wireless). Current applicable CCNP (Routing and Switching, Data Center, Wireless) preferred.

Qualifications/Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:

Required 5 years' experience in Information Technology and Systems

Experience in a 24/7 mission critical environment, healthcare preferred

Experience managing a Cisco-based network, including routing, switching and wireless

Experience in the operation and analysis of LAN and WAN packet captures, and Network Analysis

Experience with configuration and troubleshooting of advanced wireless networks including RF spectrum analysis, and interference remediation

Experience designing and maintaining a copper (Base-T) and fiber cable plant

Knowledge of modern network infrastructures, including Ethernet, MPLS, EIGRP, OSPF and BPG networks

Knowledge of modern switch infrastructures PVST/MST, Port Channel configuration, Dot1.Q Trunking, VTP, QOS/COS

Knowledge of Cisco data center technologies including Nexus vPC, FEX

Knowledge of enterprise security and monitoring with firewalls, IPS and SNMP/Syslog.

Experience with managing DNS, DHCP, & WINS protocols

Experience managing VPNs

Experience scripting for systems administration

Experience with certificate services (X.509) a plus

Knowledge of authentication protocols (RADIUS, TACACS, LDAP) a plus

Experience of systems management and monitoring a plus

Experience with Intel system virtualization a plus

Knowledge of Windows server class operating systems a plus

Knowledge of Linux server class operating systems a plus

Proficient use of Microsoft Office

Must have good communication skills both oral and written.

Must be able to be productive in a team environment with minimal supervision.

Must be able to work well with employees at all levels.

Must consistently exhibit superior critical thinking and problem solving.

Must be able to make incremental progress on multiple projects and initiatives simultaneously.

Must be attentive to details as it relates to system documentation, standard operating practices and rack configurations.

Must be a self-motivated leaner who will independently seek educational opportunities.

Must utilize good Change Management and follow the established Change management process.

Upholds information security policies.

Upholds information services department polices.

Upholds all corporate policies.

Strives to develop knowledge of emerging industry practices when solving problems.

Job Summary:

The PET CT Technologist provides health care services applying radioactive tracer, gamma camera, and computed tomography to assist in diagnosis. The PET CT Technologist performs PET CT procedures and related techniques, producing images for interpretation which were requested by a licensed practitioner. Responsibilities include collaboration with the Administrative and Medical Directors on technical issues, monitoring of equipment maintenance, performance of quality control procedures, participation in service development and budget initiatives, and maintenance of imaging protocols. Exercises professional judgment in performance of services and maintains a demeanor complementary to medical ethics. Provides appropriate patient care and recognizes patient conditions essential for successful completion of the procedure. The PET CT Technologist adheres to national, institutional and/or department standards, policies, and procedures requiring patient care which includes inpatient and outpatient ranging in age from pediatric to geriatric age groups.

Licenses and Certifications:

  • Graduation from a Joint Commission-accredited Nuclear Medicine program
  • Current State of Texas license in Nuclear Medicine Technology and current certification by NMTCB, ARRT-N or ASCP-N.
  • C urrent CPR certification
  • BS in Physics, Chemistry, Biology, or Math is desired but a candidate with exceptional capabilities or in-depth experience will be considered

Qualifications/Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:

  • One year experience preferred but, candidates finished with training and registered or registry eligible will be considered.
  • Great communication skills
  • Good computer skills
  • Excellent problem solving skills

You're going to LOVE Lovelace!

About us: Lovelace Medical Center is a patient-centered hospital featuring state-of-the-art equipment and a round-the-clock Emergency Department. We offer high-quality, high-tech medicine in a facility that has become a symbol of health and wellness in the heart of the city we serve.

Lovelace Medical Center is hiring a Nurse Abstractor.

  • Responsible for reviewing patient medical records to assure quality standards are achieved and that documentation is within compliance with established regulatory agencies.

  • Identifies opportunities for improvement during point of care record review and/or during data abstraction and facilitates onsite improvements as directed by the Director of Quality Management.

  • Abstracts moderate to complex data elements for Core Measures, STS, ACC-NCDR and enters into required data base(s) in a timely and accurate fashion.

  • Performs quality process improvement activities as directed, including identifying performance improvement opportunities and assisting the Director of Quality Management with problem solving and implementing solutions, developing and maintaining statistical databases, developing and producing complex reports and assisting clinical/operational leadership and staff with quality projects as assigned.

  • Familiarizes self with regulatory requirements for performance improvement, quality assessment and patient safety.

Qualifications:

  • Minimum: Bachelor's Degree of Science in Nursing.

  • Education may be substituted for relevant nursing experience in accordance to policy.

  • Ability to analyze and interpret data.

  • Ability to organize workflow, function independently and manage own time and work tasks.

  • Strong interpersonal communication skills.

  • Ability to deal calmly, courteously and efficiently with people.

  • Ability to maintain accuracy and consistency and compile moderately complex reports.

  • Computer skills minimally include data entry abilities, Excel and Word.

  • Two (2) years of previous job-related experience.

  • Experience may be substituted for relevant education in accordance to policy.

  • Valid NM Nursing license or NM compact License (within 90 days of hire).

Individuals within this job classification are accountable for activities of daily living to patients under the supervision of a registered nurse or licensed practical nurse. The Nurse Assistant must be able to demonstrate the knowledge and skills necessary to provide care appropriate to the age of the patients served on the assigned unit. This individual must demonstrate knowledge of the principles of growth and development over the life span and possess the ability to function in an assistive role to the licensed nurse in the provision of technical and environmental patient care activities as delegated by and under the supervision of the licensed staff. The NA will be responsible for: activities of daily living, elimination, infection control, body mechanics, safety and emergency care as indicated. He/she is expected to adhere to and abide by the rules and regulations set forth by the Oklahoma Nursing Practice Act.

PRN POSITION--Responsible for planning, organizing, supervising, and rendering occupational therapy services to patients/clients of all ages who have impairments, functional limitations, disabilities, or changes in physical function and health status resulting from injury, disease, or other causes; provide prevention and wellness services, including screenings and health promotion. Communicate and document results of treatment including patients' progress toward established goals according to department's policies and procedures. The incumbent serves as a resource person for the team and the department; participates in orientation of new staff therapists, physicians and other health personnel. The occupational therapist works within practice guidelines as defined by Oklahoma state law.
*The Occupational Therapist is responsible for organizing and conducting medically prescribed therapy treatment to individuals with developmental, physical, cognitive and/or emotional impairments, disabilities and/or handicaps, with the goal of helping the patient attain a maximum level of independence/performance. The Therapist plans treatment programs within an interdisciplinary environment. This individual also is responsible for documentation and communication of all treatment information to appropriate parties. This position will adhere to all policies, procedures and regulations to ensure patient safety and compliance.

-Graduate from accredited OT program with a minimum of a Bachelor's Degree
-Oklahoma license, license eligible or temporary letter to practice
-Current CPR/BLS

Job Summary:

Provision and documentation of examinations, evaluations, establish functional OT diagnosis, prognoses and plans of care including formulation of treatment goals, providing occupational therapy intervention to patients, measuring and reporting outcomes and formulating and carrying out discharge plans. Supervision of licensed and non-licensed assigned staff or students. Interact and practice in collaboration with other professionals. Individuals must comply with the Texas Occupational Therapy Practice Acts and Rules.

License/Certification/Education:

OT licensed in the state of Texas

CPR certified from the American Heart Association or the American Red Cross

Qualifications/Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:

Occupational Therapy experience in an acute care hospital and/or rehabilitation facility preferred

Ability to effectively function as part of a multi-disciplinary team

Ability to supervise, delegate and communicate with multiple team members

Top notch organizational and follow-through skills

Excellent communication skills (written and verbal)

Computer usage required EMR and Soarian documentation

Compassionate and committed to providing excellent customer service

Schedule Details:

Status: Full-time

Days: Monday Friday with Saturday/Sunday rotation

Hours: 8:00 AM 5:00 PM

Work Schedule: 8.00

Shift: 1st - Day

Hillcrest Hospital Henryetta, located in Henryetta, OK, is a provider of health care services, delivered with compassion for patients an their families, with respect for employees, physicans and other health professionals, with accountability for our fiscal and ethical performance and with responsiblity for the communities we serve.

The Office Manager will be responsible for supervising and participating in the daily operations of the hospital's Specialty Clinic practice. Assigns and schedules work duties and provides orientation and training to personnel. Monitors and oversees work activities, maintains medical and office supplies and is responsible for the operational budget. Identifies and recommends improvements in work procedures. Performs as primary liaison between administration, physicians and outside organizations/vendors to coordinate busines practices, accomplish directives and identify and facilitate the resolution of problems within general business operations and the delivery of patient care. Consistently promotes good customer service and effective working relationships, both internally and externally.

Requirements include:

Associates degree or above from an accredited university/college or program preferred, High School diploma/GED required

2-3 years office management experience for a multi-physician practice preferred

Must be able to function at a high level of independence and autonomy

Office Manager I, Utica Park Clinic

Utica Park Clinic is the physicians group of Hillcrest HealthCare System. With over 35 locations throughout northeastern Oklahoma, most patients enjoy the convenience of a location that is close to home. UPC patients have consistently given top ratings (98% patient satisfaction scores) for the quality of care they receive. When choosing a healthcare provider, you can be confident that you'll find a good match at Utica Park Clinic.

The Office Manager is responsible for supervising and participating in the daily operations of the practice. Specific duties include assigning/scheduling work duties, providing orientation/training to personnel, monitoring/overseeing work flow, and maintaining the operational budget. This individual also will be expected to identify and recommend improvements in work procedures. This position will adhere to all policies, procedures and regulations to ensure patient safety and compliance.

Prefer 3-5 years management experience for multi-physician practice. Must have high school diploma or GED.

Position is located at 7600 South Lewis Ave.

OR Tech, Hillcrest Hospital Claremore - FT- 6:45A-3:15P W/CALL

At Hillcrest Hospital Claremore, we're proud to offer advanced services right here at home from our Peggy V. Helmerich Birthing Center, to outpatient surgeries and preventative care. And when you need emergency care, our 24/7 emergency physician staffed ER is right where you want it to be close by- to give you prompt medical treatment. Supports the organization's mission, vision and values. Responsible for demonstrating the knowledge and skills to carry out tasks and functions in the nursing care and preparation of patients for surgical procedure, and assisting surgeons during the surgical procedure; functions as a member of the sterile team include creating and maintaining a sterile field, issuing instruments to the surgeon.
High School graduate or equivalent
Ability to follow oral and written instructions.
Must possess good manual dexterity, good hearing and eyesight.
Emotional demands require working in a stressful fast-paced environment.
Must be able to move and walk freely and stand for an extended time period, as well as lift, bend and transport.
Must have the ability to multitask.
Previous experience in sterile technique, OR supplies and Equipment preferred - not required
Previous experience in sterile process preferred - not required.

The OR Tech is responsible for the transport and care of patients to and from the department at the request and direction of licensed personnel and assist with daily activities of the OR/PACU/OPS/Surgery departments. The OR Tech is cross-trained to assist in turning over surgical suites, holding extremities, and other duties as assigned. He/She is responsible for working under the supervision of the RN and within the scope of practice in the surgery department by providing direct and indirect care based on individual needs as determined by anesthesia staff. This position is responsible for collaborating with anesthesia staff and preparing OR suites and procedures, orders, stocking, and sterilizing equipment necessary for the anesthesia staff.

High school diploma or equivalent

Exhibit proficiency in patient care and have good oral communication skills. Must be able to follow instructions according to department and hospital standards under the supervision of a licensed medial professional. Must be emotionally mature and able to work under stressful situations.

Prefer at least on year healthcare experience

Must obtain and keep current BLS certification

Unit Description:
BSA provides 24 hour paramedic care through our ambulance service, which responds to emergencies in Canyon and 825 square miles of Randall County. BSA EMS staffs two stations 24/7/365, one in northern Randall County and one in Canyon.

Job Summary:

The Paramedic is responsible for responding to emergency calls to provide efficient and immediate care to the critically ill and injured, and transports the patient to a medical facility. Determine the nature & extent of the patient's condition. Provides appropriate emergency care & transports patient when necessary. Assess injuries and renders emergency medical care to injured or ill individuals. Transport injured or sick individuals to medical facility.

Licenses and Certifications:

Current TX Paramedic license is required

National Registry certification is preferred

Current ACLS, PHTLS, PALS or PEPP is required within 80 days of employment

American Heart Association Healthcare Provider CPR is required

Valid minimum Class C Texas Driver License with restriction "A" permissible

Must be 21 years of age or older with excellent driving record

Completion of the following Department of Homeland Security, Federal Emergency Management Agency National Incident Management System (NIMS) courses: IS-100, IS-200, IS-700, IS-800.A is required within 80 days of employment

Qualifications/Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:

Previous field experience is strongly preferred

Demonstrates competency handling emergencies utilizing all BLS equipment and skills in accordance with all local protocols and behavioral objectives in the US Department of Transportation EMT-Basic curriculum.

Use good judgment and remain calm in high stress situations including situations not covered by written or verbal instructions.

Calculate weight and volume ratios and read small print, both under life-threatening time constraints.

Accurately discern street sign and address numbers and able to read maps

Must have good critical thinking skills and perform duties under intermittent or continuous physiological duress

Must have excellent communication and customer service skills required

Schedule Details:

Weekly shifts include a 24 and 12-hour shift

Including weekends and holidays; additional hours, as required

Including weekends and holidays; additional hours, as required

Unit Description:
BSA provides 24 hour paramedic care through our ambulance service, which responds to emergencies in Canyon and 825 square miles of Randall County. BSA EMS staffs two stations 24/7/365, one in northern Randall County and one in Canyon.

Job Summary:

The Paramedic is responsible for responding to emergency calls to provide efficient and immediate care to the critically ill and injured, and transports the patient to a medical facility. Determine the nature & extent of the patient's condition. Provides appropriate emergency care & transports patient when necessary. Assess injuries and renders emergency medical care to injured or ill individuals. Transport injured or sick individuals to medical facility.

Licenses and Certifications:

Current TX Paramedic license is required

National Registry certification is preferred

Current ACLS, PHTLS, PALS or PEPP is required within 80 days of employment

American Heart Association Healthcare Provider CPR is required

Valid minimum Class C Texas Driver License with restriction "A" permissible

Must be 21 years of age or older with excellent driving record

Completion of the following Department of Homeland Security, Federal Emergency Management Agency National Incident Management System (NIMS) courses: IS-100, IS-200, IS-700, IS-800.A is required within 80 days of employment

Qualifications/Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:

Previous field experience is strongly preferred

Demonstrates competency handling emergencies utilizing all BLS equipment and skills in accordance with all local protocols and behavioral objectives in the US Department of Transportation EMT-Basic curriculum.

Use good judgment and remain calm in high stress situations including situations not covered by written or verbal instructions.

Calculate weight and volume ratios and read small print, both under life-threatening time constraints.

Accurately discern street sign and address numbers and able to read maps

Must have good critical thinking skills and perform duties under intermittent or continuous physiological duress

Must have excellent communication and customer service skills required

Schedule Details:

Weekly shifts include a 24 and 12-hour shift

Including weekends and holidays; additional hours, as required

Provides comprehensive diagnostic and therapeutic services to all appropriate patients with speech, language, hearing, swallowing and/or cognitive deficits. Provide consultation and staff/family education regarding communication and swallowing.

Patient access representatives are accountable for greeting and directing patients and visitors. Excellent customer service skills are a must. Representatives must have the ability to properly collect and enter financial and demographic information into a computer, maintain patient confidentiality, provide clear and concise information to those who request it, be able to handle multiple tasks at one time, and be detail-oriented. The position tends to be fast-paced and somewhat stressful. Representatives are responsible for identifying patients, inputting financial and demographic information, and collecting monies due for co-pays. Individuals must be physically capable of transporting patients and their luggage.

This position will serve as additional support in our outpatient registration and pre-registration scheduling department. Key role of this position is outpatient and inpatient collections. This individual is also responsible for keying charges and payments for all payor logs. Must be able to assist telephone inquiries from patients. Typing and computer skills are needed for filling out claim forms, inquiries on follow up claims, etc.

Responsible for registration of patients. Conducts patient interviews to obtain required information, complete requested forms, and obtain signatures. Explains hospital's financial policy. Distributes information to required hospital departments.

Must observe professional ethics in maintaining confidential information acquired regarding personal, financial, medical or employment of patients, families, and employees of HHS. Must follow and enforce accepted safety practices for patients and HHS. Must report hazards and initiate appropriate action. Must participate in safety instructional programs.

High school diploma or GED equivalent

Knowledge of medical terminology. Good typing and computer skills. Flexible schedule.

The position tends to be fast-paced and somewhat stressful. Representatives are responsible for identifying patients, inputting financial and demographic information, and collecting monies due for co-pays. Individuals must be physically capable of transporting patients and their luggage.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Responsible for greeting and directing the patients and public upon their arrival at the hospital. Processes all admitting paperwork for all preadmission, surgical patients, outpatient physical therapy patients, emergency room and direct admissions. Provide support to the Switchboard operator.

Daily Processes & Procedures for Daily Functions:

  • Answer multi-line switchboard in a pleasant, professional manner and give information to callers, take messages, or transfer calls to appropriate individuals.
  • Greet visitors and patients in a polite, prompt helpful manner; handle their inquiries, and direct them to the appropriate persons according to their needs.
  • Conduct searches to find needed information, using such sources as the Medicaid website.
  • Complete all admitting forms in accordance with the hospital's procedures, generate information necessary for billing; registration and scheduling of physical therapy patients
  • Responsible for providing change for patients, families and employees. Daily reconciliation of a cash drawer.
  • Performs various special duties for the Business Office such as collecting payments and providing receipts; inputting charges, scanning documents into Trakker system.
  • Maintains clean, orderly registration area. Stock coffee supplies in the dining area.
  • Operate office equipment such as fax machines, copiers, and phone systems, and use computers for spreadsheet, word processing, database management, and other applications.
  • Maintain an accurate level of office supplies in order to facilitate smooth departmental operations.

JOB REQUIREMENTS

Previous experience in hospital or medical office in admissions or similar experience preferred.

High school diploma

Proficient in Microsoft office

Hillcrest Hospital Claremore - PBX Operator/Patient Access Representative - (PART TIME POSITION) - Varied

At Hillcrest Hospital Claremore, we're proud to offer advanced services right here at home from our New Beginning Birthing Center, to outpatient surgeries and preventative care. And when you need emergency care, our 24/7 emergency physician staffed ER is right where you want it to be close by- to give you prompt medical treatment. In addition, this position operates multiple line telephone switchboard to relay incoming, outgoing and interoffice calls and performs miscellaneous hospital communications and clerical duties as assigned. Answers questions of callers accordingly and gives visitor information as needed. Verbal ability is required in order to converse effectively and to understand orders given under emergency conditions. Announces close of visiting hours. May sort incoming mail for distributing. Responsible for personnel and physician paging. Greets and interviews patients and their family members in the ER with all types of billing and financial inquiries. Responsible for billing follow up and collections of all non-government accounts to the point of finalization.

Job Requirements:

High School graduate or equivalent; thorough knowledge of insurance plans and managed care; type greater than 45 words per minute; positive professional appearance and attitude; excellent communication and interpersonal skills required.

Patient Care Coordinator (RN) for UPC Population Health Department - South Creek Internal Medicine

Individuals within this job classification are accountable for assessing,planning implementing evaluating and documenting patient related care activities with a focus on the CMS target diagnosis of AMI,CHF,COPD and pneumonia and transition management of these patients for 30 days after an acute care inpatient discharge. The transition Care Nurse-RN will be expected to adhere to and abide by the rules and regulations set forth by the Oklahoma Nursing Practice Act.

The Transition care nurse will work with a multidisciplinary healthcare team to provide patient centered care across the health care continuum for Medicare (fee for service and Medicare advantage plan) patients. Will assist in the delivery of timely preventive care, care coordination and management across the medical neighborhood. Will collaborate with direct care nurses, hospitalists, case managers, patients,caregivers, PCP providers and providers care coordinators.

The Transition care nurse will demonstrate the ability to interpret and convey complex information, using critical thinking skills. Will demonstrate effective, professional, tackful and appropriate, written verbal and non-verbal communication skills with patients and family members, medical staff, colleagues, other department and vendors, Will demonstrate office teaching techniques, applying adult learning principles motivational interviewing techniques. Will be proficient in use of MIDAS and hospital/provider EMRs. Will knowledgeable of workplace health and safety guidelines, preventive health maintenance, national evidence based guidelines, patient safety and case management.

Position is located at 9001 S. 101st E. Avenue, Suite 230.

Lovelace Women's Hospital is hiring a Patient Care Tech

The Patient Care Tech performs all duties of the Patient Care Tech as defined by department competencies.

  • Knowledge of medical terminology preferred
  • Desired: Experience in a healthcare setting
  • BLS Required

Job Summary:
The Patient Care Tech is responsible for the direct and indirect patient care duties assigned to them by the Registered Nurse, following the policies and procedures of the institution. The Patient Care Tech will assist with patient care and comfort, hygiene and ADL's (Activities of Daily Living) including bed baths, restroom assistance and linen changes, nutrition, mobility, transport, and ensure patient safety with prompt response to patient request and call lights. The Patient Care Tech will assist with the management and flow of the unit by assisting with admits, discharges, transfer/transport patients, electronic patient documentation, answers telephones, collect and delivers specimens.

Licenses and Certifications:

CPR Heartsaver AED certified from American Heart Association or American Red Cross required

Qualifications/Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:

- Previous hospital based Patient Care Assistant, Medical Assistant, EMT-B and/or CNA preferred but not required

- Texas CNA certificate; current or previously held in good standing
- Nursing students currently enrolled in an ADN or BSN accrediated school of nursing program with either - Intro to Nursing complete and/or presently in the first semester of clinicals

- Acute care setting of patient drains, tubes, and specimen collection

- Acute care setting of infection control protocols

- Able to pass the BSA Acute Care Technical Skills Competency to include but not limited to: Manual

Blood Pressure,

- I & O Calculation, Measure Height and Weight, Glucose Monitoring

- Ability to recognize important patient observations and communicate it to the appropriate team member

- Ability to manipulate, position, transfer and ambulate various size patients both full assist or partial

assist

- Basic addition and subtraction skills required

- Computer skills necessary; minimum 25wpm accurate EMR and Soarian documentation

- Medical terminology a plus

- Prioritize multiple requests

- Ability to multi-task constantly and tolerate multiple interruptions

- Clear and effective communication (written and verbal) with patients, families and other healthcare professionals

- Outgoing; friendly and compassionate customer service skills needed; must be committed to patient

and family satisfaction

Schedule Details:

- Full Time
- 3rd Shift, 7:00 P.M. - 7:00 A.M.
- Varied Days

job.jobTitle: PATIENT CARE TECH., NURSING SERVICE RESOURCE
job.jobDescription:
Job Summary:
The Patient Care Technician is responsible for the direct and indirect patient care duties assigned to them by the Registered Nurse, following the policies and procedures of the institution. The Patient Care Technician will assist with patient care and comfort, hygiene and ADL's (Activities of Daily Living) including bed baths, restroom assistance and linen changes, nutrition, mobility, transport, and ensure patient safety with prompt response to patient request and call lights. The Patient Care Tech will assist with the management and flow of the unit by assisting with admits, discharges, transfer/transport patients, electronic patient documentation, answers telephones, collect and delivers specimens.

The Resource team staff of Patient Care Technicians will primarily float to the medical surgical units of the 4th, 5th, 6th, 7th and 8th floors.

Requirements, Licenses and Certifications:
Minimum of 18-years of age

CPR Heartsaver AED certified from American Heart Association or American Red Cross required


Qualifications/Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:

Previous hospital based Patient Care Assistant, Medical Assistant, EMT-B and/or CNA preferred but not required

Texas CNA certificate; current or previously held in good standing
Nursing students currently enrolled in an ADN or BSN accrediated school of nursing program with either Intro to Nursing or Nursing Skills complete and/or presently in the first semester of clinicals

Acute care setting of patient drains, tubes, and specimen collection

Acute care setting of infection control protocols

Able to pass the BSA Acute Care Technical Skills Competency to include but not limited to: Manual Blood Pressure,

I & O Calculation, Measure Height and Weight, Glucose Monitoring

Ability to recognize important patient observations and communicate it to the appropriate team member

Ability to manipulate, position, transfer and ambulate various size patients both full assist or partial assist

Basic addition and subtraction skills required

Computer skills necessary; minimum 25wpm accurate EMR and Soarian documentation

Medical terminology a plus

Prioritize multiple requests

Ability to multi-task constantly and tolerate multiple interruptions

Clear and effective communication (written and verbal) with patients, families and other healthcare professionals

Outgoing; friendly and compassionate customer service skills needed; must be committed to patient and family satisfaction


Schedule Details:

PRN flexible scheduleing for 24 -to- 48 hrs per pay period

Day shift 7:00am to 7:00pm

Minimum of 4 shifts per 4-week schedule (minimum equals 1 shift per week) with 2 shifts per week preferred

Days worked may vary around school schedule - must be available to work weekends and holidays

job.jobDescription:
Job Summary:
The Patient Care Technician is responsible for the direct and indirect patient care duties assigned to them by the Registered Nurse, following the policies and procedures of the institution. The Patient Care Technician will assist with patient care and comfort, hygiene and ADL's (Activities of Daily Living) including bed baths, restroom assistance and linen changes, nutrition, mobility, transport, and ensure patient safety with prompt response to patient request and call lights. The Patient Care Tech will assist with the management and flow of the unit by assisting with admits, discharges, transfer/transport patients, electronic patient documentation, answers telephones, collect and delivers specimens.

The Resource team staff of Patient Care Technicians will primarily float to the medical surgical units of the 4th, 5th, 6th, 7th and 8th floors.

Requirements, Licenses and Certifications:
Minimum of 18-years of age

CPR Heartsaver AED certified from American Heart Association or American Red Cross required


Qualifications/Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:

Previous hospital based Patient Care Assistant, Medical Assistant, EMT-B and/or CNA preferred but not required

Texas CNA certificate; current or previously held in good standing
Nursing students currently enrolled in an ADN or BSN accrediated school of nursing program with either Intro to Nursing or Nursing Skills complete and/or presently in the first semester of clinicals

Acute care setting of patient drains, tubes, and specimen collection

Acute care setting of infection control protocols

Able to pass the BSA Acute Care Technical Skills Competency to include but not limited to: Manual Blood Pressure,

I & O Calculation, Measure Height and Weight, Glucose Monitoring

Ability to recognize important patient observations and communicate it to the appropriate team member

Ability to manipulate, position, transfer and ambulate various size patients both full assist or partial assist

Basic addition and subtraction skills required

Computer skills necessary; minimum 25wpm accurate EMR and Soarian documentation

Medical terminology a plus

Prioritize multiple requests

Ability to multi-task constantly and tolerate multiple interruptions

Clear and effective communication (written and verbal) with patients, families and other healthcare professionals

Outgoing; friendly and compassionate customer service skills needed; must be committed to patient and family satisfaction


Schedule Details:

PRN flexible scheduleing for 24 -to- 48 hrs per pay period

Day shift 7:00am to 7:00pm

Minimum of 4 shifts per 4-week schedule (minimum equals 1 shift per week) with 2 shifts per week preferred

Days worked may vary around school schedule - must be available to work weekends and holidays

The BSA Emergency Department proudly serves a multi-state area of the Texas Panhandle, New Mexico, Oklahoma, Colorado and Kansas. The BSA ED averages 5,250 patients per month that are treated by a by a team that consist of Board Certified Emergency physicians and a highly competent compassionate ED staff.

You're going to LOVE Lovelace!

About us: Lovelace Medical Center is a patient-centered hospital featuring state-of-the-art equipment and a round-the-clock Emergency Department. We offer high-quality, high-tech medicine in a facility that has become a symbol of health and wellness in the heart of the city we serve.

Lovelace Medical Center is hiring a Patient Care Technician.

  • Under the direct supervision of the Nurse Manager or RN and within the scope of training and guidelines of the hospital policies, performs basic patient care tasks, within the scope of training and guidelines of the hospital policies.
  • Adheres to policies, procedures and regulations to ensure compliance and patient safety.

Qualifications:

  • Minimum: High School Diploma or GED equivalent
  • Desired: Completion of a Medical Assistant, Nurse Tech, or Certified Nursing Assistant program.
  • Experience in Phlebotomy or completion of a Phlebotomy course is preferred.
  • Knowledge of medical terminology is preferred.

  • Desired: Experience in a healthcare setting.

  • BLS Required.

Why Lovelace?

DNV Accredited

Named to Becker's Hospital Review's list of 100 Hospitals with Great Neurosurgery and Spine Programs

Truven Health Analytics named Lovelace Health System among the top 20 percent of health systems in the country, and is the only health system recognized for this honor in New Mexico

Named one of the 150 Great Places to Work in Healthcare by Becker's Hospital Review

Job Summary:
The PCA is responsible for the direct and indirect patient care duties assigned to them by the Registered Nurse, following the policies and procedures of the institution. The PCA will assist with patient care and comfort, hygiene/ADL's including bed baths and linen changes, nutrition, mobility, transport, and ensure patient safety with prompt response to patient request and call lights. The PCA will assist with the management and flow of the unit by assisting with admits, discharges, transfer/transport patients, electronic patient documentation, answers telephones, collect and delivers specimens.

The training consists of classroom instruction, demonstration of skills with skills training, clinical setting assignments with Buddy Preceptors, and a Technical Skills Competency. Shifts are a combination of 8-hours to 12-hours; classroom instruction is generally a week of 8-hour days then transition into 12-hour shifts with the possibility of days, evenings and nights depending on your actual shift.

Licenses and Certifications:

CPR Heartsaver AED certified from American Heart Association or American Red Cross required

Qualifications/Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:

Previous hospital based Patient Care Assistant and/or CNA experience preferred

Texas CNA certificate; current or previously held in good standing

Successful completion of the BSA Patient Care Assistant on-the-job training (on average a 6-week paid program)

Acute care setting of patient drains, tubes, and specimen collection

Acute care setting of infection control protocols

Able to pass the BSA Acute Care Technical Skills Competency to include but not limited to: Manual Blood Pressure,

I & O Calculation, Measure Height and Weight, Glucose Monitoring

Ability to recognize important patient observations and communicate it to the appropriate team member

Ability to manipulate, position, transfer and ambulate various size patients both full assist or partial assist

Basic addition and subtraction skills required

Computer skills necessary; minimum 25wpm accurate EMR and Soarian documentation

Medical terminology a plus

Prioritize multiple requests

Ability to multi-task constantly and tolerate multiple interruptions

Clear and effective communication (written and verbal) with patients, families and other healthcare professionals

Outgoing; friendly and compassionate customer service skills needed; must be committed to patient and family satisfaction

Schedule Details:

Status: Part Time

Days: Varied

Hours: 7:00 AM - 7:00 PM

Work Schedule: 12.00

Shift: 1st - Day

job.jobTitle: PATIENT CARE UNIT COORDINATOR, CRITICAL CARE
job.jobDescription:
Job Summary:
The Patient Care Unit Coordinator will float between unit secretary and patient care duties; generally a 50/50 split. Unit secretary duties are responding to all inquires at the nurse's station, processing orders, keeping charts current, answering phones and call lights and assisting the licensed nursing staff as needed. The Patient Care Technician duties are assisting with patient care under the direction of the licensed staff along with patient comfort, hygiene/ADL's to include bed baths and linen changes, mobility and transport, patient safety, and prompt response to patient request and call lights and vital signs.

Licenses and Certifications:

Current Texas CNA certificate

CPR certified from the American Heart Association or American Red Cross


Qualifications/Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:

Previous hospital based Patient Care Assistant/Nurse Tech/Unit Secretary or Medical Assistant experience desired
ADN and/or BSN nursing students with Intro to Nursing Skills or the first semester of clinicals completed preferred

Acute care setting of patient drains, tubes, and specimen collection

Acute care setting of infection control protocols

Vital signs; manual blood pressure, heights/weights, O2 stats, I& O calculations, Glucose monitoring
Ability to recognize important patient observations and communicate it to the appropriate team member
Ability to manipulate, position, transfer and ambulate various size patients both full assist or partial assist

Basic addition and subtraction skills required

Computer skills required; accurate 40+ wpm minimum EMR and Soarian documentation

Medical Terminology a plus

Prioritize multiple requests

Multi-task with ability to handle multiple interruptions

Effective and efficient written and verbal communication skills

Excellent front-line customer service skills


Schedule Details:
PRN minimum availability is 1 12-hr shift per week with preferred of 2-shifts per week based on unit needs

3rd Shift - Nights 7:00pm - 7:00am
Varied days to include possible weekdays, weekends and holiday rotation

Prioritize multiple requests

Multi-task with ability to handle multiple interruptions

Full-time
1st Shift, 7:00AM - 7:00PM
Varied weekdays, weekends and holiday rotation

The Patient Care Tech duties are assisting with patient care under the direction of the licensed staff along with patient comfort, hygiene/ADL's to include bed baths and linen changes, mobility and transport, patient safety, and prompt response to patient request and call lights and vital signs.

Ardent Health Services (AHS) is a national healthcare company headquartered in Nashville, TN. Our subsidiaries own and operate hospitals and multispecialty physician practices in three states. Ardent includes: 3 health systems with 14 hospitals, 2,194 licenses beds, 12,000 employees, and 3 physician groups with 270 employed physicians. Within the industry, we are noted for recognizing that every hospital is as unique as the community it serves. This in-depth understanding of how health care works at the local level is one of our great strengths.

We have an exciting opportunity to join our team as a Payroll Manager. This dynamic position will have oversight over our corporate payroll department which includes exposure to employees working in multiple states and will be a subject matter expert for payroll throughout our organization.

Primary Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Maintains production records, timesheets, and payroll system.
  • Responsible for computing withholding and deductions associated with net earnings.
  • Ensures the accurate processing of wage payments to exempt and nonexempt staff including setup and maintenance of direct deposit, W-4 information, garnishments, child support, tax and levies.
  • Transfers payroll labor accounts distribution as appropriate' analyzes, reconciles and balances data processing and electronic time input batches ensures all systems balance correctly.
  • Interacts with internal and external auditors; provides access to payroll and other related records as required.
  • Maintains records for annual sick worker's compensation audits.
  • Audits and maintains Paid Time Off records for all eligible employees.
  • Compiles and maintains data necessary to calculate and process payments for PTO payoff upon termination.
  • Processes termination documents and final checks.
  • Prepares month-end payroll reconciliation and monthly stats and well as records monthly journal entries based on monthly activity.
  • Responsible for the completion of all year-end reports for all jurisdictions.
  • Assists in the annual budget process as necessary.
  • Answers policy and procedure questions for all levels of employees.
  • Investigates and resolves complex payroll problems according to Labor Code and IRS regulations.
  • Sorts, prioritizes, reviews for accuracy and process incoming payroll/personnel documents.
  • Provides direction and support to hospital payroll staff related to state and federal laws and regulations as well as the company's policies and procedures.
  • Responsible for filing of monthly, quarterly and year-end local, state and federal tax returns.
  • Verifies employment with outside entities such as banks, etc.
  • Completes calendar year-end processing of payroll, including supplemental payrolls, W-2 and other tax forms.
Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities:
  • Ability to provide accurate and efficient service under the stress of constant deadlines.
  • Knowledge of high-volume, multi-state payroll systems, processes, and procedures.
  • Knowledge of public institution personnel/payroll practices and procedures.
  • Ability to make administrative/procedural decisions and judgments.
  • Knowledge and understanding of payroll documentation procedures and requirements.
  • Skill in the use of personal computers and related software applications.
  • Skill in the use of computer spreadsheet (ie Excel), database, and mainframe applications in a Windows environment.
  • Knowledge of federal and state tax laws.
  • Ability to understand and process complex paperwork.
  • Ability to analyze and solve problems.
  • Knowledge of procedures and standards for check processing.
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Ability to audit and maintain financial records.
  • Ability to understand IRS regulations.
  • Ability to use discretion and ensure confidentiality.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's Degree and three (3) to five (5) years of experience or seven (7) years of experience or any similar combination of education and experience.
  • Certified Payroll Professional preferred.
  • Lawson experience preferred.
  • Executive pay and multi-location/state experience preferred.

The Payroll Coordinator is responsible for processing biweekly payroll, garnishments, expense reimbursement files, data entry related to W-4s, direct deposits and paycards, assist with processing of W-2's, assist with out of state tax process, assist with system updates, and all other assigned duties.

This position requires the ability to work independently, think critically, and resolve employee issues in a professional manner. Customer Service and the ability to jump in and work as a team is a must. The Payroll Coordinator must have high attention to detail, maintain confidentiality, and be competent in various software and hardware tools and systems.

Must have a strong payroll background and 3-5 years experience using Kronos timekeeper or Lawson Payroll.

job.jobTitle: Bread & Butter General Surgeon needed in Sunny New Mexico
job.hours: M-F 8-5 / 10 Days shared call per month
job.jobDescription:
GENERAL SURGEON - FULL TIME - LOVELACE REGIONAL HOSPITAL - ROSWELL, NM

Lovelace Regional Hospital - Roswell is seeking to employ a GENERAL SURGEON. This a Bread & Butter General Surgeon opportunity. If you have Vascular experience that's a big plus!

Our hospital, its physicians, providers and staff share a commitment to our community to improve medical care in Southeast New Mexico. Lovelace Regional Hospital-Roswell is poised to grow with you and your family, and we look forward to enhancing and expanding our services to Roswell, Chaves County and Southeast New Mexico.
Call or E-mail Victor Jensen, Physician Recruiter 505-503-3364 victor.jensen@lovelace.com
Roswell - Location & Population:
Located in the southeast New Mexico, Roswell is the county seat of Chaves County. According to the 2010 census, more than 48,000 people live in Roswell.

The major industries here are irrigation farming, dairying, ranching, manufacturing, distribution, petroleum production, and, of course, tourism!

Weather:
Because Roswell is located in the high plains, we have all four seasons for you to enjoy.

While our winters can get cold, they are usually sunny and light snow is fairly common. Our Spring is mild and beautiful! As you'd expect, Summers can get quite hot and temperatures frequently rise to triple digit temperatures.

However, we do get beautiful and cooling thunderstorms during the summer. Fall is mild, but snow is possible in October and November.

job.jobTitle: Lovelace Medical Group is Seeking Hospitalists!
job.jobDescription:
PHYSICIAN - MD / DO - HOSPITALISTS - ALBUQUERQUE, NM

Lovelace Medical Group

The Lovelace Health System, a 6-hospital system serving the greater Albuquerque, New Mexico metropolitan area of over 450,000, is building a hospitalist group to service our four hospitals that care for patients from the city and suburbs. We are interested in internal medicine physicians and other board certified physicians who enjoy working in an all inpatient setting(Hospitalists) . Our hospitalists will be dedicated to working at one of the three facilities within our system, performing standard internal medicine/hospitalist procedures, with some basic critical care procedures an d offering consults on a variety of cases. The schedule is 7 days on and 7 days off, a minimum of 182 shifts per year equals full time. We have part-time and PRN positions as well . The Census target is 16-18 patients per shift . The hospitalist service will have advanced practice providers, project coordinators and a practice manager to oversee day to day hospital administrative duties.

The compensation model will provide TOP TIER salaries and benefits, plus lucrative bonuses based on production and quality. Day and night shifts are available. Nocturnist will be compensated at a higher level, but all positions offer very generous salaries and benefits.

Albuquerque is a great place to live; with the Rio Grande River and the Sandia Mountains in town, this city is a natural choice for outdoor enthusiasts. The high altitude and low humidity of Albuquerque provide about 300 days of sunshine per year to hike, bike, hunt, fish , ski and BBQ all year 'round.

There are good public, private and parochial schools in Albuquerque. The cost of living is very moderate. The city offers museums, entertainment, good shopping, fine dining, including some of the best Southwestern Cuisine anywhere.

Here's a link to more information about Albuquerque www.itsatrip.org

If you or someone you know may be interested in learning more about this opportunity, please forward your CV to or contact:

Our surgeons enjoy professional support while in the OR and have an assigned MA and 3 rooms from which to practice in Clinic. Our surgeons provide 10 days call per month

We offer a nationally competitive salary and benefits combined with a generous signing bonus and relocation assistance. Our providers also enjoy 30 days of vacation, 5 days of CME time and $5K in CME funds.

The Business Services Representative is responsible for a wide range of administrative and account management activities. Specific duties include following up with insurance companies to verify patient medical plan benefits and interacting with physician office personnel and patients regarding financial issues. This individual should possess solid computer and communication skills. This position will adhere to all policies, procedures and regulations to ensure patient safety and compliance. Review and follow-up of Accounts Receivable: including contacting insurance companies, researching and refilling claims, resolving patient billing problems. Shared responsibility for answering incoming billing telephone calls, printing, reviewing, and mailing demand claims and statements daily.
This position will have a strong emphasis on customer service. Must be willing to listen to patients and be nice to the public. Must work well with others in teamwork and cooperation.

High school diploma or GED, excellent communication/interpersonal skills, and a minimum of two years experience in medical billing are required. Training in medical terminology and coding helpful, but not required.

The Customer Service Respresentative works in a call center environment in the Physician's Billing Office. The respresentatve is responisible for the following:

  1. Maintains call time of less than 5 minutes per call.
  2. Processes patient payments, documents accounts, handles resubmission of claims, etc.
  3. Closes all payment/correction batches by the close of day and turns in batch reports and all supporting documents daily.
  4. Communicates in a professional manner with other departments.

  5. Handles all other assigned duties in a timely manner. Examples: Bankruptcy, itemized statement requests, emails, night line messages, deceased report.

  6. Other duties assigned.

job.hours: 2 shifts 7p-7a and 1 shift 4p-4a, varied e/o weekend
job.jobDescription:
Hillcrest Hospital Claremore, RN, ER, FT, 2 shifts 7p-7a and 1 shift 4p-4a.

At Hillcrest Hospital Claremore, we're proud to offer advanced services right here at home from our Peggy V. Helmerich Birthing Center, to outpatient surgeries and preventative care. And when you need emergency care, our 24/7 emergency physician staffed ER is right where you want it to be close by- to give you prompt medical treatment. This position is responsible for assessing, planning, implementing, evaluating and documenting all care activities in order to deliver efficient, effective and quality patient care.

The RN also must demonstrate the knowledge and skills needed to provide age-appropriate care, based on the assigned unit. This includes a thorough understanding of the principles of growth and development over the life span, along with the ability to assess/interpret issues relative to an individual patient's status and age-specific needs. This position will adhere to all policies, procedures and regulations to ensure patient safety and compliance.
Job Requirements:
Graduate of an accredited school of nursing with a current license as a Registered Nurse in the State of Oklahoma. BLS certification required, ACLS must be obtained with in first year of employment, Two or more current years of acute care experience as a RN preferable ER nursing. Must be able to provide nursing care to patients pediatrics to geriatric, demonstrate leadership and teaching

The Registered Nurse shall be responsible for assessing, planning, supervising and evaluating the nursing care of patients and for correlating the nursing process, the medical plan of care and policies.

Observe professional ethics in maintaining confidential information acquired regarding personal, financial, medical or employment of patients, families, and employees of Hillcrest South. Must follow and enforce accepted safety practices for patients and Hillcrest South. Must report hazards and initiate appropriate action. Must participate in safety instructional programs.

The ED RN will deliver quality care by offering excellent customer service. All employees participate within a team centered approach towards patient care. The RN must possess exceptional communication skills, critical thinking skills, and independent decision making skills. General responsibilities include: patient assessments, holistic care involving patient families, the ability to delegate tasks, display proficiency in order entry and Meditech. The RN must also assist the department manager in staffing the department in a safe and cost effective manner. Occasional assignments outside the department may be required.

The above statements reflect the general duties considered necessary to describe the essential functions of this position as identified, and shall not be considered as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be inherent in the position.
Education: Must possess a current Oklahoma License as a Registered Nurse.

Experience: Desirable characteristics include at least one year of experience as an R.N., preferably in the area of application. Must be able to follow directions and perform work according to department standards when no directions are given. Must be emotionally mature and able to function effectively under stress.

Licenses/Certificates: Must possess a current Oklahoma License as a Registered Nurse. Must obtain and maintain a current certification in CPR. ACLS required upon hire and must maintain. PALS must be obtained with in 90 day probation period if not active at hire. ENPC or NRP would be equivalent certifications for PALS. BSN Preferred.

Cardiac Rehab RN, Fitness Center, Oklahoma Heart Institute at Hillcrest Medical Center, Tulsa, OK

Individuals within this job classification are accountable for assessing, planning, implementing, evaluating and documenting care activities in accordance with HHS standards in order to deliver efficient, effective and quality patient care. He/she is expected to adhere to and abide by the rules and regulations set forth by the Oklahoma Nursing Practice Act.

Performs nursing assessment for each cardiac outpatient and develops a care plan including the findings of diagnostic testing, physicians' orders and assessments, and the exercise prescription. Performs monitored exercise therapy, education sessions and counseling to facilitate behavior modification and change. Collaborates with multidisciplinary team and the patient's physician(s) to provide patient services in a clinically appropriate manner. Monitors exercise sessions and observes patient responses, including changes in cardiac rate/rhythm, and reports to physician according to stated procedures. Recommends changes in exercise or other treatment plans when indicated. Provides patient and family with education to identify risk factors and recommended modification plans to reduce those identified risk factors. Gathers and interprets data reflecting the patient's status in order to identify individual patient's requirements relative to his or her age-specific needs, and to provide the care needed. Communicates with, and educates physicians about the benefits of cardiac rehab and facilitates referrals.

The Registered Nurse shall be responsible for assessing, planning, supervising and evaluating the nursing care of patients and for correlating the nursing process, the medical plan of care and policies.

1) Demonstrate knowledge of conditions, diseases, and treatment therapies for unit specific populations
2) Continually assess patients' physical, physiological, social, and educational needs to determine level and type of care.
3) Develope, prioritize and maintain patient plan of care to include patient problems, goals, interventions
4) Implement plan of care baces on patient acuity, identified needs, and physician orders
5) Administer medications and treatments effectively and skillfully
6) Demonstrate safe and effective use of all unit equipment
7) Demonstrate competence in managing potential patient risks; falls, isolation, infant security,
8) Effectively evaluates the outcome of interventions and implements necessary changes to plan of care
9) Collaborates with other health professionals in the management of health care
10) Documents assessments, interventions (including use of supplies and equipment) and outcomes of care accurately, objectively, and timely
11) Demonstrates knowledge of patients' rights. Serves as an advocate for patients/families regarding decisions affecting their plan of care. Has knowledge of process for resolution of ethical dilemmas.

Education:
Must have obtained an Associate's Degree or higher in Nursing.

Technical/Formal Training:

About us: Lovelace Women's Hospital is New Mexico's first and only hospital dedicated to women's health. We are a highly accomplished 120 bed Women's Hospital nestled at the Foot Hills of the Sandia Mountains where it's sunny 360 days a year. Our patients choose Lovelace Women's Hospital because it's a name they trust. Whether we come alongside them for a birthing experience or breast cancer treatment, our primary goal is to offer them exceptional care. For seven consecutive years, Lovelace Women's Hospital has been recognized by Modern Healthcare Magazine as one of the best places to work in healthcare in the nation.

  • 2015 & 2016 Women's Choice Award for America's Best Breast Centers
  • 2016 Women's Choice Award for America's Best Hospitals for Patient Safety
  • Named to Modern Healthcare's 100 Best Places to Work since 2008
  • Zia Award from Quality New Mexico for Best in Class
Facility: Lovelace Women's Hospital is New Mexico's first and only hospital dedicated to women's health and features a 53-bed Level III Neonatal Intensive Care Unit, 24/7 emergency department, 16 labor and delivery rooms, 41-bed Mother-Baby unit, and a Maternal-Fetal Medicine program for high-risk pregnancies. Additionally, the hospital is home to a Natural Birthing Center, where women who wish to have a more natural delivery can deliver in a safe environment. Lovelace Women's Hospital offers a nationally accredited Breast Care Center, digital mammography, and cardiology. Lovelace Women's Hospital also has the latest minimally invasive robotic surgery system, offering surgery with less pain, shorter hospital stays and faster recovery for many gynecological and urological procedures.

The RN demonstrates the ability to deliver nursing care to Observation Patients/Family through the interactive elements of the nursing process of: assessing; diagnosing; identifying expected patient outcomes; planning; implementing; and evaluating the effectiveness of nursing care. The candidate must be able to care for the observation chest pain patient by monitoring chest pain symptoms and vital signs to determine whether their condition warrants discharge or inpatient admission. Clinicians at the CDU also treat non-cardiac observation patients (CHF, Abdominal Pain, Syncope, Dehydration, TIA) that are transferred from the ED or post surgery after presentation in the ED that require no more than a 24 hour observation period before discharge. The RN demonstrates standards of professional performance by maintaining competencies in the care of the adult and geriatric patient population. The RN abides by the rules and regulations set forth by the Oklahoma Board of Nursing.

1) The RN must be able to recognize an acute cardiac condition through patient assessment of continued chest pain, EKG changes and elevated biomarkers. The RN takes appropriate actions in notifying the physician to transfer to an acute inpatient level of care.
2) The RN will initiate and document infection control precautions as per policy 100% of the time as well as maintain and document infection control precautions per policy and utilize appropriate PPE. The RN will also provide education to family and patient on the infection control guidelines.
3) The RN will assess, reassess and document patient status per policy including but not limited to admission and discharge documentation. The RN will plan, implement, and document nursing care that is appropriate to the patient's needs, condition, and culture.
4) The RN must demonstrate use of clinical reasoning to formulate the most appropriate nursing diagnosis and interventions based on patient assessment.
5) The RN will delegate appropriately to team members to maximize quality of care and utilization of resources.
6) The RN will maintain confidentiality with all information.
7) The RN will meet departmental standards and competencies as evidenced by departmental documentation..
8) The employee will report to work on time and work as scheduled and per attendance policy. The employee will work independently with minimal supervision and utilize policy and procedures of the facility to guide them in the proper course of action.
9) The employee will comply with safety policies and procedures and maintain professional working relationships with co workers, physicians, and customers.
Education:
A graduate of an accredited nursing school.

Technical/Formal Training:
Must obtain and maintain a current certification in CPR. RN must obtain ACLS within 6 months of hire date. New graduates will obtain ACLS within 1 year of hire date.


Knowledge/Skill/Abilities:
Must be able to follow directions and perform work according to department standards when no directions are given. Must be emotionally mature and able to function effectively under stress.

Experience:
At least one year of experience as an R.N., preferably in the area of application preferred.

Licensure:
Must possess a current Oklahoma License as a Registered Nurse.

RN, GYN/Peds, Hillcrest Medical Center, Tulsa, OK

For more than 90 years, Hillcrest Medical Center has provided an environment of hope, health and healing. The 690-bed hospital is among Oklahoma's most widely respected and acclaimed hospitals, offering extraordinary care and a multitude of services in many areas.

This position is responsible for patient care coordination on designated shift in assigned department with collaboration with the supervisor or manager. To insure quality patient care consistent with the philosophy and objectives of the organization. This position provides direct operational support for the unit on a shift basis, acts as a clinical resource person for the staff and acts as a liaison between staff and management, assisting the manager in determining staffing needs and identifying problems the designated unit. The charge nurse provides the communication link between manager, supervisor, staff, patients, physicians and others. The position serves as a resource to staff for patient care assessment and in the planning of nursing interventions. The position facilitates problem resolution and collaborates with the manager in assessing quality of care provided, identifying staff strengths and weaknesses, and in evaluation of staff performance. Operational issues are identified by this position, and the individual works to take action and correct problems. Interface with physicians and interdisciplinary teams for comprehensive care planning is also required.
