About us: Lovelace Women's Hospital is New Mexico's first and only hospital dedicated to women's health. We are a highly accomplished 120 bed Women's Hospital nestled at the Foot Hills of the Sandia Mountains where it's sunny 360 days a year. Our patients choose Lovelace Women's Hospital because it's a name they trust. Whether we come alongside them for a birthing experience or breast cancer treatment, our primary goal is to offer them exceptional care. For seven consecutive years, Lovelace Women's Hospital has been recognized by Modern Healthcare Magazine as one of the best places to work in healthcare in the nation.

  • 2015 & 2016 Women's Choice Award for America's Best Breast Centers
  • 2016 Women's Choice Award for America's Best Hospitals for Patient Safety
  • Named to Modern Healthcare's 100 Best Places to Work since 2008
  • Zia Award from Quality New Mexico for Best in Class
Facility: Lovelace Women's Hospital is New Mexico's first and only hospital dedicated to women's health and features a 53-bed Level III Neonatal Intensive Care Unit, 24/7 emergency department, 16 labor and delivery rooms, 41-bed Mother-Baby unit, and a Maternal-Fetal Medicine program for high-risk pregnancies. Additionally, the hospital is home to a Natural Birthing Center, where women who wish to have a more natural delivery can deliver in a safe environment. Lovelace Women's Hospital offers a nationally accredited Breast Care Center, digital mammography, and cardiology. Lovelace Women's Hospital also has the latest minimally invasive robotic surgery system, offering surgery with less pain, shorter hospital stays and faster recovery for many gynecological and urological procedures.

The Registered Nurse shall be responsible for assessing, planning, supervising and evaluating the nursing care of patients and for correlating the nursing process, the medical plan of care and policies.

1) The RN will plan, perform care, document and demonstrate knowledge of growth and development norms for adolescent, adult and geriatric patients. The RN will will demonstrate knowledge of age appropriate equiptment and identify and advocate for the safety of the patient.
2) The RN will initiate and document infection control precautions as per policy 100% of the time as well as maintain and document infection control precautions per policy and utilize appropriate PPE. The RN will also provide education to family and patient on the infection control guidelines.
3) The RN will assess, reassess and document patient status per policy including but not limited to admission and discharge documentation. The RN will plan, implement, and document nursing care that is appropriate to the patient's needs, condition, and culture.
4) The RN will collaborate with case management and physicians in the continuum of care.
5) The RN will delegate appropriately to team members to maximize quality of care and utilization of resources.
6) The RN will maintain confidentiality with all information.
7) The RN will meet departmental standards and competencies as evidenced by departmental documentation..
8) The employee will report to work on time and work as scheduled and per attendance policy. The employee will work independently with minimal supervision and utilize policy and procedures of the facility to guide them in the proper course of action.
9) The employee will comply with safety policies and procedures and maintain professional working relationships with co workers, physicians, and customers.
10) RN must obtain ACLS within 6 months of hire date. New graduates will obtain ACLS within 1 year of hire date.

Education:
A graduate of an accredited nursing school.

Technical/Formal Training:
Must obtain and maintain a current certification in CPR.


Knowledge/Skill/Abilities:
Must be able to follow directions and perform work according to department standards when no directions are given. Must be emotionally mature and able to function effectively under stress.

Experience:
At least one year of experience as an R.N., preferably in the area of application preferred.

Licensure:
Must possess a current Oklahoma License as a Registered Nurse.

RN, Float Pool, Hillcrest Medical Center

Individuals within this job classification are accountable for assessing, planning, implementing, evaluating and documenting care activities of a broad sprectrum of acute inpatients in accordance with HHS standards in order to deliver efficient, effective and quality patient care. The Registered Nurse (RN) must be able to demonstrate the knowledge and skills necessary to provide care appropriate to the needs of the patients served on each of the Acute Inpatient Services units including Med/Surg, Renal, Orthopedic, Cardiac Telemetry, Inpatient Rehab, and Burn Progressive. The RN is to plan for the provision of patient care including the development, modification and implementation of the plan of care in accordance with HHS Standards in order to deliver efficient, effective and quality patient care as described in the Patient Care policies and procedures. He/she is expected to adhere to and abide by the rules and regulations set forth by the Oklahoma Nursing Practice Act as well as other regulatory and accrediting bodies.

This position is responsible for patient care coordination on designated shift in assigned department with collaboration with the supervisor or manager. To insure quality patient care consistent with the philosophy and objectives of the organization. This position provides direct operational support for the unit on a shift basis, acts as a clinical resource person for the staff and acts as a liaison between staff and management, assisting the manager in determining staffing needs and identifying problems the designated unit. The charge nurse provides the communication link between manager, supervisor, staff, patients, physicians and others. The position serves as a resource to staff for patient care assessment and in the planning of nursing interventions. The position facilitates problem resolution and collaborates with the manager in assessing quality of care provided, identifying staff strengths and weaknesses, and in evaluation of staff performance. Operational issues are identified by this position, and the individual works to take action and correct problems. Interface with physicians and interdisciplinary teams for comprehensive care planning is also required.

Age groups may include the newborn, pediatric, adolescent, adult and geriatric patients. (Varying levels of practitioner and/or care giver will have different skills and abilities.) The skill and ability may include knowledge of growth and development, ranges of treatment and the ability to obtain and interpret information regarding patient needs. The criteria to deliver age appropriate care shall be in the individual departmental policies and procedures.Must be able to function both as a team member and independently; excellent customer service skills, competent, safe, and knowledgeable in patient care. Must have some familiarity with telemetry.

Provide patient care specific to the age of the patient through utilization of the nursing process and by leadership to provide direction to other nursing service personnel and by working collaboratively with an interdisciplinary health care team. Demonstrates the appropriate skills and ability, based on scope of practice, level of training and/or licensure, to assess, treat, and/or care for patients based on the age of the patient. Age groups may include the newborn, pediatric, adolescent, adult and geriatric patients. (Varying levels of practitioner and/or care giver will have different skills and abilities.) The skill and ability may include knowledge of growth and development, ranges of treatment and the ability to obtain and interpret information regarding patient needs. The criteria to deliver age appropriate care shall be in the individual departmental policies and procedures.

Individuals within this job classification are accountable for assessing, planning, implementing, evaluating and documenting care activities in accordance with HHS standards in order to deliver efficient, effective and quality patient care. The Registered Nurse (RN) must be able to demonstrate the knowledge and skills necessary to provide care appropriate to the age of the patients served on the assigned unit. This individual must demonstrate knowledge of the principles of growth and development over the life span, possess the ability to assess data reflective of the patient's status, interpret the appropriate information needed to identify each patient's requirements relative to his/her age-specific needs. The RN is to plan for the provision of patient care including the development, modification and implementation of the plan of care in accordance with HHS standards in order to deliver efficient, effective and quality patient care as described in the Patient Care policies and procedures. He/she is expected to adhere to and abide by the rules and regulations set forth by the Oklahoma Nursing Practice Act

Why Lovelace?

The RN demonstrates the ability to deliver nursing care to Observation Patients/Family through the interactive elements of the nursing process of: assessing; diagnosing; identifying expected patient outcomes; planning; implementing; and evaluating the effectiveness of nursing care. The candidate must be able to care for the observation chest pain patient by monitoring chest pain symptoms and vital signs to determine whether their condition warrants discharge or inpatient admission. Clinicians at the CDU also treat non-cardiac observation patients (CHF, Abdominal Pain, Syncope, Dehydration, TIA) that are transferred from the ED or post surgery after presentation in the ED that require no more than a 24 hour observation period before discharge. The RN demonstrates standards of professional performance by maintaining competencies in the care of the adult and geriatric patient population. The RN abides by the rules and regulations set forth by the Oklahoma Board of Nursing.

1) The RN must be able to recognize an acute cardiac condition through patient assessment of continued chest pain, EKG changes and elevated biomarkers. The RN takes appropriate actions in notifying the physician to transfer to an acute inpatient level of care.
2) The RN will initiate and document infection control precautions as per policy 100% of the time as well as maintain and document infection control precautions per policy and utilize appropriate PPE. The RN will also provide education to family and patient on the infection control guidelines.
3) The RN will assess, reassess and document patient status per policy including but not limited to admission and discharge documentation. The RN will plan, implement, and document nursing care that is appropriate to the patient's needs, condition, and culture.
4) The RN must demonstrate use of clinical reasoning to formulate the most appropriate nursing diagnosis and interventions based on patient assessment.
5) The RN will delegate appropriately to team members to maximize quality of care and utilization of resources.
6) The RN will maintain confidentiality with all information.
7) The RN will meet departmental standards and competencies as evidenced by departmental documentation..
8) The employee will report to work on time and work as scheduled and per attendance policy. The employee will work independently with minimal supervision and utilize policy and procedures of the facility to guide them in the proper course of action.
9) The employee will comply with safety policies and procedures and maintain professional working relationships with co workers, physicians, and customers.
Education:
A graduate of an accredited nursing school.
Licensure:
Must possess a current Oklahoma License as a Registered Nurse.

Technical/Formal Training:
Must obtain and maintain a current certification in CPR. RN must obtain ACLS within 6 months of hire date. New graduates will obtain ACLS within 1 year of hire date.

Knowledge/Skill/Abilities:
Must be able to follow directions and perform work according to department standards when no directions are given. Must be emotionally mature and able to function effectively under stress.

Experience:
At least one year of experience as an R.N., preferably in the area of application preferred.

RN, ICU, Hillcrest Hospital Claremore, FT 7-7a, varied every other weekend

At Hillcrest Hospital Claremore, we're proud to offer advanced services right here at home from our Peggy V. Helmerich Birthing Center, to outpatient surgeries and preventative care. And when you need emergency care, our 24/7 emergency physician staffed ER is right where you want it to be close by- to give you prompt medical treatment. This position has the responsibility of supporting the mission of the hospital, which is to provide patients with the highest quality of healthcare within an atmosphere of genuine caring. In addition, the critical care Registered Nurse is responsible for demonstrating the knowledge and skill to carry out the nursing process when providing care to all patients. The ICU RN is responsible for supervising, delegating, and coordinating personnel assigned to the unit and patient care when in charge, and for promoting teamwork with physicians and personnel of other departments.
Job Requirements:
Graduate of an accredited school of nursing with a current license as a Registered Nurse in the State of Oklahoma. BLS certification required. ACLS must be obtained with in first year of employment. Two or more current years of acute care experience as a RN are preferred. Must be able to provide nursing care to patients 18 years to geriatric, demonstrate leadership and teaching skills.

The Registered Nurse is primarily responsible for using the nursing process of assessment, nursing diagnosis, outcomes identification, planning, implementation, and evaluation to provide care to assigned patients. Responsible and accountable for identifying and prioritizing needs, formulating the plan of care, prioritizing/managing/delegating interventions and collaborating with the physicians and other members of the interdisciplinary team.

1) Demonstrate ability to competently perform all duties of an RN. Strive for 100% compliance with Core Measures and work diligently to improve and maintain HCAHPS scores.

2) Demonstrate ability to clearly and effectively communicate with all members of the interdisciplinary team, while maintaining a positive and professional attitude.

3) Demonstrate high level critical thinking and independent decision-making skills.

4 ) Able to provide total care of the high acuity Cardiac patient utilizing the nursing process. Practices within the scope of the Oklahoma Nurse Practice Act.

5) Deliver quality nursing care with a focus on excellent customer service.

6) Accurately document all nursing assessments and procedures as directed in the electronic medical record.

7) Demonstrate competency to care for complex cardiac patient

8) Maintain communication with Charge RN and 6T Director regarding competencies and skill set.

9) Participate in mandatory and optional continuing education as directed.

10) Maintain patient confidentiality and privacy practices in accordance with HIPAA. Complete annual competency and safety training as assigned.

Education: A graduate of an accredited nursing school

Technical/Formal Training: Must obtain and maintain a current certification in CPR. The ICS Staff RN must maintain ACLS. New graduate nurses have up to six months to obtain their ACLS. Experienced new hires have 6 months to obtain ACLS.

Knowledge/Skills/Abilities: Must be able to follow directions and perform work according to department standards when no directions are given. Must be emotionally mature and able to function effectively under stress.

Experience: At least one year of experience as an RN, preferably in the area of application preferred.

Licensure: Must possess a current Oklahoma License as a Registered Nurse.

You're going to LOVE Lovelace!

About us: Lovelace Women's Hospital is New Mexico's first and only hospital dedicated to women's health. We are a highly accomplished 120 bed Women's Hospital nestled at the Foot Hills of the Sandia Mountains where it's sunny 360 days a year. Our patients choose Lovelace Women's Hospital because it's a name they trust. Whether we come alongside them for a birthing experience or breast cancer treatment, our primary goal is to offer them exceptional care. For seven consecutive years, Lovelace Women's Hospital has been recognized by Modern Healthcare Magazine as one of the best places to work in healthcare in the nation.

  • 2015 & 2016 Women's Choice Award for America's Best Breast Centers
  • 2016 Women's Choice Award for America's Best Hospitals for Patient Safety
  • Named to Modern Healthcare's 100 Best Places to Work since 2008
  • Zia Award from Quality New Mexico for Best in Class
Facility: Lovelace Women's Hospital is New Mexico's first and only hospital dedicated to women's health and features a 53-bed Level III Neonatal Intensive Care Unit, 24/7 emergency department, 16 labor and delivery rooms, 41-bed Mother-Baby unit, and a Maternal-Fetal Medicine program for high-risk pregnancies. Additionally, the hospital is home to a Natural Birthing Center, where women who wish to have a more natural delivery can deliver in a safe environment. Lovelace Women's Hospital offers a nationally accredited Breast Care Center, digital mammography, and cardiology. Lovelace Women's Hospital also has the latest minimally invasive robotic surgery system, offering surgery with less pain, shorter hospital stays and faster recovery for many gynecological and urological procedures.

The Registered Nurse is primarily responsible for using the nursing process of assessment, nursing diagnosis, outcomes identification, planning, implementation, and evaluation to provide care to assigned patients. Responsible and accountable for identifying and prioritizing needs, formulating the plan of care, prioritizing/managing/delegating interventions and collaborating with the physicians and other members of the interdisciplinary team.

1) Demonstrate ability to competently perform all duties of an RN. Strive for 100% compliance with Core Measures and work diligently to improve and maintain HCAHPS scores.

2) Demonstrate ability to clearly and effectively communicate with all members of the interdisciplinary team, while maintaining a positive and professional attitude.

3) Demonstrate high level critical thinking and independent decision-making skills.

4 ) Able to provide total care of the high acuity Cardiac patient utilizing the nursing process. Practices within the scope of the Oklahoma Nurse Practice Act.

5) Deliver quality nursing care with a focus on excellent customer service.

6) Accurately document all nursing assessments and procedures as directed in the electronic medical record.

7) Demonstrate competency to care for complex cardiac patient

8) Maintain communication with Charge RN and 6T Director regarding competencies and skill set.

9) Participate in mandatory and optional continuing education as directed.

10) Maintain patient confidentiality and privacy practices in accordance with HIPAA. Complete annual competency and safety training as assigned.

Education: A graduate of an accredited nursing school

Technical/Formal Training: Must obtain and maintain a current certification in CPR. The ICS Staff RN must maintain ACLS. New graduate nurses have up to six months to obtain their ACLS. Experienced new hires have 6 months to obtain ACLS.

Knowledge/Skills/Abilities: Must be able to follow directions and perform work according to department standards when no directions are given. Must be emotionally mature and able to function effectively under stress.

Experience: At least one year of experience as an RN, preferably in the area of application preferred.

Licensure: Must possess a current Oklahoma License as a Registered Nurse.

Job Requirements:

RN, Med/Surg Hillcrest Hospital Claremore, VARIED

At Hillcrest Hospital Claremore, we're proud to offer advanced services right here at home from our Peggy V. Helmerich Birthing Center, to outpatient surgeries and preventative care. And when you need emergency care, our 24/7 emergency physician staffed ER is right where you want it to be close by- to give you prompt medical treatment. The RN also must demonstrate the knowledge and skills needed to provide age-appropriate care, based on the assigned unit. This includes a thorough understanding of the principles of growth and development over the life span, along with the ability to assess/interpret issues relative to an individual patient's status and age-specific needs. This position will adhere to all policies, procedures and regulations to ensure patient safety and compliance.
Job Requirements:
High school diploma or equivalent required. Must be a graduate of an accredited school of nursing with a current license as a Registered Nurse in the State of Oklahoma and possess a current BLS certification. ACLS preferred. One or more current years of acute care experience as a registered nurse preferred. Must be able to provide nursing care to patients of all ages: neonates to geriatric population. Must demonstrate teaching and leadership skills.

Hillcrest Medical Center has one mission: to Change Lives for the better, together!


This means that every employee - from the bedside to the boardroom - works together to make Hillcrest the best place to be for our visitors, our patients and our team members. We are proud to offer nationally-recognized services, first-time procedures and high-quality care in a friendly and collaborative environment.

Registered nurses are accountable for assessing, planning, implementing, evaluating and documenting care activities in accordance with Hillcrest Health System standards in order to deliver efficient, effective and quality patient care. The Registered Nurse (RN) must be able to demonstrate the knowledge and skills necessary to provide care appropriate to the age of the patients served on the assigned unit. This individual must demonstrate knowledge of the principles of growth and development over the life span, possess the ability to assess data reflective of the patient's status, interpret the appropriate information needed to identify each patient's requirements relative to his/her age-specific needs. The RN is to plan for the provision of patient care including the development, modification and implementation of the plan of care in accordance with HHS standards in order to deliver efficient, effective and quality patient care as described in the Patient Care policies and procedures. He/she is expected to adhere to and abide by the rules and regulations set forth by the Oklahoma Nursing Practice Act.

If you are a healthcare professional looking for the opportunity to join a vibrant and integrated team focused on Changing Lives, we invite you to learn more about Hillcrest Medical Center.

Registered Nurse

Post-Surgical Floor

Tulsa Spine & Specialty Hospital

1845 - 0715

Tulsa Spine and Specialty Hospital provides excellence in Surgical Intervention, Diagnostic Imaging, Pain Management, and Customer Service.

BASIC PURPOSE OF THE JOB


The Registered Nurse is responsible for delivery of patient care through the nursing process of assessment, diagnosing, planning, implementation, and evaluation. S/He is responsible for directing and coordinating all nursing care for medical/surgical patients based on established clinical nursing practice standards. S/He collaborates with other professional disciplines to ensure effective and efficient patient care delivery and the achievement of desired patient outcomes. S/He serves in a resource role when oriented and as directed. S/He supports the organization's vision and mission. S/He utilizes knowledge of patient age and cultural diversity into the provision of patient care. S/He contributes to the provision of quality nursing care through performance improvement techniques that demonstrate positive outcomes in patient care.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS


1. Delivers nursing care according to standards of care defined by the Oklahoma Board of Nursing and the American Nurses Association (ANA) Standards of Clinical Practice.
A. Collects patient health data:
Determines priority of data collection based on patient's immediate condition or needs.
Collects pertinent data using appropriate assessment techniques.
Involves patient, significant others, and health care providers in data collection when appropriate.
Ensures data collection process is systematic and ongoing.
Documents relevant data in the medical record according to hospital standards.
B. Analyzes assessment data in determining diagnoses / patient problems:
Derives diagnoses / patient problems from assessment data.
Validates diagnoses / patient problems with patient, significant others, and health care providers, when possible.
Documents diagnoses / patient problems in a manner that facilitates determination of expected outcomes and plan of care.
C. Identifies expected outcomes individualized to the patient:
Derives outcomes from the diagnoses / patient problems.
Documents outcomes as measurable goals.
Formulates outcomes with the patient and health care providers, when possible.
Ensures outcomes are realistic to patient's present and potential capabilities.
Ensures outcomes are attainable in relation to resources available to the patient.
Ensures outcomes include a time estimate for attainment.
Ensures outcomes provide direction for continuity of care.
D. Develops a plan of care that prescribes interventions to attain expected outcomes:
Individualizes plan to patient's condition or needs.
Develops plan with patient, significant others, and health care providers, when appropriate.
Ensures plan reflects current nursing practice.
Documents plan.
Provides for continuity of care in plan.
E. Implements interventions identified in plan of care.
Establishes interventions that are consistent with plan of care
Implements interventions in a safe and appropriate manner.
Documents interventions.
Safely administers all medications per physician order.
F. Evaluates patient's progress toward attainment of outcomes.
Ensures evaluation is systematic and ongoing.
Documents patient's responses to interventions.
Evaluates effectiveness of interventions in relation to outcomes.
Utilizes ongoing assessment data to revise diagnoses / patient problems, outcomes and plan of care as needed.
Documents revisions in diagnoses / patient problems, outcomes, and plan of care.
Involves patient, significant others, and health care providers in evaluation process, when appropriate.

JOB REQUIREMENTS


Minimum of two years' clinical practice with experience in the specific field.
Ability to utilize the nursing process in the provision of nursing care including, but not limited to: administering treatments and medications; interpreting diagnostic tests, formulating a plan of care, collaborating with other health care providers, and providing education to patients and/or significant others. The successful candidate will be required to pass competencies for this position.

RN, Mother Baby, Hillcrest Medical Center

This position is responsible for patient care coordination on designated shift in assigned department with collaboration with the supervisor or manager. To insure quality patient care consistent with the philosophy and objectives of the organization. This position provides direct operational support for the unit on a shift basis, acts as a clinical resource person for the staff and acts as a liaison between staff and management, assisting the manager in determining staffing needs and identifying problems the designated unit. The charge nurse provides the communication link between manager, supervisor, staff, patients, physicians and others. The position serves as a resource to staff for patient care assessment and in the planning of nursing interventions. The position facilitates problem resolution and collaborates with the manager in assessing quality of care provided, identifying staff strengths and weaknesses, and in evaluation of staff performance. Operational issues are identified by this position, and the individual works to take action and correct problems. Interface with physicians and interdisciplinary teams for comprehensive care planning is also required.

The Registered Nurse is a professional caregiver who assumes responsibility and accountability for a group of patients for a designated time frame. She or he provides direct care to these patients via the nursing process, the environmental/instrumentation and management of other health care team members.

1) The RN will plan, perform care, document and demonstrate knowledge of growth and development norms for adolescent, adult and geriatric patients. The RN will demonstrate knowledge of age appropriate equipment and identify and advocate for the safety of the patient.
2) The RN will initiate and document infection control precautions as per policy 100% of the time as well as maintain and document infection control precautions per policy and utilize appropriate PPE. The RN will also provide education to family and patient on the infection control guidelines.
3) The RN will assess, reassess and document patient status per policy including but not limited to admission and discharge documentation. The RN will plan, implement, and document nursing care that is appropriate to the patient's needs, condition, and culture.
4) The RN will collaborate with case management and physicians in the continuum of care.
5) The RN will delegate appropriately to team members to maximize quality of care and utilization of resources.
6) The RN will maintain confidentiality with all information.
7) The RN will meet departmental standards and competencies as evidenced by departmental documentation..
8) The employee will report to work on time and work as scheduled and per attendance policy. The employee will work independently with minimal supervision and utilize policy and procedures of the facility to guide them in the proper course of action.
9) The employee will comply with safety policies and procedures and maintain professional working relationships with co workers, physicians, and customers.

The above statements reflect the general duties considered necessary to describe the essential functions of this position as identified, and shall not be considered as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be inherent in the position.
Education:
A graduate of an accredited nursing school.

Technical/Formal Training:
Must obtain and maintain a current certification in CPR. Must also have ACLS.

Knowledge/ Skill/Abilities:
Demonstrated leadership abilities; able to work under stressful situations. Possesses good oral and written communication skills. A demonstrated ability in interpersonal relationships which enhances communication, promotes conflict resolutions, and facilitates staff development. Must be able to follow directions and perform work according to department standards when no directions are given. Must be emotionally mature and able to function effectively under stress.

Experience:
Desirable characteristics include at least one year of experience as an R.N., preferably in the area of application.

Licensure:
Must possess a current Oklahoma License as a Registered Nurse.

The RN is to plan for the provision of patient care including the development, modification and implementation of the plan of care in accordance with HHS standards in order to deliver efficient, effective and quality patient care as described in the Patient Care policies and procedures. He/she is expected to adhere to and abide by the rules and regulations set forth by the Oklahoma Nursing Practice Act.

RN Float, Oklahoma Heart Institute

From comprehensive diagnostics to open heart surgery and cardiac rehabilitation, Oklahoma Heart Institute combines nationally recognized cardiovascular physicians with the region's most advanced technology.

This position requires excellent organizational and multitasking skills. Experience with Cardiology, Endocrinology or Sleep Medicine preferred. Ability to make triage decisions efficiently and effectively with a busy clinical call center required.

Monday through Friday, 8-5 with no weekend, holidays or call hours. Current Oklahoma RN license required.

The Registered Nurse shall be responsible for assessing, planning, supervising and evaluating the nursing care of patients and for correlating the nursing process, the medical plan of care and policies. Providing care consistent with the goals and philosophy of SCH and with standards of nursing practice as defined by the Nurse Practice Act of the State of Oklahoma. The Post Partum, OB/GYN, Mother/Baby RN will deliver quality care by offering excellent customer service. All employees participate within a team centered approach towards patient care. The RN must possess exceptional communication skills, critical thinking skills, and independent decision making skills. General responsibilities include: patient assessments, holistic care involving patient families, the ability to delegate tasks, display proficiency in order entry, and Meditech. The RN must also assist the department manager in staffing the department in a safe and cost effective manner. Occasional assignments outside the department may be required. RN's may participate in the care of patients from newborns to geriatrics. Must observe professional ethics in maintaining confidential information acquired regarding personal, financial, medical or employment of patients, families, and employees of SCH. Must follow and enforce accepted safety practices for patients and SCH. Must report hazards and initiate appropriate action. Must participate in safety instructional programs. Must participate in education and in-services. The above statements reflect the general duties considered necessary to describe the essential functions of this position as identified, and shall not be considered as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be inherent in the position.

Education: Must possess a current Oklahoma License as a Registered Nurse. BSN Preferred.

Experience: Desirable characteristics include at least one year of experience as an R.N., preferably in the area of application. Must be able to follow directions and perform work according to department standards when no directions are given. Must be emotionally mature and able to function effectively under stress. Licenses/Certificates: Must possess a current Oklahoma License as a Registered Nurse. Must obtain and maintain a current certification in BLS. Must maintain any other certificates as required (i.e. ACLS, NRP, PALS,AWHONN, etc.).

The Operating Room Registered Nurse is responsible for the delivery of patient care through the nursing process of assessment, diagnosing, planning, implementation, and evaluation. He/ she is also responsible for directing and coordinating all nursing care of critically ill patients based on established clinical nursing practice standards.

1) Observes Professional ethics in maintaining confidential information.

2) Follows and enforces accepted safety practices for patients and Hillcrest Hospital South

3) Reports hazards and initiates appropriate action.

4) Participates in safety instructional programs.

5) Completes documentation and charges in an accurate, timely, and legible manner.

6) Prepares and provides for departmental needs within budget guidelines.

7) Participates in the recruitment and retention programs of the unit.

8) Monitors and evaluates the strenghts and weaknesses of new employees within the introductory period.

9) Performs other duties assigned.

10) Makes critical decisions and collaborates with physicians and other health care professionals.

11) Demonstrates problem solving abilities, leadership skills, and collaborative strengths to function independently with little to no direction.

Education:
Graduate from an accredited school of nursing.

Experience:
NEW GRADS ACCEPTED. Prefer at least one year experience as a RN in an operating room environment.

License/certification:
Currently licensed as a Registered Nurse in Oklahoma and BLS. If ACLS certified upon hire, must maintain, otherwise obtain certification with 6 months of employment and maintain currency. CNOR preferred.

Provide patient care specific to the age of the patient through utilization of the nursing process and by leadership to provide direction to other nursing service personnel and by working collaboratively with an interdisciplinary health care team. Demonstrates the appropriate skills and ability, based on scope of practice, level of training and/or licensure, to assess, treat, and/or care for patients based on the age of the patient. Age groups may include the newborn, pediatric, adolescent, adult and geriatric patients. (Varying levels of practitioner and/or care giver will have different skills and abilities.) The skill and ability may include knowledge of growth and development, ranges of treatment and the ability to obtain and interpret information regarding patient needs. The criteria to deliver age appropriate care shall be in the individual departmental policies and procedures.

RN, Mother Baby, Hillcrest Medical Center

For more than 90 years, Hillcrest Medical Center has provided an environment of hope, health and healing. The 690-bed hospital is among Oklahoma's most widely respected and acclaimed hospitals, offering extraordinary care and a multitude of services in many areas.

This position is responsible for patient care coordination on designated shift in assigned department with collaboration with the supervisor or manager. To insure quality patient care consistent with the philosophy and objectives of the organization. This position provides direct operational support for the unit on a shift basis, acts as a clinical resource person for the staff and acts as a liaison between staff and management, assisting the manager in determining staffing needs and identifying problems the designated unit. The charge nurse provides the communication link between manager, supervisor, staff, patients, physicians and others. The position serves as a resource to staff for patient care assessment and in the planning of nursing interventions. The position facilitates problem resolution and collaborates with the manager in assessing quality of care provided, identifying staff strengths and weaknesses, and in evaluation of staff performance. Operational issues are identified by this position, and the individual works to take action and correct problems. Interface with physicians and interdisciplinary teams for comprehensive care planning is also required.

POSITION SUMMARY:

The Rapid Response Nurse is responsible for rounding and responding to calls in all adult units to provide urgent/emergent nursing interventions.

The Rapid Response Nurse will assess, evaluate and initiate approved interventions for patients at risk for/or exhibiting a change in condition. He/she will utilize critical thinking and problem solving skills to recognize early signs and symptoms of clinical deterioration and act accordingly to insure optimal outcomes. The RRT nurse uses effective communication skills to collaborate with team members, physicians and nursing staff to provide quality patient care consistent with the philosophy and objective of the organization. They respond to stroke s and expedite care to the acute stroke patient. The Rapid Response Nurse participates in data collection for quality improvement and core measure activities and act as a resource, mentor and role model for nursing staff. The Rapid Response nurse also provides on-going hospital wide education for nursing staff, such as mock code training. The Rapid Response nurse meets or exceeds the competencies outlined in the ICU RN job description.

RN - OB, Hillcrest Hospital Claremore, FT, 7p-7a varied every other weekend

At Hillcrest Hospital Claremore, we're proud to offer advanced services right here at home from our New Beginning Birthing Center, to outpatient surgeries and preventative care. And when you need emergency care, our 24/7 emergency physician staffed ER is right where you want it to be close by- to give you prompt medical treatment. The perinatal nurse is responsible for demonstrating the knowledge and skill to carry out the nursing process when providing care to all patients. Also, for meeting the established standards of NAACOG nursing practice in supervising, delegating, and coordinating personnel assigned to the unit and patient care when in charge. The OB RN also promotes teamwork with physicians and personnel of other departments.
Job Requirement:
Graduate of an accredited school of nursing with a current license as a registered nurse in the State of Oklahoma. BSN preferred. Current Basic Life Support certification required. ACLS and Neonatal Resuscitation Provider preferred. One or more current years of acute care hospital experience as a RN with one-year experience in Labor/Delivery, Post Partum, Nursery, or NICU required.

  • - BLS - Basic Life Support
  • - RN - Registered Nurse
  • - 1-3 Years of Experience
  • - ACLS - Advanced Cardiac Life Support Preferred

Winter Surge participants agree to commit to a defined consecutive week assignment of a scheduled minimum of 36 hours per week for a 13 week contract.

Participants agree to accept unit, location and shift assignments by HHS Resource Team, under the direction of HMC Nursing Administration, and understands that shift, location and unit assignment may change during the contracted assignment period.

Winter Surge participants are eligible for a $4000 Completion Bonus paid at end of 13 week contract if all scheduling, attendance and performance standards have been met.

QUALIFICATIONS

1. Must not have been employed by Hillcrest Healthcare System (HHS) in the past six months.

2. Current Oklahoma license, BLS certification and ACLS for critical care and appropriate certifications for other specialty areas (PALS, NRP, TNCC) are required.

3. Minimum of one year recent (within the last 2 years) hospital experience in selected area.

4. Satisfactory completion of the interview process including background and reference checks and physical.

5. Completion of the hospital/nursing/computer orientation and credentialing process with minimal unit orientation.

6. Complete validation and approval of competency checklist to specialty areas by Nurse Managers.

7. Accessible by telephone.

SCHEDULING STANDARDS

1. The assignment period will be for 13 weeks.

2. Winter Surge participants will be scheduled for a minimum of 72 hours per pay period including a minimum of four weekend shifts a month (where applicable).

3. Winter Surge participants are required to work holidays during their agreement period. Holidays are defined as Memorial Day, July 4th, Labor Day, Thanksgiving, Christmas Eve Night, Christmas, New Years Eve Night, and New Years Day. Resource contractors will be eligible for Holiday pay on these days

4. Winter Surge participants are expected to work all scheduled shifts as assigned unless canceled by the Staffing Office.

5. If the Winter Surge participant is to be canceled, the staffing assistant will contact them two hours prior to the start of the shift. Valid notification will include use of the telephone voice mail.

6. The Winter Surge participants will be eligible for evening, night and weekend differentials. They will not be eligible for critical staffing premium pay.

7. Winter Surge participants will be assigned to a specific floor, but due to fluctuating census HHS Resource Team or HMC Nursing Administration has the right to pull the Winter Surge participants to another floor. In some circumstances if census/volumes are low, it could be possible that Winter Surge participants would be reassigned to another HHS facility to provide coverage. Refusal to float will result in disciplinary action.

PERFORMANCE STANDARDS

Adherence to the Winter Surge Program Agreement will be overseen by HHS Resource Team.

Winter Surge participants will be directly supervised in the clinical areas by the Nurse Manager/Director and Charge Nurse.

1. Winter Surge participants will participate in all mandatory education.

2. Winter Surge participants will need to provide proof of and maintain validation of any additional specialty certifications required on the units in which they work.

3. Winter Surge participants will be evaluated by and held accountable for performance based on the standard hospital job descriptions for their respective position. HHS Resource Team will solicit performance feedback from HMC nursing leadership weekly.

4. Winter Surge participants are allowed no-calls in the 13 week period unless covered by federal or state law.

5. HHS has the right to terminate this agreement for cause at any time.

Winter Surge participants will maintain flexibility and availability in order to supplement hospital staffing needs. Winter Surge participants are required to comply with all HHS policies, procedures, and patient care standards. Winter Surge participants acknowledge that this is a temporary employment assignment and is not eligible for benefits except those mandated by law.

Hillcrest Healthcare System may, in its sole and absolute discretion, terminate or modify the Winter Surge Program Standards at any time.

Winter Surge participants are eligible for a $4000 Completion Bonus paid at end of 13 week contract if all scheduling, attendance and performance standards have been met.

Provide patient care specific to the age of the patient through utilization of the nursing process and by leadership to provide direction to other nursing service personnel and by working collaboratively with an interdisciplinary health care team. Demonstrates the appropriate skills and ability, based on scope of practice, level of training and/or licensure, to assess, treat, and/or care for patients based on the age of the patient. Maintain hemodynamic drips, hemodynamic monitoring, cardiac monitoring. Age groups may include the newborn, pediatric, adolescent, adult and geriatric patients. (Varying levels of practitioner and/or care giver will have different skills and abilities.) The skill and ability may include knowledge of growth and development, ranges of treatment and the ability to obtain and interpret information regarding patient needs. He/she is expected to adhere to and abide by the rules and regulations set forth by the Oklahoma Nursing Practice Act.

RN, Mother Baby, Hillcrest Medical Center

For more than 90 years, Hillcrest Medical Center has provided an environment of hope, health and healing. The 690-bed hospital is among Oklahoma's most widely respected and acclaimed hospitals, offering extraordinary care and a multitude of services in many areas.

This position is responsible for patient care coordination on designated shift in assigned department with collaboration with the supervisor or manager. To insure quality patient care consistent with the philosophy and objectives of the organization. This position provides direct operational support for the unit on a shift basis, acts as a clinical resource person for the staff and acts as a liaison between staff and management, assisting the manager in determining staffing needs and identifying problems the designated unit. The charge nurse provides the communication link between manager, supervisor, staff, patients, physicians and others. The position serves as a resource to staff for patient care assessment and in the planning of nursing interventions. The position facilitates problem resolution and collaborates with the manager in assessing quality of care provided, identifying staff strengths and weaknesses, and in evaluation of staff performance. Operational issues are identified by this position, and the individual works to take action and correct problems. Interface with physicians and interdisciplinary teams for comprehensive care planning is also required.

The Registered Nurse is primarily responsible for using the nursing process of assessment, nursing diagnosis, outcomes identification, planning, implementation, and evaluation to provide care to assigned patients. Responsible and accountable for identifying and prioritizing needs, formulating the plan of care, prioritizing/managing/delegating interventions and collaborating with the physicians and other members of the interdisciplinary team.

1) Demonstrate ability to competently perform all duties of an Intensive Care RN. Strive for 100% compliance with Core Measures and work diligently to improve and maintain HCAHPS scores.

2) Demonstrate ability to clearly and effectively communicate with all members of the interdisciplinary team, while maintaining a positive and professional attitude.

3) Demonstrate high level critical thinking and independent decision-making skills. .

4) Able to provide total care of the critically ill patient utilizing the nursing process. Practices within the scope of the Oklahoma Nurse Practice Act.

5) Deliver quality nursing care with a focus on excellent customer service.

6) Accurately document all nursing assessments and procedures as directed in the electronic medical record.

7) Delegate tasks to unlicensed personnel as appropriate.

8) Maintain communication with Charge RN and ICU Director regarding competencies and skill set.

9) Participate in mandatory and optional continuing education as directed.

10)Maintain patient confidentiality and privacy practices in accordance with HIPAA. Complete annual competency and safety training as assigned.

11)Other tasks as delegated by the Charge RN or ICU Director.

Education:

A graduate of an accredited nursing school.

Technical/Formal Training:

Must obtain and maintain a current certification in CPR. The ICU Staff RN must maintain ACLS. New graduate nurses have up to six months to obtain their ACLS. Experienced new hires have 90 days to obtain ACLS.

Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:

Must be able to follow directions and perform work according to department standards when no directions are given. Must be emotionally mature and able to function effectively under stress.

Experience:

At least one year of experience as Registered Nurse. Will consider prior LPN experience where applicable.

Licensure:

Must possess a current Oklahoma License as a Registered Nurse.

The Operating Room Registered Nurse is responsible for the delivery of patient care through the nursing process of assessment, diagnosing, planning, implementation, and evaluation. He/ she is also responsible for directing and coordinating all nursing care of critically ill patients based on established clinical nursing practice standards.

1) Observes Professional ethics in maintaining confidential information.

2) Follows and enforces accepted safety practices for patients and Hillcrest Hospital South

3) Reports hazards and initiates appropriate action.

4) Participates in safety instructional programs.

5) Completes documentation and charges in an accurate, timely, and legible manner.

6) Prepares and provides for departmental needs within budget guidelines.

7) Participates in the recruitment and retention programs of the unit.

8) Monitors and evaluates the strenghts and weaknesses of new employees within the introductory period.

9) Performs other duties assigned.

10) Makes critical decisions and collaborates with physicians and other health care professionals.

11) Demonstrates problem solving abilities, leadership skills, and collaborative strengths to function independently with little to no direction.

Education:
Graduate from an accredited school of nursing.

Experience:
NEW GRADS ACCEPTED. Prefer at least one year experience as a RN in an operating room environment.

License/certification:
Currently licensed as a Registered Nurse in Oklahoma and BLS. If ACLS certified upon hire, must maintain, otherwise obtain certification with 6 months of employment and maintain currency. CNOR preferred.

Individuals within this job classification are accountable for assessing, planning, implementing, evaluating and documenting care activities in accordance with HHS standards in order to deliver efficient, effective and quality patient care. The Registered Nurse (RN) must be able to demonstrate the knowledge and skills necessary to provide care appropriate to the age of the patients served on the assigned unit. This individual must demonstrate knowledge of the principles of growth and development over the life span, possess the ability to assess data reflective of the patient's status, interpret the appropriate information needed to identify each patient's requirements relative to his/her age-specific needs. The RN is to plan for the provision of patient care including the development, modification and implementation of the plan of care in accordance with HHS standards in order to deliver efficient, effective and quality patient care as described in the Patient Care policies and procedures. He/she is expected to adhere to and abide by the rules and regulations set forth by the Oklahoma Nursing Practice Act.

The registered nurse shall be responsible for assessing, planning, supervising the nursing care of patients and for correlating the nursing process, the medical plan of care and policies.

Essential Functions:

1. Demonstrate understanding and ability to attend delivery of vaginal or cesarean section patient as needed.

Post Delivery Management:

Obtains vital signs and assesses patient according to unit policy

A. Vaginal delivery

B. C-section delivery

Obtains and documents accurate Intake and output

Instructs on post delivery assessment with normal findings and expectations

Assesses patient's level of pain and manages according to physician's order

Reassess patient's pain post-intervention and documents response appropriately

Instructs on dietary orders.

Also, instructs on breastfeeding techniques and initiates proper referral if patient needs further assistance to include calling lactation specialist.

3. Demonstrates an understanding of indications, side effects and assessment of the patient on Mg+ to include deep tendon reflexes, neurovascular checks and vital signs

4. Demonstrates an understanding of inidications for administration of vaccines, vitamin k injection, eye antibiotic ointment and proper time of administration.

5. Demonstrates process following intrauterine fetal demise and miscarriage including spiritual care when appropriate.

6. Discharge instructions: Documents instructions on both standardized and individualized discharge instruction forms.

Education: Must have graduated from an acredited RN nursing program.

Knowledge/Skills/Abilities: Demonstrated leadership abilities; able to work under stressful situations. Possesses good oral and written communication skills. A demonstrated ability in interpersonal relationships which enhances communication, promotes conflict resolutions, and facilitates staff development. Skill and knowledge to sustain and evaluate clinical competence in caring for the specific age and type of patient population served.

Experience: Two to five years of clinical experience (preferably in the area of application); experience in patient care management preferred.

Licensure: Must possess a current Oklahoma License as a Registered Nurse. Must obtain and maintain a current certification in CPR. NRP and STABLE must be obtained within 6 months of hire.

The Registered Nurse shall be responsible for assessing, planning, supervising and evaluating the nursing care of patients and for correlating the nursing process, the medical plan of care and policies.

1) The RN will plan, perform care, document and demonstrate knowledge of growth and development norms for adolescent, adult and geriatric patients. The RN will will demonstrate knowledge of age appropriate equiptment and identify and advocate for the safety of the patient.
2) The RN will initiate and document infection control precautions as per policy 100% of the time as well as maintain and document infection control precautions per policy and utilize appropriate PPE. The RN will also provide education to family and patient on the infection control guidelines.
3) The RN will assess, reassess and document patient status per policy including but not limited to admission and discharge documentation. The RN will plan, implement, and document nursing care that is appropriate to the patient's needs, condition, and culture.
4) The RN will collaborate with case management and physicians in the continuum of care.
5) The RN will delegate appropriately to team members to maximize quality of care and utilization of resources.
6) The RN will maintain confidentiality with all information.
7) The RN will meet departmental standards and competencies as evidenced by departmental documentation..
8) The employee will report to work on time and work as scheduled and per attendance policy. The employee will work independently with minimal supervision and utilize policy and procedures of the facility to guide them in the proper course of action.
9) The employee will comply with safety policies and procedures and maintain professional working relationships with co workers, physicians, and customers.
10) RN must obtain ACLS within 6 months of hire date. New graduates will obtain ACLS within 1 year of hire date.

Education:
A graduate of an accredited nursing school.

Technical/Formal Training:
Must obtain and maintain a current certification in CPR.


Knowledge/Skill/Abilities:
Must be able to follow directions and perform work according to department standards when no directions are given. Must be emotionally mature and able to function effectively under stress.

Experience:
At least one year of experience as an R.N., preferably in the area of application preferred.

Licensure:
Must possess a current Oklahoma License as a Registered Nurse.

The RN must possess exceptional communication skills, critical thinking skills, and independent decision making skills. General responsibilities include: patient assessments, holistic care involving patient families, the ability to delegate tasks, display proficiency in order entry and Meditech. The RN must also assist the department manager in staffing the department in a safe and cost effective manner. Occasional assignments outside the department may be required.

Experience: Desirable characteristics include at least one year of experience as an R.N., preferably in the area of application. Must be able to follow directions and perform work according to department standards when no directions are given. Must be emotionally mature and able to function effectively under stress.

The registered nurse shall be responsible for assessing, planning, supervising the nursing care of patients and for correlating the nursing process, the medical plan of care and policies.

Essential Functions:

1. Demonstrate understanding and ability to attend delivery of vaginal or cesarean section patient as needed.

Post Delivery Management:

Obtains vital signs and assesses patient according to unit policy

A. Vaginal delivery

B. C-section delivery

Obtains and documents accurate Intake and output

Instructs on post delivery assessment with normal findings and expectations

Assesses patient's level of pain and manages according to physician's order

Reassess patient's pain post-intervention and documents response appropriately

Instructs on dietary orders.

Also, instructs on breastfeeding techniques and initiates proper referral if patient needs further assistance to include calling lactation specialist.

3. Demonstrates an understanding of indications, side effects and assessment of the patient on Mg+ to include deep tendon reflexes, neurovascular checks and vital signs

4. Demonstrates an understanding of inidications for administration of vaccines, vitamin k injection, eye antibiotic ointment and proper time of administration.

5. Demonstrates process following intrauterine fetal demise and miscarriage including spiritual care when appropriate.

6. Discharge instructions: Documents instructions on both standardized and individualized discharge instruction forms.

Education: Must have graduated from an acredited RN nursing program.

Knowledge/Skills/Abilities: Demonstrated leadership abilities; able to work under stressful situations. Possesses good oral and written communication skills. A demonstrated ability in interpersonal relationships which enhances communication, promotes conflict resolutions, and facilitates staff development. Skill and knowledge to sustain and evaluate clinical competence in caring for the specific age and type of patient population served.

Experience: Two to five years of clinical experience (preferably in the area of application); experience in patient care management preferred.

Licensure: Must possess a current Oklahoma License as a Registered Nurse. Must obtain and maintain a current certification in CPR. NRP and STABLE must be obtained within 6 months of hire.

The Registered Nurse is primarily responsible for using the nursing process of assessment, nursing diagnosis, outcomes identification, planning, implementation, and evaluation to provide care to assigned patients. Responsible and accountable for identifying and prioritizing needs, formulating the plan of care, prioritizing/managing/delegating interventions and collaborating with the physicians and other members of the interdisciplinary team.

Essential Functions:
1) Demonstrate ability to competently perform all duties of an Intensive Care RN. Strive for 100% compliance with Core Measures and work diligently to improve and maintain HCAHPS scores.
2) Demonstrate ability to clearly and effectively communicate with all members of the interdisciplinary team, while maintaining a positive and professional attitude.
3) Demonstrate high level critical thinking and independent decision-making skills.
4) Able to provide total care of the critically ill patient utilizing the nursing process. Practices within the scope of the Oklahoma Nurse Practice Act.
5) Deliver quality nursing care with a focus on excellent customer service.
6) Accurately document all nursing assessments and procedures as directed in the electronic medical record.
7) Delegate tasks to unlicensed personnel as appropriate.
8) Maintain communication with Charge RN and ICU Director regarding competencies and skill set.
9) Participate in mandatory and optional continuing education as directed.
10) Maintain patient confidentiality and privacy practices in accordance with HIPAA. Complete annual competency and safety training as assigned.
11) Other tasks as delegated by the Charge RN or ICU Director.
Education:
A graduate of an accredited nursing school.

Technical/Formal Training:
Must obtain and maintain a current certification in CPR. The SDU Staff RN must maintain ACLS. New graduate nurses have up to six months to obtain their ACLS. Experienced new hires have 90 days to obtain ACLS.

Knowledge/ Skill/Abilities:
Must be able to follow directions and perform work according to department standards when no directions are given. Must be emotionally mature and able to function effectively under stress.

Experience :
Required: At least one year of experience as Registered Nurse. Will consider prior LPN experience where applicable.
Preferred: One or more years of experience in a Step Down Unit. Med/Surg experience with an aptitude for developing new skills will be considered.

Licensure:
Must possess a current Oklahoma License as a Registered Nurse.

RN, Circulator

Surgical Services (OR)

Tulsa Spine & Specialty Hospital

Monday - Friday

No Weekends, No Holidays, Voluntary Call

Tulsa Spine and Specialty Hospital provides excellence in Surgical Intervention, Diagnostic Imaging, Pain Management, and Customer Service.

BASIC PURPOSE OF THE JOB


Under the direction of the Director of Surgical Services, the Registered Nurse uses clinical expertise, nursing skills and adult teaching/learning principles to assist in the implementation of administrative and clinical objectives to provide cost effective, quality patient care for Tulsa Spine Hospital Patient Care Units. The Registered Nurse serves as a role model for professional practice and participates in assessment, planning and implementation of age and cultural appropriate care according to patient population. Maintains communications with physicians to ensure intensity of service and medical necessity criteria are met and documented. Works with all members of the Patient Care Team to ensure that discharge planning needs are met.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS


1. Assesses patient physiological status, including age specific considerations.
2. Establishes patient goals based on nursing diagnosis.
3. Develops a plan of care that prescribes nursing actions to achieve patient goals.
4. Implements nursing actions, in order to achieve patient goals.
5. Performs nursing actions that demonstrate accountability.
6. Demonstrates maturity and accountability for job performance. Supports facility mission and values, the philosophy, objectives and goals of department and assesses areas of personal and professional growth.
7. Supports and promotes excellence in customer service.
8. Supports and promotes Infection Control Program.
9. Supports and promotes Safety Program.
10. Supports and promotes Risk Management Program.

JOB REQUIREMENTS

Graduate of a NLN accredited school of nursing.
Bachelor of Science Degree in Nursing (BSN) preferred.
Minimum of two years clinical practice with experience in the OR, CCU or SS Departments.
Current Oklahoma RN Licensure
Current Basic Life Support Certification within 30 days of hire
Advanced Cardiac Life Support Certification required within 60 days of hire
Good communication skills, both orally and written, computer skills helpful; ability to work with others as a team to ensure quality patient care. Provides direct patient care as needed.

Registered Nurse

Post-Surgical Floor

Tulsa Spine & Specialty Hospital

1845 - 0715

Tulsa Spine and Specialty Hospital provides excellence in Surgical Intervention, Diagnostic Imaging, Pain Management, and Customer Service.

BASIC PURPOSE OF THE JOB
The Registered Nurse is responsible for delivery of patient care through the nursing process of assessment, diagnosing, planning, implementation, and evaluation. S/He is responsible for directing and coordinating all nursing care for medical/surgical patients based on established clinical nursing practice standards. S/He collaborates with other professional disciplines to ensure effective and efficient patient care delivery and the achievement of desired patient outcomes. S/He serves in a resource role when oriented and as directed. S/He supports the organization's vision and mission. S/He utilizes knowledge of patient age and cultural diversity into the provision of patient care. S/He contributes to the provision of quality nursing care through performance improvement techniques that demonstrate positive outcomes in patient care.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
1. Delivers nursing care according to standards of care defined by the Oklahoma Board of Nursing and the American Nurses Association (ANA) Standards of Clinical Practice.
A. Collects patient health data:
Determines priority of data collection based on patient's immediate condition or needs.
Collects pertinent data using appropriate assessment techniques.
Involves patient, significant others, and health care providers in data collection when appropriate.
Ensures data collection process is systematic and ongoing.
Documents relevant data in the medical record according to hospital standards.
B. Analyzes assessment data in determining diagnoses / patient problems:
Derives diagnoses / patient problems from assessment data.
Validates diagnoses / patient problems with patient, significant others, and health care providers, when possible.
Documents diagnoses / patient problems in a manner that facilitates determination of expected outcomes and plan of care.
C. Identifies expected outcomes individualized to the patient:
Derives outcomes from the diagnoses / patient problems.
Documents outcomes as measurable goals.
Formulates outcomes with the patient and health care providers, when possible.
Ensures outcomes are realistic to patient's present and potential capabilities.
Ensures outcomes are attainable in relation to resources available to the patient.
Ensures outcomes include a time estimate for attainment.
Ensures outcomes provide direction for continuity of care.
D. Develops a plan of care that prescribes interventions to attain expected outcomes:
Individualizes plan to patient's condition or needs.
Develops plan with patient, significant others, and health care providers, when appropriate.
Ensures plan reflects current nursing practice.
Documents plan.
Provides for continuity of care in plan.
E. Implements interventions identified in plan of care.
Establishes interventions that are consistent with plan of care
Implements interventions in a safe and appropriate manner.
Documents interventions.
Safely administers all medications per physician order.
F. Evaluates patient's progress toward attainment of outcomes.
Ensures evaluation is systematic and ongoing.
Documents patient's responses to interventions.
Evaluates effectiveness of interventions in relation to outcomes.
Utilizes ongoing assessment data to revise diagnoses / patient problems, outcomes and plan of care as needed.
Documents revisions in diagnoses / patient problems, outcomes, and plan of care.
Involves patient, significant others, and health care providers in evaluation process, when appropriate.

JOB REQUIREMENTS
Minimum of two years' clinical practice with experience in the specific field.
Ability to utilize the nursing process in the provision of nursing care including, but not limited to: administering treatments and medications; interpreting diagnostic tests, formulating a plan of care, collaborating with other health care providers, and providing education to patients and/or significant others. The successful candidate will be required to pass competencies for this position.

May serve in the role of Charge Nurse and is accountable for professional practice. Adheres to policies and procedures and regulations to ensure compliance and patient safety.

Cath Lab RN utilizes knowledge bases of nursing education and experience in order to deliver nursing care using the nursing process according to hospital policies, procedures, and protocols. Responds to life threatening situations with appropriate interventions. Practices in a Cardiac Cath Lab and/or Invasive Radiology environment through the application of theoretical knowledge and practical skills, included but not limited to cardiac pacing, hemodynamic monitoring, mechanical ventilation. Organizes patient care delivery by prioritizing, delegating, delivering and evaluating on an ongoing basis. The primary responsibility of the registered nurse in the HF CARE Center is care of the patient with congestive heart failure. This individual will possess the basic Medical Surgical competencies and will also have competencies in basic arrhythmia, current BLS and ACLS certification. Responsibilities include: patient assessment--cardiovascular, pulmonary, neurological, skin, emotional; obtaining pertinent medical history; cardiac monitoring and appropriate intervention; medication administration including infusion; direct patient care; aquapheresis therapy; education and counseling about disease process and treatments; documentation in the medical record, and discharging the patient with instructions needed for home management.

Registered nurses are accountable for assessing, planning, implementing, evaluating and documenting care activities in accordance with Hillcrest Health System standards in order to deliver efficient, effective and quality patient care. The Registered Nurse (RN) must be able to demonstrate the knowledge and skills necessary to provide care appropriate to the age of the patients served on the assigned unit. This individual must demonstrate knowledge of the principles of growth and development over the life span, possess the ability to assess data reflective of the patient's status, interpret the appropriate information needed to identify each patient's requirements relative to his/her age-specific needs. The RN is to plan for the provision of patient care including the development, modification and implementation of the plan of care in accordance with HHS standards in order to deliver efficient, effective and quality patient care as described in the Patient Care policies and procedures. He/she is expected to adhere to and abide by the rules and regulations set forth by the Oklahoma Nursing Practice Act.

This position is responsible for patient care coordination on designated shift in assigned department with collaboration with the supervisor or manager. To insure quality patient care consistent with the philosophy and objectives of the organization. This position provides direct operational support for the unit on a shift basis, acts as a clinical resource person for the staff and acts as a liaison between staff and management, assisting the manager in determining staffing needs and identifying problems the designated unit. The charge nurse provides the communication link between manager, supervisor, staff, patients, physicians and others. The position serves as a resource to staff for patient care assessment and in the planning of nursing interventions. The position facilitates problem resolution and collaborates with the manager in assessing quality of care provided, identifying staff strengths and weaknesses, and in evaluation of staff performance. Operational issues are identified by this position, and the individual works to take action and correct problems. Interface with physicians and interdisciplinary teams for comprehensive care planning is also required.

About us: Lovelace Women's Hospital is New Mexico's first and only hospital dedicated to women's health. We are a highly accomplished 120 bed Women's Hospital nestled at the Foot Hills of the Sandia Mountains where it's sunny 360 days a year. Our patients choose Lovelace Women's Hospital because it's a name they trust. Whether we come alongside them for a birthing experience or breast cancer treatment, our primary goal is to offer them exceptional care. For seven consecutive years, Lovelace Women's Hospital has been recognized by Modern Healthcare Magazine as one of the best places to work in healthcare in the nation.

  • 2015 & 2016 Women's Choice Award for America's Best Breast Centers
  • 2016 Women's Choice Award for America's Best Hospitals for Patient Safety
  • Named to Modern Healthcare's 100 Best Places to Work since 2008
  • Zia Award from Quality New Mexico for Best in Class
Facility: Lovelace Women's Hospital is New Mexico's first and only hospital dedicated to women's health and features a 53-bed Level III Neonatal Intensive Care Unit, 24/7 emergency department, 16 labor and delivery rooms, 41-bed Mother-Baby unit, and a Maternal-Fetal Medicine program for high-risk pregnancies. Additionally, the hospital is home to a Natural Birthing Center, where women who wish to have a more natural delivery can deliver in a safe environment. Lovelace Women's Hospital offers a nationally accredited Breast Care Center, digital mammography, and cardiology. Lovelace Women's Hospital also has the latest minimally invasive robotic surgery system, offering surgery with less pain, shorter hospital stays and faster recovery for many gynecological and urological procedures.

You're going to LOVE Lovelace!

About us: Lovelace Women's Hospital is New Mexico's first and only hospital dedicated to women's health. We are a highly accomplished 120 bed Women's Hospital nestled at the Foot Hills of the Sandia Mountains where it's sunny 360 days a year. Our patients choose Lovelace Women's Hospital because it's a name they trust. Whether we come alongside them for a birthing experience or breast cancer treatment, our primary goal is to offer them exceptional care. For seven consecutive years, Lovelace Women's Hospital has been recognized by Modern Healthcare Magazine as one of the best places to work in healthcare in the nation.

  • 2015 & 2016 Women's Choice Award for America's Best Breast Centers
  • 2016 Women's Choice Award for America's Best Hospitals for Patient Safety
  • Named to Modern Healthcare's 100 Best Places to Work since 2008
  • Zia Award from Quality New Mexico for Best in Class
Facility: Lovelace Women's Hospital is New Mexico's first and only hospital dedicated to women's health and features a 53-bed Level III Neonatal Intensive Care Unit, 24/7 emergency department, 16 labor and delivery rooms, 41-bed Mother-Baby unit, and a Maternal-Fetal Medicine program for high-risk pregnancies. Additionally, the hospital is home to a Natural Birthing Center, where women who wish to have a more natural delivery can deliver in a safe environment. Lovelace Women's Hospital offers a nationally accredited Breast Care Center, digital mammography, and cardiology. Lovelace Women's Hospital also has the latest minimally invasive robotic surgery system, offering surgery with less pain, shorter hospital stays and faster recovery for many gynecological and urological procedures.

This position is responsible for patient care coordination on designated shift in assigned department with collaboration with the supervisor or manager. The Clinical Leader will promote the mission and values of Hillcrest Healthcare System and be an active advocate of providing quality patient care, excellent customer service and efficient health care. As a member of the leadership team, this individual will be involved in system planning, budgeting, manpower planning and program development in accordance with HHS standards in order to deliver efficient, effective and quality patient care. The Clinical Leader will also be expected to regular staff on the unit as a Charge Nurse. As a Clinical Leader he/she is expected to adhere to and abide by the rules and regulations set forth by the Oklahoma Nursing Practice Act.
Education: Graduate of accredited school of nursing

Licensure/Certification: RN license issued by the OK BON. Must possess and maintain a current BLS and ACLS. CNOR, PALS preferred.

Experience: 3 5 Years of related experience preferred.

Skills: Organizational, verbal, interpersonal, mathematical, analytical, grammar/spelling, read/comprehend written instructions, and follow verbal instructions.

Mental and Emotional Requirements: Manage stress appropriately, make decisions under pressure, manage anger/fear/hostility/violence of others appropriately, handle multiple priorities, work alone, and work in areas that are confined and/or crowded.
