Individuals within this job classification are responsible to assist the Manager/Director in the coordination and management of activities in the organizational unit (department(s)), including:

1. Coordinating delivery of services continuum.

2. Assisting with coordinating inter/intra departmental services as necessary

3. Assisting with the development and implementation of policies and procedures that guide/support departmental services

4. Assisting with assessment/evaluation of staff qualifications and competence

5. Participating in the assessment and improvement of departmental quality targets and performance

6. Maintaining appropriate quality control programs

7. Providing orientation and continuing education for staff

8. Recommending space/other resources needed by the department

9. Participating in the selection of outside services.

10. The Clinical Leader will also be expected to staff the unit as a Charge Nurse as regularly and/or as needed.

Bailey Medical Center (BMC) located in Owasso, Oklahoma is a premier provider of health care service voted Modern Healthcares Top 100 best places to work three years running. BMC is a premier provider of health care services, delivered with compassion for patients and their families, with respect for employees, physicians and other health professionals, with accountability for our fiscal and ethical performance, and with responsibility to the communities we serve.

This position is responsible for patient care coordination on designated shift for BMC in patient care areas in collaboration with the administrator on call. To insure quality patient care consistent with the philosophy and objectives of the organization, this position provides direct operational support for the hospital on a shift basis, acts as a clinical resource person for the staff and acts as a liaison between staff and mgmt, assisting the administrator in determining staffing needs and identifying problems within the campus. The House supervisor provides the communication link between manager, staff, patients, physicians and others. This position serves as a resource to staff for patient bed assessment and in the planning of emergency nursing interventions. The position facilitates problem resolution and collaborates with administration, and the Medical director in assessing quality of care provided, identifying staff strengths and weaknesses and in evaluation of staff performance. Operational issues are identified by this position and the position works to take action and correct problems. Interface with physicians and interdisciplinary teams for comprehensive care planning is also required.

Critial Care and/or ER experience required
House Supervisor experience preferred but will train right candidate

Must have current Oklahoma RN license, BLS, ACLS and PALS certifications upon hire.

Demonstrates the appropriate skills and ability, based on scope of practice, level of training and/or licensure, to assess, treat, and/or care for patients based on the age of the patient. Age groups may include the newborn, pediatric, adolescent, adult and geriatric patients. (Varying levels of practitioner and/or caregiver will have different skills and abilities.) The skill and ability may include knowledge of growth and development, ranges of treatment and the ability to obtain and interpret information regarding patient needs. The criteria to deliver age appropriate care shall be in the individual departmental policies and procedures. Functions as an effective public relations representative both within and outside the hospital. Acts as the CNO in her absence.

Unit Description:
BSA Health System in Amarillo, Texas is seeking a Manager of Surgical Services. The Manager of Surgical Services will oversee areas of the Surgery and Sterile Processing. This position will report to the Director of Surgical Services. We are seeking an innovative leader who is able to maintain the work flow of busy surgical services departments and maintain a positive working environment. We are looking for someone who is not afraid of challenges and has the ability to provide a great place for our patients!

Job Summary:
The Manager of Surgical Services will oversee approximately 75 FTEs with an average of 1100 procedures per month. Responsible for hiring, evaluating, educating, and counseling staff in all areas. Maintaining productivity, constantly improving customer satisfaction and employee satisfaction ratings. Reviewing, updating, and enforcing polices while maintaining department statistics.

Education/Licenses and Certifications:

Texas eligible licensed Registered Nurse.

BSN required; MSN, Business, Health Administration or related field preferred.

AORN and/or Certification of Nursing Administration preferred.

Surgical services based nursing background to include 3-5 years management experience in the Operating Room or related units of a comparable size facility with overall 8-10 years in nursing.

Strong communication skills, team building expertise, experience in managing programs and staff, along with collaborating with physicians.

Qualifications/Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:

Responsible for the 24-hour operations for the OR and Sterile Processing

16-multi-purpose surgical suites and 2 cystoscopy suites operated on a 24-hr basis with approximately 50-surgeons

Most frequent surgeries are: General Surgery, Orthopedic, Vascular, Urology, Cardiothoracic, Neurosurgery, ENT, Gynecology, Plastics, Robotics and Bariatrics; 13,200 surgeries annually

Selects, develops, and maintains a team of competent staff

Sets throughput and efficiency goals for the department

Hold self and team accountable for achieving a high level of quality of care, customer service, as well as employee and physician satisfaction

Responsible for achieving established financial budget outcomes

Schedule Details:

Status: Full Time

Days: Varied

Hours: Varied

Shift: Varied

job.hours: Non-traditional hours as needed 40+ per week possible
job.jobDescription:
The Medical/Surgical nursing department consists of a 30-bed pre and post surgical unit. The unit is supported by an interdisciplinary team, working to ensure quality driven initiatives and excellent patient care.

Job Summary:

The Nurse Manager is responsible for assisting the Director with the overall responsibilities of Medical/ Surgical department in accordance with established nursing standards, philosophy and BSA Mission and Vision. The Nurse Manager serves as a vital link between management and the clinical staff as well as strives to achieve efficient, safe and cost effective patient care.

The Nurse Manager assists with the day to day management operations of the Medical/Surgical unit, along with growth and development of the staff.

The Nurse Manager helps to achieve positive customer service scores by rounding on patients and staff, modeling high standards of customer service with the expectation of accountability of staff and excellent clinical skills.

License/Certifications/Education:

Current Texas RN; BSN preferred

CPR American Heart Association or American Red Cross

Qualifications/Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:

3 years minimum nursing experience; Medical/Surgical experience preferred

Leadership and management skills in a hospital environment

Interpersonal skills effective in fostering team building, communication, and professional accountability

Assist with the plan of care, evaluate and coordinate care with other disciplines

Solid understanding of financial and productivity management and of patient flow

Understanding of educational requirements, clinical competencies and certifications of the unit staff

Competent computer use including various computer programs, analyzing data and generating reports

Possess strong verbal and written communication, organizational, teamwork and follow-through skills

Multi-task constantly and tolerate interruptions

Clear and effective delegation skills

Communicate effectively with all members of the healthcare team

Value driven commitment to provide quality healthcare service with exceptional patient experiences

Cardiology is an excellent unit to let your organizational skills, critical thinking and your compassion shine!

job.jobTitle: Registered Nurse (RN) Intensive Care Unit (ICU) / Critical
job.jobDescription:
Registered Nurse (RN) Intensive Care Unit (ICU) / Critical Care

Lovelace Medical Center is seeking a full-time Intensive Care Unit (ICU) / Critical Care Registered Nurse (RN) to work 3rd Night Shift at our premier facility in Albuquerque, NM. This is a great gateway opportunity for a qualified Registered Nurse looking to become an Advance Practice RN. Position highlights also include:

- Closed Unit with Pulmonologists as Primary Providers

- Increasing Surgical and Neuro Base

Job Duties

The Intensive Care Unit (ICU) / Critical Care Registered Nurse (RN) is responsible for the practice of professional nursing including assigned patient care, critical care and staff management. The RN may serve in the role of Charge Nurse and must adhere to policies, procedures and regulations to ensure compliance and patient safety. This position also requires the candidate's ability to:

- Provide strict patient confidentiality

- Thrive well in a team setting

- Communicate effectively, both orally and in writing

- Maintain strong organization and prioritization skills

- Effectively problem solve

Candidate Requirements

- Associate's Degree or Diploma in Nursing Required

- ACLS Required by Department

- Valid NM RN License or Compact License Required

- Minimum 2 years of RN ICU /Critical Care Experience

- Bachelor's Degree in Nursing Preferred

Contact Daniel Mormak for more information:

Email: daniel.mormak@lovelace.com

Phone: (505) 718-4035

Registered Nurse-OR - Lovelace Regional Hospital- Roswell

Sign on Bonus up to $15,000!!

You're going to LOVE Lovelace!

About us: Lovelace Regional Hospital Roswell is committed to offering Roswell and Chaves County residents the highest quality patient care. We are dedicated to exceeding our patients' expectations in every way.

Lovelace Regional Hospital Roswell is now hiring a Registered Nurse, OR.

Summary of Job Duties:
Responsible and accountable for the practice of Professional Nursing, to include patient care and staff management assigned to the RN in his/her charge. May serve in the role of Charge Nurse and is accountable for professional practice. Adheres to policies and procedures and regulations to ensure compliance and patient safety.

1)Manages the patient care process by ensuring that a comprehensive patient assessment and plan of care is completed and documented on all patients within the time frame of the established policy.

2)Manages staff members, assesses the needs of patients, and delegates tasks appropriately.

3)Establishes collaborative relationships with members of the healthcare team and facilitates the generation of ideas for improvement of patient care and functioning of the unit.

4)Adheres to regulatory and organization policies and procedures to ensure compliance and patient safety.

5)Participates and attends departmental meetings and professional development activities.

6)Demonstrates quality improvement, facilitating the generation of ideas for improvement of patient care and functioning of the unit.

7)Responsible for completing basic RN competencies in addition to departmental specific competencies.

8)Takes ownership of assignments; other duties as assigned or requested.

9)Communicates and listens effectively with internal and external customers; effectively understands instructions and shares knowledge.

10)Cooperates and interacts with supervisors, peers, other departments, and all customer groups demonstrating our commitment to "service".

Education Minimum: Associate's Degree or Diploma of Nursing

Desired: Bachelor's Degree in Nursing Technical/Formal Training Knowledge/Skills/Abilities
Ability to maintain strict patient confidentiality; Management skills; strong organization and problem solving skills; works well in a team setting; communicates effectively both orally and in writing.

Experience Desired: One (1) year experience

Licensure Valid NM RN License or valid multi-state compact license and BLS; HIRING DEPARTMENT MAY ALSO REQUIRE ACLS and or PALS.

Lovelace Women's Hospital is hiring a Post Partum Nurse (Full Time-Days)

At LWH we offer competitive salaries. Additional compensation for BSN, National Certifications, as well as one of the highest Shift Differentials in the healthcare industry . Benefits include Health, Dental, Vision Insurance, 401K, Tuition Reimbursement, Loan Forgiveness and Relocation Assistance. Lovelace Women's Hospital has been Recognized as Best Place to Work (#5 nationally) by Modern Healthcare for 8 years.

Job Summary
Registered nurse renders highly professional and technical nursing care to assigned patients. Provides direct and indirect patient care using the nursing process (assessment, planning, implementation, and evaluation). Directs and supervises other assigned team members and collaborates with multidisciplinary team members to provide age/developmentally appropriate care in accordance with unit standards of care. Supports the mission, vision, values and strategic goals of Lovelace Women's Hospital.


Minimum: Associate's Degree or Diploma of Nursing
Desired: Bachelor's Degree in Nursing

Licenses and/or Certifications
Current BLS certification required.
Current NRP certification required.
Current license to practice professional nursing in the state of New Mexico required or Compact State, must acquire NM Lic within 90 days.

You're going to LOVE Lovelace!

About us: Lovelace Women's Hospital is New Mexico's first and only hospital dedicated to women's health. We are a highly accomplished 120 bed Women's Hospital nestled at the Foot Hills of the Sandia Mountains where it's sunny 360 days a year. Our patients choose Lovelace Women's Hospital because it's a name they trust. Whether we come alongside them for a birthing experience or breast cancer treatment, our primary goal is to offer them exceptional care. For seven consecutive years, Lovelace Women's Hospital has been recognized by Modern Healthcare Magazine as one of the best places to work in healthcare in the nation.

  • 2015 & 2016 Women's Choice Award for America's Best Breast Centers
  • 2016 Women's Choice Award for America's Best Hospitals for Patient Safety
  • Named to Modern Healthcare's 100 Best Places to Work since 2008
  • Zia Award from Quality New Mexico for Best in Class

Facility: Lovelace Women's Hospital is New Mexico's first and only hospital dedicated to women's health and features a 53-bed Level III Neonatal Intensive Care Unit, 24/7 emergency department, 16 labor and delivery rooms, 41-bed Mother-Baby unit, and a Maternal-Fetal Medicine program for high-risk pregnancies. Additionally, the hospital is home to a Natural Birthing Center, where women who wish to have a more natural delivery can deliver in a safe environment. Lovelace Women's Hospital offers a nationally accredited Breast Care Center, digital mammography, and cardiology. Lovelace Women's Hospital also has the latest minimally invasive robotic surgery system, offering surgery with less pain, shorter hospital stays and faster recovery for many gynecological and urological procedures.

Contact Daniel Mormak for more information:

Email: daniel.mormak@lovelace.com

Phone: (505) 718-4035

Unit Summary:

The Orthopedic unit is a 35-bed unit with an average patient mix of 75% orthopedic surgical patients and 25% medical surgical overflow. The routine patient to nurse ratio fluctuates with patient census; unit goal is 5 to 1 ratio. The unit is supported by a team consisting of the Unit Secretary, Patient Care Assistants, Transporters, Nutrition Ambassadors, RN's, RN Shift Supervisor's, a Clinical Educator, the Nurse Manager and Director along with a strong Physical and Occupational Therapy presence working as a cohesive team to ensure excellent patient care.

RN, ER

Lovelace Regional Hospital- Roswell is committed to offering Roswell and Chaves County residents the highest quality patient care. We are dedicated to exceeding our patients' expectations in every way.

1) Manages the patient care process by ensuring that a comprehensive patient assessment and plan of care is completed and documented on all patients within the time frame of the established policy.
2) Manages staff members, assesses the needs of patients, and delegates tasks appropriately.
3) Establishes collaborative relationships with members of the healthcare team and facilitates the generation of ideas for improvement of patient care and functioning of the unit.
4) Adheres to regulatory and organization policies and procedures to ensure compliance and patient safety.
5) Participates and attends departmental meetings and professional development activities.
6) Demonstrates quality improvement, facilitating the generation of ideas for improvement of patient care and functioning of the unit.
7) Responsible for completing basic RN competencies in addition to departmental specific competencies.
8) Takes ownership of assignments; other duties as assigned or requested.
9) Communicates and listens effectively with internal and external customers; effectively understands instructions and shares knowledge.
10) Cooperates and interacts with supervisors, peers, other departments, and all customer groups demonstrating our commitment to "service".

job.jobTitle: Registered Nurse (RN) Intensive Care Unit (ICU) / Critical
job.jobDescription:
Lovelace Westside Hospital is seeking a full-time Intensive Care Unit (ICU) / Critical Care Registered Nurse (RN) to work 3rd Night Shift at our premier facility in Albuquerque, NM. This is a great gateway opportunity for a qualified Registered Nurse looking to become an Advance Practice RN. Position highlights also include:

- Closed Unit with Pulmonologists as Primary Providers

- Increasing Neuro Base

Job Duties

The Intensive Care Unit (ICU) / Critical Care Registered Nurse (RN) is responsible for the practice of professional nursing including assigned patient care, critical care and staff management. The RN may serve in the role of Charge Nurse and must adhere to policies, procedures and regulations to ensure compliance and patient safety. This position also requires the candidate's ability to:

- Provide strict patient confidentiality

- Thrive well in a team setting

- Communicate effectively, both orally and in writing

- Maintain strong organization

- Effectively problem solve

Candidate Requirements

- Associate's Degree or Diploma in Nursing Required

- ACLS and or PALS Required by Department

- Valid NM RN License or Compact License Required

- Minimum 1 year of RN ICU /Critical Care Experience Preferred

- Bachelor's Degree in Nursing Preferred

Contact Daniel Mormak for more information:

Email: daniel.mormak@lovelace.com

Phone: (505) 718-4035

Job Summary:
The PACU nurse is responsible for assessing the patient: vital signs, pain, and the site of the incision, temperature and respirations. The PACU nurse should have a thorough knowledge of pain medications and be able to use his/her own judgment of a patient's pain. Duties of a PACU nurse include changing of dressings, turning a patient, breathing exercises and pain management. Requires critical thinking and organization. Friendly, professional communication skills are required to be able to communicate with patients, families, physicians and other healthcare team members as needed.

Unit Description:
Harrington Cancer Center is a department within the BSA Health System and has provided care for oncology patients throughout the Texas Panhandle for 30 years. Harrington Cancer Center sees over 100 patients a day and sees all patients of all ages.

Job Summary:

T he primary care nurse functions within the framework of the primary nursing model assuming the care of a case load of patients from admission throughout the continuum of care. The primary Care Nurse is accountable for delivering care by utilizing the nursing process, the ONS Standards of Oncology Nursing Practice and the principles of Continuous Quality Improvement in collaboration with the healthcare team. Must be an RN currently licensed by the State of Texas with at least one year oncology experience.

Licenses and Certifications:

  • An RN currently licensed by the State of Texas with at least one year Oncology experience Required
  • BSN Preferred
  • OCN Certification Preferred
  • Current CPR certification Required

Qualifications/Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:

  • Exhibits desire to exemplify the BSA culture, including the BSA Mission, Vision and the BSA Way .
  • Demonstrates positive, customer focused interpersonal and business telephone skills
  • Communicates well, and exhibits:
    • Strong English verbal skills
    • Ability to read and understand English language
    • Strong interpersonal skills and ability to interact with customers and healthcare professionals at all levels
    • Legible writing skills and penmanship in English language
  • Is organized and has follow-through skills
  • Possesses keyboard data entry skills and working knowledge of computers and basic office equipment
  • Has strong grasp of medical terminology
  • Works in a fast paced environment and adapt to rapidly changing situations
  • Quickly evaluates and prioritizes requests of staff and physicians
  • Deals with employees, patients, physicians and visitors in stressful situations
  • Is well versed in HIPAA laws and keep patient documentation and information confidential
  • Can multi-task constantly and tolerate interruptions
  • Works as part of a cohesive medical team to care for patients and deliver exceptional customer service
  • Bi-lingual strongly desired.

Status: Full Time

Hours: 8:00 AM 5:00 PM

Day's Work: Monday - Friday

Shift: 1st - Day

Work Schedule: 8.00

job.jobDescription:
The One-Call Center is a medically based call center manned with licensed nursing (RN) staff that facilitates transfers and admits within the hospital system. The One-Call center operates Monday through Saturday 10:00am to 8:00pm.

Job Summary:

Serves as a member of the BSA transfer center in driving communication and coordination of transfer/admission to the hospital. The Transfer Specialist evaluates patient status, need, and helps determine the appropriateness and priority of the request, as well as hospital bed availability. The Transfer Specialist must continuously communicate with Physicians, facilities, and the Administrator on call.


License/Certification/Education:

Current Texas RN license

BSN or working towards higher education preferred

Qualifications/Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:

Minimum 3-5 yrs nursing experience in an acute care setting
Supervisory experience a plus

Strong clinical assessment skills and critical thinking ability

Excellent telephone communication and listening skills

Working knowledge of applicable regulatory rules and requirements is beneficial

Ability to communicate effectively with excellent verbal communication; professional, friendly, helpful in facilitating transfers/admissions

Ability to work with diverse members of the health care team

Must be able to work independently
Must project and maintain professionalism and effectiveness in high stress situations

Proficient computer use; Microsoft Office, Excel; accurate daily data input


Schedule Details:

Full-time

Varied Days - One Call Center requires coverage 7-days a week

10- to- 11-hr shifts typical hours are 9:00am - 8:00pm

Location: Lovelace Central Business Office

Lovelace Women's Hospital is hiring a Social Worker. The Social Worker provides casework, discharge planning, psycholosocial, and financial counseling services to patients and their families in response to the emotional and social problems that arise in connection with an illness.
  • Completes a social history, spiritual assessment and an initial bereavement risk.
  • Demonstrates knowledge and responsibility for patient safety in aspects of patient care.
  • Provides counseling services to patients, family members and home care staff.
Qualifications:
  • Minimum: Masters Degree in Social Work
  • Strong interpersonal and communication (written and verbal), ability to deal with highly stressful situations, ability to function independently and with others, maintain strict confidentiality.
  • 2 years of previous job related experience. Must meet hiring eligibility requirements following fingerprinting and police background check.

The Collections Specialist is responisible for the following:

    1. Receives reports and manipulates and sorts them by group, dollar amounts, and FSC.
    2. Sends report to offices with all accounts in a CL2 FSC and a balance greater than 50.01for their review and approval to send to collection agency. Advises offices of deadline to return and if not the accounts will automatically be sent to collection agency.
    3. Review accounts/invoices to determine if insurances have been billed, for updated patient addresses and notes accounts. If it is determined insurance wasn't filed than account will be changed to insurance FSC and insurance filed.
    4. Receives returned mail and updates account to reflect bad address. Sends returned mail to the office so they can review chart for updated information and if none they are to call the patient to obtain. If new address found then resets dunning level and sends statement to new address.
    5. Moves accounts/invoices to collections in IDX.
    6. Moves all accounts/invoices under 50.00 to Bad Debt FSC.
    7. Reviews all accounts/invoices to determine if the balances can be combined and sent to collections.
    8. Communicates with collection agencies and provides needed information to them when requested.
    9. Other duties as assigned.

The A/R Specialist is responsible for assigned objectives regarding the open position requirements:

1. Maintains and works accounts using the designated workflow process or application (ETM, Direct Remit or any other means) as assigned by Manager.

4. Process accounts according to Objectives and HHS Policy whether verbal or written.

6. Continue self-education by attending two job related seminars and/or webinars each year.

1. Processes all Patient and/or Insurance refunds in a timely manner, complying with written process.

2. Process daily correspondence.

3. Process accounts according to Objectives and HHS Policy.

4. Process clinic requests within a timely manner.

5. Working though credit spreadsheet report per process.

6. All other duties as assigned.

The Transcription Specialist is responsible for performing quality control (QC) functions for transcription services on voice and text files, including blanks, inaccuracies, and verification of provider and patient type. Responsible for researching questions regarding dictation and transcribed reports. Provides training, orientation for providers, employees and contractors. Maintains and develops training materials, data tables and files. Completes daily reports of QC functions to be submitted to HIM Sr. Supervisor on a weekly basis. Identifies system problems and/or physician dictation problems and reports them to the HIM Sr. Supervisor.

Transcription Education/Training preferred

The individual assists in the effective operation through teamwork, customer service/satisfaction, quality assurance, adherence to legal and financial regulations, providing feedback and assisting in the development and implementation of policies and procedures

Responsible for planning, organizing, supervising, and rendering speech-language pathology services to patients/clients of all ages who have impairments, functional limitations, disabilities, or changes in physical function and health status resulting from injury, disease, or other causes; provide prevention and wellness services, including screenings and health promotion. The overall responsibility of the Sr. Application Analyst (Lawson) - HR & Payroll is to provide client support, perform analysis, design, configuration, testing, documentation and roll out of technologies to meet Ardent's enterprise needs. Lead designated projects within the HR/Payroll environment. Additional responsibilities include but are not limited to: developing system strategies with management and other stakeholders, conducting business needs analyses, identifying and mitigating project risks, supporting the application users and assisting in the implementation of the application projects.

Analysis and Solution Definition:

Communication:

Problem Solving:

  • Provides leadership and technical guidance to identify system deficiencies and analyze system problems and solutions.
  • Exhibits confidence and an extensive knowledge of emerging industry practices when solving business problems.
  • Collaborates with business stakeholders to introduce innovative solutions.

Leadership:

  • Facilitates effective team interaction.
  • Acknowledges and appreciates each team member's contributions.

General:

  • A relentless drive to be the best.
  • Ability to travel as needed

Qualifications

Education

Bachelor's Degree, or equivalent business experience in supporting a Human Resource &/Payroll ERP system such as Lawson, PeopleSoft, SAP, JDEdwards.

Experience

job.jobTitle: Application Analyst ~ Epic Resolute Hospital Billing
job.jobDescription:
Ardent Health Services (AHS) is a national healthcare company headquartered in Nashville, TN. Our subsidiaries own and operate hospitals and multispecialty physician practices in three states. Ardent includes: 3 health systems with 14 hospitals, 2,194 licenses beds, 12,000 employees, and 3 physician groups with 270 employed physicians. Within the industry, we are noted for recognizing that every hospital is as unique as the community it serves. This in-depth understanding of how health care works at the local level is one of our great strengths.

We have an exciting opportunity to join our team as an Application Analyst in Epic Resolute Hospital Billing.

Position Summary:

This position is responsible for in-depth knowledge of assigned Epic System software. This position conducts regular day-to-day communication, reviews software, demonstrates a deeper understanding of business operations, and works with Epic, the Project Team(s), Ardent Health Systems Subject Matter Experts, and end users to tailor the system to fit the organizations needs. This position routinely performs in-depth analysis of workflows, data collection, report details, and other technical issues associated with the use of Epic software; is responsible for developing and documenting the internal procedures that will be used in conjunction with Epic applications; and will design, build, test, install and maintain those solutions.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Work with Application Managers/Directors/etc. and the entire Project Team, to collect, analyze and document business operations and workflow.
  • Complete all tasks in a timely manner with accurate documentation.
  • Collaborate effectively with colleagues and across teams to achieve the completion of tasks.
  • Troubleshoot problems and address questions from users, and provide on-call support on a rotating basis.
  • Make recommendations, review and test changes, enhancements, and each new release as assigned.
  • Ensure the test scripts have been created, reviewed, and updated to reflect proposed workflow solutions.
  • Analyze data conversion needs.
  • Support the training team by keeping trainers abreast of new functionality and system changes.
  • Analyze new functionality in new releases to identify impact.
  • Understands interface requirements and considerations to ensure appropriate testing is done to validate workflow from end to end.
  • Provide assigned on-site support during go-lives and system upgrades.
  • Ensures all quality assurance processes are followed, including change management and testing efforts.
  • Actively participate and contribute in meetings.
  • Works with the Application Manager/Director in the assessment of projects for scoping and timelines.
  • Participate in disaster recovery measures.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Must have a BA/BS degree or equivalent and 2+ years of experience.
  • Certified in Epic Resolute Hospital Billing
  • Demonstrate effective oral, written communication and follow-up skills, as well as strong interpersonal relationship skills.
  • Demonstrate strong desktop tool usage including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
  • Must have good process design experience.
  • Demonstrate basic project management skills (ability to lead meetings, prioritize, resolve conflicts, maintain issues list, manage project plan).
  • Must be self-motivated, detail-oriented, and a problem solver.

Unit Summary:

Environmental Services (EVS) is a vital part of BSA in maintaining a sterile environment for patients. Each day EVS conducts an average of 300 routine cleans (this includes patient rooms, office areas, etc.) and 100 checkouts (which are rooms vacated by discharged patients).

Job Summary:

Responsible for maintaining a clean, safe, and attractive environment for patients, staff and visitors within the hospital; meeting all required standards and regulations.

Licensure/Certification/Registration:

Membership in National Executive Housekeeping Association is optional.

Experience preferred:

Five (5) years Environmental Services Supervisory Experience.

Education/Training preferred:

Bachelor of Science Degree with emphasis in Management and Environmental Issues.

Skills & Abilities:

- Good organizational and follow-through skills

- Must be able to utilize basic computer concepts, copier, and other equipment, as needed.

- Must have good communication skills (Written and Verbal). Possess adequate speaking and/or hearing ability to respond to telephone and other equipment and to communicate effectively with employees/customers.

- Strong time management skills, including the ability to multi-task constantly and tolerate interruptions.

- Position requires fluency in English language to function in job environment appropriately

- Must exhibit desire to exemplify the BSA culture, including the BSA Mission, Vision and the BSA Way

- Strong interpersonal and customer service skills.

- Problem Solving and organizational skills. Requires cognitive skills for reasoning and interpreting information, for developing and implementing educational programs, for problem solving, prioritizing, planning, and coordinating, and for critical thinking.

- Ability to make quick, accurate decisions and function calmly under stressful situations.

- Handles sensitive/confidential information appropriately.

- Ability to write legibly

Schedule Details:

- Full-time

- Days/Shift varied

- 8.00 hours work schedule

Responsible for registration of patients. Conducts patient interviews to obtain required information, complete requested forms, and obtain signatures. Explains hospital's financial policy. Distributes information to required hospital departments. Collect POS and POA upon admission.

High school diploma or GED equivalent

Knowledge of medical terminology. Good typing and computer skills. Flexible schedule.

Job Summary:
Primary responsibilities include advanced level of securing, maintaining and monitoring the health of the server environment throughout the enterprise, which encompasses conducting utilization studies and the establishment of fault notification processes, analyzing data to recognize trends and create automated proactive measures to prevent application downtime. Provides second and third level end-user support and mentor junior members of the Operations team. This position will work closely with other members of the Ardent Information Technology team to support the overall mission of the company and its long-term strategic business initiatives.

Educations/Licenses and Certifications:
Required-degree in Information Technology / Computer Science or equivalent technical training.
Required-MCSE 2000/2003/2008 and/or VCP

Qualifications/Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:
Minimum of seven years experience in information technology, preferably in the healthcare industry\
Minimum of five years experience working with Intel servers.
Minimum of three years experience working in VMware and Citrix environment.
Project management experience as it relates to user and server migration.
Working knowledge and experience with ITIL foundation processes.
Experience with SolarWinds Orion monitoring.
Experience with Cisco UCS and IBM server platforms.
Extensive experience with securing a Microsoft server environment.
Must have good communication skills both oral and written.
Must have good project management skills.
Must display the ability to be a team player and work well with employees at all levels.
Must be attentive to details as it relates to server documentation, standard operating practices and server rack configurations.
Extensive knowledge of Microsoft 2003, 2008, and 2012 Server.
Extensive knowledge of core infrastructure services (DNS, DHCP, IIS, AD group policies, Exchange, File Services, etc.)
Extensive knowledge supporting and administering enterprise applications such as VMware vCenter and ESXi, VDI solutions such as VMware View or XenDesktop, Rightfax services, Exchange services, Tivoli Endpoint Manager, and Citrix Presentation Server.
Extensive knowledge with clustering and highly available network solutions across multiple data centers.
Expert at troubleshooting complex problems.
Broad knowledge of systems management, scripting and automation.
Broad knowledge of storage solutions including SAN, NAS, CIFs, NFS, replication, deduplication.
Strong working knowledge of Scripting.
Knowledge of applicable data privacy practices and laws (HIPAA).
Prior healthcare experience preferred.

Schedule Details:
Status: Full Time
Days: Monday - Friday
Hours: 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM
Work Schedule: 8.00
Shift: 1st - Day

Ardent Health Services (AHS) is a national healthcare company headquartered in Nashville, TN. Our subsidiaries own and operate hospitals and multispecialty physician practices in three states. Ardent includes: 3 health systems with 14 hospitals, 2,194 licenses beds, 12,000 employees, and 3 physician groups with 270 employed physicians. Within the industry, we are noted for recognizing that every hospital is as unique as the community it serves. This in-depth understanding of how healthcare works at the local level is one of our great strengths.
The Intel Sr. Systems Engineer - Citrix will be responsible for advanced level of securing, maintaining and monitoring the health of the server environment throughout the enterprise, which encompasses conducting utilization studies and the establishment of fault notification processes, analyzing data to recognize trends and create automated proactive measures to prevent application downtime. Provides second and third level end-user support and mentor junior members of the Operations team. This position will work closely with other members of the Ardent Information Technology team to support the overall mission of the company and its long-term strategic business initiatives.
Education
  • Required-degree in Information Technology / Computer Science or equivalent technical training.
  • Required-MCSE 2000/2003/2008 and/or VCP
Experience

  • Minimum of seven years experience in information technology, preferably in the healthcare industry
  • Minimum of five years experience working with Intel servers.
  • Minimum of three years experience working in VMware and Citrix environment.
  • Project management experience as it relates to user and server migration
  • Working knowledge and experience with ITIL foundation processes.
  • Experience with SolarWinds Orion monitoring.
  • Experience with Cisco UCS and IBM server platforms.
  • Extensive experience with securing a Microsoft server environment.

Additional Requirements

  • Extensive knowledge of Citrix.
  • Extensive knowledge of Microsoft 2003, 2008, and 2012 Server.
  • Extensive knowledge of core infrastructure services (DNS, DHCP, IIS, AD group policies, Exchange, File Services, etc.)
  • Extensive knowledge supporting and administering enterprise applications such as VMware vCenter and ESXi, VDI solutions such as VMware View or XenDesktop, Rightfax services, Exchange services, Tivoli Endpoint Manager, and Citrix Presentation Server.
  • Extensive knowledge with clustering and highly available network solutions across multiple data centers.
  • Expert at troubleshooting complex problems.
  • Broad knowledge of systems management, scripting and automation.
  • B road knowledge of storage solutions including SAN, NAS, CIFs, NFS, replication, deduplication.
  • Strong working knowledge of Scripting.
  • Knowledge of applicable data privacy practices and laws (HIPAA).
  • Prior healthcare experience preferred.


Primary Duties and Responsibilities

  • Provide advanced level of support for servers, storage systems and infrastructure services. This individual may lead and direct the work of others on occasion to accomplish the common goals of the Operations team. This individual also participates in the planning and implementation of policies and procedures to ensure system provisioning and maintenance is consistent with company goals, industry best practices, and regulatory requirements.
  • Assist with the implementation of new technologies and verify that all procedural documentation is accurate, and that knowledge transfer from the engineering team is completed prior to any technology being placed in the Production environment.
  • Act as a contributor to enterprise level strategic projects, meeting milestone deadlines, and accomplishing project action items.
  • Ensure that proper operating procedures are adhered to during the full lifecycle of all servers throughout the enterprise including documentation, server builds, server maintenance, monitoring, support, refresh/upgrades, and decommission.
  • Required to administer data within corporate change, problem management and request systems; monitor assignment and completion of efforts documented in these systems; and properly escalate issues to management. Through escalations this role may serve as a point of contact for interactions with vendors on issue resolution.
  • Installs various types of software including operating systems and applications on a variety of hardware platforms including system updates, patches and configuration changes.
  • Analyze monitoring data to recognize trends and create proactive solutions to prevent recurring issues
  • Maintain operations of enterprise shared services and assist application teams as needed
  • Installs and maintains server hardware, system racks ensuring a visually clean and consistent environment. With installation and maintenance comes the need to maintain the asset inventory across the brand, including servers and software licenses.
  • Facilitate training, coaching, and mentoring junior team members to promote their skills development.
  • Serve as level 3 support of core infrastructure services utilizing the incident management ticketing system. Works closely with IT&S teams to resolve internal customer issues.
  • Perform other duties as assigned.


Benefits
  • Competitive Paid Time Off program
  • 401(k) Retirement Savings
  • Competitive Salary
  • Bonus targets based on company and individual performance
  • Comprehensive Medical, Dental and Vision Benefits
  • Company provided & Optional Life Insurance
  • Healthcare & dependant care flexible spending accounts

Lovelace Regional Hospital Roswell is now hiring a Sterile Processing Tech.

  • Demonstrates the ability to read and interpret the surgery schedule and take a lead role in determining the instrumentation and staff work flow.
  • Demonstrates an advanced understanding of the procedures/policies required for decontamination and terminal sterilization of instrumentation while instituting protective measures to assure proper decontamination and sterilization.

  • Maintains instrumentation/equipment in good working order and reports malfunctions or broken items or unsafe instrumentation to appropriate personnel.
  • Demonstrates working knowledge of decontaminator, ultrasonic, washer sterilizer, hand washing delicate, flexible, power instrumentation, steam, plasma-hydrogen peroxide, paracetic acid methods of stylization.

Qualifications:

  • Minimum: High school diploma or equivalent.
  • Advanced knowledge of regulatory standards for universal precautions, sterilization methodologies, and regulatory standards for biological monitoring.
  • Ability to take a lead role in workflow and problem solve equipment malfunctioning.
  • One (1) year of previous job-related experience in Central Supply and/or Sterile Processing experience in hospital or clinic setting, preferred.
  • National Certification in Sterile Processing or equivalent, desired

This individual must be a senior student from an accredited radiologic technology program and must present documentation of that status. This individual must be able to operate all routine radiographic equipment in a safe and proficient manner. Must demonstrate knowledge of contrast media injections and reactions. This individual must be able to demonstrate proficiency in operating the PACS computer system.

The incumbent must be able to produce high quality radiographs with a minimum of repeats. Must be able to handle multiple room assignments and all different types of exams on a daily basis. Must be able to communicate with physicians, patients, families, and ancillary hospital personnel.

The incumbent must be able to demonstrate the knowledge and skills necessary to provide care appropriate to the age of the patients served. The individual must demonstrate knowledge of the principles of growth and development over the life span and possess the ability to assess data reflective of the patient's status and interpret the appropriate information needed to identify each patient's requirements relative to his or her age-specific needs, and to provide the care needed as described in the department's competency plan. Will participate in performance improvement initiatives. Will assist with other activities as deemed necessary for the day to day operation of the department.

Clinical Documentation Improvement Supervisor:

The Clinical Documentation Improvement (CDI) Supervisor is responsible for facilitating and coordinating the CDI program across the multi-facility integrated health care delivery system. The CDI Supervisor will work to leverage performance, providing feedback and influence to persistently improve documentation results and impact key performance indicators. The CDI Supervisor will assist in leading continuous improvement in the development and deployment of standard policies and procedures, standardized queries, technologies and tools, and strategies targeted to improve the quality of documentation and overall financial performance. This leader will be accountable for CDI successes as demonstrated through accurate Severity of Illness (SOI) / Risk of Mortality (ROM) capture rates, Complicating or Comorbid Condition (CC) / Major Complicating or Comorbid Condition (MCC) capture rates, Case Mix Index (CMI) analysis, physician query- response rates, and tracking financial variances. The CDI Supervisor will utilize historic and current data to monitor and track performance and trends, and escalate issues in order to advance improvements. The CDI Supervisor will assist in ensuring ICD-10 requirements are met within the CDI program which includes physician education and engagement, and updating any CDI tools utilized within the program. The CDI Supervisor must be able to manage multiple priorities, including concurrent record reviews on assigned units at least 50% of the time, and monitor CDI team, physician training/education, tracking results for senior leadership visibility and other necessary administrative duties 50% of the time. Additional responsibilities: teaching CDI principles and ICD10 concepts to key stakeholders across the organization, working closely with Physician Advisors on escalated cases to ensure that the appropriate documentation is added to the medical record, collaborating with the inpatient Coding team and Clinical Informatics team and their leadership to ensure adherence to established processes, and providing second level reviews of selected cases (with Physician Advisor support).

The Surgical Technician is responsible for assisting the physician in the direct care of the patients in the operating room environment. The surgical technician functions under the supervision of the surgeon and the RN.

Must possess a high school diploma or GED equivalent. Graduate of surgical technology program

Exhibit proficiency in patient care. Excellent oral communication skills. Expertise in the theory and application of sterile and aseptic technique. Knowledge of human anatomy, surgical procedures, and technological tools.

Desirable characteristics include at least one year of experience as a Surgical Tech, preferably in the area of application. Must be able to follow directions and perform work according to department standards under the supervision of an RN. Must be emotionally mature and able to function effectively under stress.

Prefer candidates who possess a current Oklahoma Certificate as a Certified Surgical Technician. Surgical Technicians without certification have (1) one year from date of hire to obtain certification and maintain currency while employed at Hillcrest Hospital South. Must possess current BLS certification upon hire and maintain certification.

We are seeking a detail oriented Insurance Underpayment Recovery Specialist with an outstanding work ethic and sharp analytical skills to join our team. If you have a firm understanding of Payor Contracts and Hospital Reimbursement then this is the perfect opportunity for you.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES

1. Identify and resolve issues associated with claim underpayment.

2. Contact designated insurance carriers to inquire on underpayment.

3. Send appeal letters to insurance carriers.

4. Perform follow up with payors.

5. Research contracts and escalate contract issues.

6. Review Managed Care Contracts and compare against claims to identify discrepancies.

Note: The essential job functions of this position are not limited to the duties listed above.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES

1. Maintain working knowledge of contract management and patient accounting systems

2. Build relationships with facility Finance, Business office and Managed Care Personnel

3. Ability to analyze data to determine corrective actions needed to effectively understand changes required to effectively appeal underpaid amounts

4. Ability to understand payment methodology and guide underpayment recovery specialists to identify and collect underpayments from contracted commercial and governmental payors.

QUALIFICATIONS

Education:

High School Diploma. Degree preferred

Experience:

2+ years experience in insurance collections or underpayment recovery

Understanding of Reimbursement and Hospital Contracts

Detail Oriented Analytical Thinker

Excellent verbal and phone communication skills

Proficient in Microsoft Office

Additional Requirements: Excellent verbal, analytical and interpersonal skills.

We are currently recruiting for a Vice President of Human Resources for Lovelace Health System (LHS) in Albuquerque, NM. Lovelace Health System consists of 6 hospitals, a medical group, 3,700 employees, 606 licensed beds, and $351 million in capital improvements since 2001. Lovelace Health System is owned by Ardent Health Services, a nationwide provider of hospital and healthcare services which owns and operates 14 hospitals serving three major markets.

The Vice President of Human Resources (VP HR) reports directly to the system CEO and oversees all aspects of Human Resources for LHS. This position is a key promoter of strategic priorities which include Quality, People, Service, Growth and Financial with an emphasis on People. Our goal for the strategic priority of People is to attract, engage, develop and retain high performing talent and to achieve LHS's mission. The VP of HR fosters an environment of effective relationships and performance excellence.

Key indicators include:

-Integrity -Mentoring

-Accountability -Recognition

-Others needs above own -Professional development

-Mutual respect -Solicit & act upon feedback

-Conflict resolution

The VP of HR will guide and maintain functional relationships at all levels of HR staff within the organization and will have direct oversight over all of human resources including Organizational Development, Shared Services and the LHS Resource Team. Additionally, this position will have a direct focus on strategic planning and the deployment of strategic initiatives.

Examples of Responsibilities:

-Engage executives to understand talent needs of the businesses and define responses

-Ensure effective use & implementation of enterprise-wide HR & Talent initiatives

-Promote and foster a healthy work environment

-Uphold all compliance standards, including OFCCP, DNV, CMS, Department of Labor, HR policies and

other regulatory requirements

-Build, develop and lead a team of HR professionals within LHS

-Drive effective leader and employee communications initiatives

-Ensure operational excellence, monitoring, and measuring the effectiveness and efficiency of the HR

leaders and teams

-Identify and facilitate use of HR service contractors as needed

-Set consistent compensation practices within LHS

Job Requirements:

Experience:

-Five+ (5+) years HR experience as the lead HR executive reporting to a system or regional CEO in a work

environment reflective of the scope & complexity of the Lovelace Health System

-Other preferred experience profile could included multiple years as a lead HR executive with regional or

national accountability in a healthcare service related organization.

-Bachelors degree in Human Resources Management or related field. Masters degree preferred

-PHR or SPHR certification preferred

Are you looking to join a stable and growing company where you can truly make an impact? Are you a visionary who is inspired by a challenge and will put forth the effort to make it successful? If so, then this is the job and company for you!

We are seeking a true, dynamic leader that understands the importance of developing positive relationships and trust with our 360+ physicians and leadership teams and how to maintain that dynamic within the organization. Someone that can bring their expertise to the business to help create strategies to enhance and grow physician services throughout the organization through creative initiatives. Someone that can develop a plan to better align with independent physicians within all markets. A true leader that can be consulted when it comes to strategies of how to align and integrate the physician practices within the organization while maintaining positive working relationships!

Working at Ardent means changing lives! We know the work we do and the support we give has a direct impact on the happiness of our teams and the consistency, and quality of care our patients receive. We understand that what makes a job exceptional are the relationships you have with the people you work with! This position works closely with the division and physician group leadership in our markets to identify opportunities to enhance the practices. We are looking for someone to coach and motivate teams in both physician groups at the corporate and local levels by collecting data and communicating information in order to maintain the best possible relationships within the organization and throughout the communities we serve.

If creating an impact in a growing company while ensuring a healthy work environment through creative initiatives is something you are interested in, then you have found the right place!

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • To help establish new strategies, opportunities, and options to enhance physician practices throughout the company.
  • Identify and disseminate "best practices" throughout physician practices by working with Division and Corporate operations.
  • Develop and monitor methodologies to evaluate the financial performance and benchmarking of the employed clinical practices.
  • Create standardization across all markets surrounding our EPIC implmentation
  • Identify methodologies to reduce the overall investment in the physician practices (e.g. enhance productivity, improve access, evaluate new models of care, etc.).
  • Assist in the development of quality metrics and benchmarks for all specialists and non-physician practitioners to ensure the provision of safe, high quality care.
  • Assist market leaders in developing company-wide strategy to maximize performance under value-based reimbursement programs.

Education: Bachelors degree in related field required. MBA, MHA, or other related Master's Degree preferred.

Experience: A minimum of seven (7) years experience in healthcare administration.

Additional Requirements:

Background in finance preferred.

Experience in leading Physician Practices preferably healthcare system physician group practices and experience in physician practice support operations.

Under the supervision of the Radiologist and Radiology Director, performs all routine diagnostic and therapeutic radiographic procedures and produces quality images while applying both radiation and physical safety measures.

Strong X-ray background and some CT experience preferred.

Graduate of an accredited two-year Radiologic Technology training program in a school approved by the Council of Medical Education of the AMA. Demonstrate proficiency in all study protocols at facility. Competency in components of Radiography practice as appropriate.

American Registry of Radiologic Technologist (ARRT) required and must maintain a current BLS for Healthcare providers.
